Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Medior Data Analyst - Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.
You are based in or around Amsterdam




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
Hybrid way of working
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Social Insights Specialist (Meltwater Specialist)




London, Amsterdam

6 months FTC




About Us: Fractal is a dynamic and innovative AI company that is committed to delivering cutting-edge solutions to our clients. We are seeking a highly skilled and proactive Data & Insights Specialist with strong communication and presentation skills to support the adoption and strategic use of Meltwater across our brands and business units. This role is critical in enabling teams to extract actionable insights from social and media intelligence, build and maintain a robust media scorecard, and ensure consistent, high-quality reporting across markets.




Responsibilities:




· Meltwater Enablement & Adoption

Act as the go-to expert for Meltwater, supporting onboarding, training, and day-to-day usage across multiple brands and BUs.
Partner with brand teams to embed Meltwater into their workflows and decision-making processes.
Collaborate with the global Meltwater team and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with Unilever’s insights engine strategy.




· Media Scorecard Development

Lead the creation and refinement of a standardized media scorecard to track brand performance, media impact, and consumer sentiment.
Ensure the scorecard is actionable, scalable, and aligned with business KPIs.




· Insights Generation & Reporting

Conduct daily monitoring and analysis of Meltwater dashboards and alerts.
Deliver timely, insightful reports to brand teams, highlighting key trends, risks, and opportunities.
Leverage AI-powered summaries and dashboards to streamline reporting.




· Cross-Functional Collaboration

Work closely with Consumer Market Insights, Communications, Digital, and Marketing teams to ensure insights are integrated into strategic planning.
Support the development of use cases and best practices for Meltwater adoption across markets.




Preffered Qualifications:




Background in FMCG or consumer brands
Experience with AI-enabled reporting tools and dashboarding.
Familiarity with Unilever’s digital ecosystem is a pre, while knowledge of GDT capabilities and tools (e.g., Brand DNAi, Smart Briefing) is a plus




Ideal Candidate Profile:




Proven experience in consumer insights, media intelligence, or social listening roles.
Deep familiarity with Meltwater or similar platforms (e.g., Brandwatch, Talkwalker).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into compelling narratives.
Experience working in a matrixed, multinational organization.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Comfortable working independently and driving initiatives across diverse teams.




Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join a globally respected asset manager's global data operations team. This is a hands-on operations role, ideal for someone who combines analytical knowhow with a service-oriented mindset and enjoys working at the heart of investment data.

You will be responsible for:

Ensuring accurate and timely setup and maintenance of investment data (e.g. securities, pricing, analytics).
Performing business and data analysis to improve daily production and project workflows.
Supporting data operations processes and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.
Collaborating with global teams to maintain consistent and reliable data handoffs.
Monitoring key metrics and escalate issues appropriately.
Deliveringexceptional internal customer service and communication across teams.



Requirements


3+ years' experience in financial services, ideally in data, operations, or analytics.
Strong Excel skills and an understanding of core investment data concepts.
Ability to manage complex data workflows and communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences.
Analytical mindset with the ability to troubleshoot and problem-solve.
Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented approach.
Experience with security master data, pricing, or analytics data is strongly preferred.



Benefits



Initially 6-months contract, with a strong expectation to be extended. Rate to be discussed.

Title: Data Analyst Analytics Platform
Description:
Why Choose Eneco?

The One Planet strategy we are committed to here at Eneco sets an ambitious goal to be climate neutral by 2035. We want to achieve that goal for both us and our clients. To make it happen, we are dedicated to offering our customers innovative digital capabilities and smart solutions. Our team is working towards creating an exceptional online customer experience, through modernizing the Eneco chat, app and web environments. We are striving to deliver a superior digital customer experience that will stimulate and make it easier for our customers to become greener, every day.




What Will You Do?

As a Technical Digital Analyst in our Analytics Platform Team, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across Eneco's business and product teams. We're looking for someone who can proactively support and build on our Digital Analytics foundational infrastructure. You will work closely with stakeholders (e.g. Data Analysts, Product Analysts, Media Specialists, and Product Managers) to deploy, maintain, and optimize analytics solutions (GA4, GTM, GBQ) that support Eneco’s digital transformation.




You Will Be Responsible For

Monitoring, supporting, and maintaining the Digital Analytics foundational infrastructure for Eneco and Oxxio (and other brands on occasion).
Ensuring operational GA4 (configuring, training and supporting colleagues, monitoring) is up to date and running smoothly.
Ensuring operational GTM (client-side and server-side) deployment, optimization, review of workspaces, and tag management is working correctly.
Supporting product and business teams by identifying necessary measurements, reviewing measurement plans, and proposing measurement solutions for our apps, websites and chatbots.
Improving Digital Analytics end-to-end infrastructure.




Is This You?




Must Have:

Strong understanding of digital analytics concepts, (web/app) tracking, and methodologies
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and troubleshooting skills
Proficient in (server-side) GTM, GA4, Firebase, and user feedback and experimentation tools (e.g., GrowthBook, Optimizely, GetFeedback, Hotjar)
Proficient in writing custom JavaScript (for tagging) and SQL (for querying and analysis)
Experience working with online marketing and advertising pixels (e.g., Google Ads, Affiliates)
Strong understanding of privacy-related topics (e.g., GDPR, Telecommunicatiewet, Consent Mode)
Passionate about knowledge sharing (e.g., documentation, training colleagues, workshops)
Basic statistics knowledge for hypothesis testing




Nice to Have:

Knowledge of data modeling using dbt and Snowflake DWH
Good understanding of data visualization (e.g., Power BI and Google Looker Studio)
Familiarity with Azure, Kubernetes, and Docker
Ability to communicate technical topics clearly to non-technical stakeholders
Dutch language skills are a plus




This is Where You Will Work

You will be working collaboratively with other Data Analysts, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists within the Analytics Platform Team. The team is responsible for maintaining and onboarding all digital analytics and experimentation-related tools. Each specialist focuses on their specific area of specialization to enable value streams to reach their objectives without worrying about the foundational tech infrastructure.




For Digital Analytics, you will not be working alone; instead, you can grow and learn alongside the Senior Digital Analyst. Within the team, we foster a culture of learning, actively encourage proactive collaboration, celebrate successes, and use failures as opportunities for growth and improvement.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Level: Mid-level (3+ years)

Function: Data Analyst

Reports to: Project Manager - Business Development

Workload: 0.5 – 1.0 FTE with flexible working hours







Simplifying maintenance and repair has been our mission from day one. We’re shaping the future powered by innovative technology and helping fleet managers to improve their fleet plannable uptime and easy access to capacity and reliable workshops.




Job Summary




The transportation, logistics, and trailer industry are undergoing a transformation. This is a unique opportunity to become part of a brand-new corporate start-up venture where you’ll be shaping data-driven solutions with the shared goal of digitizing logistics fleets and workshops across Europe.

As a Data Analyst at Viamanta, you will turn data into insights that fuel better decisions. You’ll work hands-on with modern cloud technologies to build meaningful dashboards, uncover insights, and contribute to a growing suite of data products that support internal teams and external partners. You will be joining an entrepreneurial team with both corporate and start-up experience, working with high ownership and in a fast-paced environment.

Are you a structured thinker who loves solving real problems with data? Do you enjoy turning complexity into clarity and have an eye for meaningful metrics and actionable insights? Then we are eager to hear from you.




Responsibilities

·      Build and maintain engaging dashboards and reports in Power BI that support data-driven decisions across Viamanta

·      Translate business needs into analytical models, queries, and visualizations

·      Collaborate with stakeholders from management, product, operations, and commercial teams to define and track key performance indicators (KPIs)

·      Use Python and SQL to conduct exploratory data analysis and identify trends, patterns, or anomalies

·      Support data infrastructure and pipeline improvements in close collaboration with product and engineering teams

·      Assist in rolling out analytics capabilities related to CMS and other business system integrations

·      Promote a data-first culture by enabling teams to use our tools, reports, and insights effectively

·      Maintain and improve documentation of data models and analytical processes




Qualifications

·      3+ years of experience in a Data Analyst or equivalent role

·      Bachelor’s degree in a STEM field or business analytics (or equivalent working experience)

·      Advanced Power BI skills for dashboards and visualization

·      Strong SQL and Python programming skills for analysis and transformation

·      Familiarity with cloud platforms, preferably AWS (S3, Glue, Athena, Redshift).

·      Experience working with relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server)

·      Clear communicator with the ability to simplify complex topics for a broad audience

·      Comfortable working in a fast-moving environment and translating it into structured, maintainable solutions

·      Experience with Data Science or Machine Learning projects is a plus

·      Legal authorization to work in the EU




What’s in it for you?

·      Joining a young start-up – your work will directly shape our success and the way we scale and grow

·      A highly competitive salary package

·      Flexible working hours and hybrid collaboration

·      A team culture that values ownership, transparency, and getting things done

·      A real opportunity to help build a digital-first company in a transforming industry




About Viamanta

Viamanta is a B2B SaaS platform on a mission to simplify maintenance and repair. We enable fleet operators and workshops to digitize and automate their maintenance and repair processes. Our platform gives fleet managers better visibility and control over workshop capacity, uptime planning, cost approvals, and operational execution. Meanwhile, workshops benefit from streamlined communication, standard workflows, and improved collaboration with fleet customers.

Headquartered in Amsterdam, we operate across several European markets. We combine deep industry knowledge with modern technology to drive practical improvements in efficiency, uptime, and cost control for our partners.

The transportation and logistics industry is undergoing a transformation. At Viamanta, you will be part of that change – working on real problems, with real customers, and making a tangible impact on the way Europe’s fleets and workshops operate.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Fintech – Utrecht




Are you interested in working with huge financial datasets? And are you interested in translating this to the business in order to make the landscape more data-driven? Read on!




Keywords: Python, SQL, Azure, PowerBI




Our client is a dominant financial institution in the Netherlands, covering components in insurance, mortgages, and investments. The company is in full transformation, becoming a financial institution of the future – part of this transformation is the migration of all services/applications to the public cloud.




They are looking for a data analyst who will analyze data from financial sources like pensions, mortgages, and investments. All this data needs to be cleaned and translated to the business through dashboards.




If you are someone with a technical background that also likes to see the bigger picture of how data can be used in a big fintech organization, you are at the right place. They are looking for someone that also likes to challenge and interact with business stakeholders.




Required skills:

At least 8+ years of professional experience and extensive experience in data analytics.
Experience with SQL.
Experience with cloud and tools like PowerBI is a plus.
Strong communication skills in either Dutch or English.




Benefits:

Up to 80K base salary including holiday allowance based on 38 hours.
13th month.
VISA sponsorship.
3% salary raise yearly if that fits the scale.
Pension scheme.
Healthcare insurance contribution.
Insurance discounts.
Participating in employee share plan.
Working from home allowance.
Trainings.
Travel reimbursement / NS Business Card.
Partly paid sabbatical every 5 years.
Hybrid setup – 2 days office.




Focus is on candidates in the Netherlands.




Interested? Please contact me at mette@doghouse-recruitment.nl

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the job




Are you passionate about using data to make a real-world impact in cyber security? As a Data Analyst you won’t just analyze data, you’ll also help safeguard the digital backbone of one of the Netherlands' leading financial organizations. You'll uncover opportunities, flag security issues, and translate complex data into clear strategies and visual stories that drive action.




What you’ll do




• Detect potential security threats and vulnerabilities

• Analyze data to derive insights

• Craft strategies to mitigate risks







Your Expertise




We’re looking for a data-driven thinker who thrives in complexity and knows how to turn data into insight and insight into action. You’re a team player with strong communication skills and technical know-how, ready to contribute to an evolving security landscape.




You’ll bring




• A Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a data-related field.

• At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst.

• A sharp analytical mind with a proactive, problem-solving attitude.

• Proficiency in Power BI (including Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service).

• PL-300 certification (or willingness to obtain it)

• Comfort working with SQL, Databricks, and Azure (preferred).

• Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.




Bonus if you have




• Domain knowledge in cybersecurity (e.g. identity and access management, cybercrime, risk mitigation).

• Familiarity with Agile-Scrum methodologies.







What to Expect




• An environment that values cooperation, creativity, and data excellence.

• Opportunities to work on meaningful challenges

• Competitive salary between €5.800 to €6.250 gross per month, based on 40hr per week

• 25 vacation days

About the job


Are you passionate about using data to make a real-world impact in cyber security? As a Data Analyst you won’t just analyze data, you’ll also help safeguard the digital backbone of one of the Netherlands' leading financial organizations. You'll uncover opportunities, flag security issues, and translate complex data into clear strategies and visual stories that drive action.


What you’ll do


• Detect potential security threats and vulnerabilities

• Analyze data to derive insights

• Craft strategies to mitigate risks



Your Expertise


We’re looking for a data-driven thinker who thrives in complexity and knows how to turn data into insight and insight into action. You’re a team player with strong communication skills and technical know-how, ready to contribute to an evolving security landscape.


You’ll bring


• A Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a data-related field.

• At least 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst.

• A sharp analytical mind with a proactive, problem-solving attitude.

• Proficiency in Power BI (including Power Query, DAX, Power BI Service).

• PL-300 certification (or willingness to obtain it)

• Comfort working with SQL, Databricks, and Azure (preferred).

• Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills.


Bonus if you have


• Domain knowledge in cybersecurity (e.g. identity and access management, cybercrime, risk mitigation).

• Familiarity with Agile-Scrum methodologies.

• An environment that values cooperation, creativity, and data excellence.

Title: Data Analyst Analytics Platform
Description:
Why Choose Eneco?

At Eneco, we're on a mission to be climate neutral by 2035 — not just for ourselves, but for all our customers. Digital innovation plays a key role in achieving this, and our Analytics Platform team is at the heart of that effort. We aim to empower the organization to become truly data- and metric-driven, helping teams measure their impact through actionable KPIs, integrated into our OKR framework.

To support this, we're looking for a Data Analyst who’s passionate about enabling data-informed decisions across the business. While Power BI is our current visualization platform, we're focused on future-proofing our data landscape and are exploring more scalable and code-first analytics solutions. This is an opportunity to help shape that evolution.




What Will You Do?

As a Data Analyst in the Analytics Platform Team, you will be a key enabler of data-driven decision-making across Eneco and Oxxio. Your role goes beyond dashboards, you will help us drive consistency and clarity in how we measure business outcomes and create reusable, scalable analytics capabilities.




While you will support our existing Power BI infrastructure, your focus will be on building a future-ready analytics environment. You’ll work closely with data professionals, product teams, and business stakeholders to align metrics to our OKRs, improve accessibility to trusted insights, and make sure analytics tools and processes evolve alongside our ambitions.




You Will Be Responsible For:

Enabling the organization to become more metric- and KPI-driven by building robust, scalable analytics solutions.
Supporting the governance and improvement of our current visualization toolset (e.g., workspace structure, permissions, deployment).
Collaborating with IT and other teams to align visualization tools with broader data infrastructure.
Designing and maintaining centralized data models and reporting templates that promote reuse and consistency.
Driving continuous improvement by integrating experimentation methods (e.g., A/B testing) into Power BI-based analytics workflows.
Supporting the rollout of analytics capabilities and best practices across teams through training, documentation, and workshops.
Contributing to the future direction of our analytics platform — including the exploration of BI-as-code or alternative visualization tools.




Is This You?




Must Have:

Strong analytical skills and a structured approach to building KPI- and OKR-driven reporting.
Experience using Power BI in a professional environment.
Understanding of data modeling and performance optimization for analytics products.
Experience in supporting and enabling others with reporting and data literacy.
Solid communication skills, able to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders




Nice to Have:

Experience with Power BI system administration and governance.
Experience with Azure (Data Lake, Synapse) and/or Snowflake.
Familiarity with dbt or similar data modeling tools.
Understanding of CI/CD and automation for BI tools (e.g., PowerShell, REST APIs).
Experience with other BI tools or BI-as-code environments.
Experience in Agile/Scrum/Kanban settings.
Dutch language skills.




This Is Where You’ll Work

You’ll be part of the Analytics Platform team. Working closely with data engineers, analysts, and scientists who build and maintain foundational capabilities for the entire Eneco organization. The team ensures consistency in tooling and best practices while fostering a strong learning culture.

You’ll also be part of the broader Eneco Data & Analytics community, where we support each other’s growth and collaborate across value streams to create business impact.




Who We’re Looking For

A forward-looking Data Analyst who sees tools like Power BI as enablers — not end goals.
Someone who wants to help Eneco evolve toward a mature, scalable, and metrics-focused analytics practice.
A team player who enjoys empowering others and contributing to an enterprise-wide transformation.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Data Analyst


As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Clients, I am seeking for a Data Analyst for a position in Amsterdam, Netherlands. As a Data Analyst for our Operations BI Product Team you will have a large scope and wide stakeholder landscape to keep you always learning something new about airport operations. You will help your stakeholders to fine tune existing KPIs or explore new ones, and align definitions against the vast datasets at your disposal. You will be in the frontline of creating tangible intelligence that will be used in decision making by colleagues ranging from management to those in critical operational roles.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Join the key Business Intelligence team dedicated to support our stakeholders in the Operations Domain with accurate actionable performance dashboards and insights;
  • Understand the business and the potential to optimize their processes and help formulating the most relevant business and analysis questions;
  • Define meaningful KPIs together with business stakeholders and perform data analyses to translate these functional definitions into precise logic and calculations;
  • Explore, assess and validate the data quality and usability of existing and new datasets;
  • Ensure consistent interpretation of KPIs across different stakeholder groups by formalizing and documenting definitions;
  • Act as a bridge between business requirements and BI development (back-end and front-end) to ensure alignment between requirements and end results.


Key Requirements:

  • 3+ years of working in a data team, with meaningful experience in data analytics. Aviation-related experience is a big plus;
  • HBO-level education in engineering, econometrics, sciences, business analytics, or related with a strong quantitative component;
  • Experience in translating business requirements to data products, insights and KPIs;
  • Ability to tell compelling stories with data and present outcomes effectively to stakeholders;
  • Comfortable participating in Agile ceremonies and adhering to Scrum processes;
  • Proficiency in analytical tools and programming languages, particularly Python and relevant libraries such as Pandas, Pyspark and Plotly or Matplotlib. - Knowledge of Streamlit is a plus;
  • Experience working in PowerBI, and familiar with related concepts such as semantic models and DAX;
  • Knowledge of Collibra is a plus;
  • Excellent communication skills, including fluency in Dutch and a good working level of English is required.


Contract: 6+ months

Rates: Excellent

Location: Amsterdam

Hours: 32 hours/week

Interview: 2 stages, 1 technical + 1 assessment


Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

- Ability to tell compelling stories with data and present outcomes effectively to stakeholders;

- Comfortable participating in Agile ceremonies and adherence to Scrum processes;

- Proficiency in analytical tools and programming languages, particularly Python and relevant libraries such as Pandas, Pyspark and Plotly or Matplotlib. - Knowledge of Streamlit is a plus;

- Knowledge of Collibra is a plus;

Title: Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert
Description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.

Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert

6 month FTC

Location: Eindhoven (onsite 3 days per week)

Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.

About The Role

As a Data Analyst / Data Visualization Expert you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets and creating compelling visuals that communicate insights effectively to various stakeholders. Your role will involve both rigorous data analysis and the design of clear, precise, and engaging visualizations.

Key Responsibilities


Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and patterns within datasets.
Develop impactful data visualizations using tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense, Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Ensure data integrity and quality by continuously auditing and cleansing data.
Work alongside cross-departmental teams to integrate data-driven insights into business strategies.
Provide technical guidance on best practices for data visualization and data storytelling.
Stay informed about the latest trends and techniques in data visualization and analytics.



Qualifications


Bachelor's/Master degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in data analysis and data visualization.
Proficient in using data visualization tools such as QuickSight, QlikSense,Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex data insights in a simple and impactful way.
Demonstrated ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team environment.
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Experience with dashboard design and data storytelling.
Preferred: Java engineering experience for data processing and system integration tasks.



If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!

Not the right fit? Let us know you're interested in a future opportunity by clicking Introduce Yourself in the top-right corner of the page or create an account to set up email alerts as new job postings become available that meet your interest!

Title: Research & Insights Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We Are Social is a global socially-led creative agency with unrivalled social media expertise. With over 15 offices worldwide, we deliver a global perspective to our clients in a time when social media is shaping culture. We Are Social Amsterdam has been a hub for innovative, impactful creative campaigns driven by cultural and social insights since 2021.

At We Are Social, we foster a culture of creativity, collaboration, and adaptability. Our team thrives on pushing boundaries, exploring bold ideas, and delivering work that makes a meaningful impact for leading global brands.

The Opportunity

Are you passionate about managing research projects and delivering compelling, actionable insights?

Do you have a proactive and solution-oriented approach to data?

Are you skilled at designing and implementing research methodologies tailored to specific needs?

We are looking for a Research & Insight Analyst for We Are Social Amsterdam to manage end-to-end research projects, including design, setup, execution and presentation. You will work closely with internal teams and clients to recommend suitable research solutions and ensure the quality of deliverables.

Requirements

What You'll Have Delivered Elsewhere


Managed research projects, including design, setup, workflow, and resource management.
Mastered research and analytical skills at an advanced level.
Designed and implemented research methodologies tailored to specific needs and contexts.
Stayed updated on platform-specific metrics and changes in the social and digital landscape.
Utilized analytical tools, such as social listening, performance measurement tools, and databases.
Presented and explained findings effectively to diverse audiences, including clients and internal stakeholders.
Developed compelling storytelling based on research insights.
Provided actionable recommendations aligned with business goals.


What Else Are We Looking For?


Experience: 3+ years of experience in research, data analysis, or a similar field, preferably within an agency environment.
Advanced knowledge of social listening tools (eg. Brandwatch), and ideally digital research platforms (eg. GWI)
Passion for the digital world and familiarity with key social networks, such as Instagram, Facebook, X, TikTok, Twitch, YouTube, and Discord.
Proven ability to extract insights from raw aggregated data.
Strong knowledge of Google Workspace tools (Docs, Sheets, Slides) as well as Excel and PowerPoint for data analysis and presentations.
A keen eye for detail.
Demonstrates a proactive approach to identifying and exploring new data sources and research methodologies to uncover actionable insights.
Ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.


Benefits

Life at We Are Social Amsterdam

We Are Social Amsterdam Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. We Celebrate Diversity And Inclusion, Ensuring That Everyone Feels Valued And Empowered To Contribute To Our Shared Success. We Offer


Career Path Design: Regular reviews and mentorship to support professional growth.
WAS Passport: Opportunity to work for two weeks per year in any of our global network offices.
Training Programs: Access to professional development initiatives and creative workshops.
Diversity and Wellbeing: Participate in mental health, CSR, and diversity & inclusion activities.
Flexible Working: Up to three remote working days per week.


If this all sounds like the place you have been waiting to find then apply now! What are you waiting for?

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Founded in 1999 and listed on NASDAQ in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group is a leading global travel service provider comprising of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar.




Across its platforms, Trip.com Group integrates travel resources from industry partners and helps travellers worldwide pursue the perfect trip with exceptional travel products and services.




We have four Customer Service Centres for Trip.com established in Japan, Korea, the UK, and the Philippines, providing 24/7 customer service in 19 different languages.




We have more than 30,000 employees scattered across 30 countries in Asia, Europe, the Americas, and Oceania, striving to expand our global markets and aiming to be the world’s leading and most trusted family of online travel brands that aspire to deliver the perfect trip at the best price for every traveller.




As a Marketing Data Analyst in our Partnerships and Affiliate Marketing team, you will play a critical role in supporting the success of our affiliate programs and partnerships. We are looking for someone who takes initiative, actively seeks out opportunities for improvement, and is eager to contribute to our team’s success.




In this Role, you’ll get to:

Monitor and Analyse Performance: Track key performance indicators (KPIs) across various channels, identifying trends, and communicating to the team any anomalies, and opportunities for optimisation.
Generate Insights for Campaign Optimisation: Assist in analysing data to provide insights that help improve campaign performance, ROI, and overall marketing effectiveness.
Develop and Maintain Dashboards: Contribute to the creation and maintenance of dashboards that provide real-time insights into program performance, making it easy for stakeholders to understand key metrics and trends.
Support Partnership Strategies: Work with business developers and learn about the effectiveness of different partnerships, contributing data-driven recommendations for future collaborations.
Take Initiative in Problem-Solving: Proactively identify issues or opportunities for optimisation and develop strategies that improve overall performance.
Collaborate Internationally: Work alongside marketing teams based in Shanghai and other global locations, ensuring that efforts align with broader marketing strategies and global business goals.
Assist in Conducting Experiments: Support the design and analysis of experiments to test new strategies, creatives, or partnership models, contributing to data-driven decisions.




What you'll Need to Succeed:

Strong Analytical Skills: Ability to interpret data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to translate data findings into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Basic SQL Knowledge: Familiarity with SQL for querying and managing datasets is preferred, with a willingness to develop these skills further.
Experience with Data Analysis Tools: Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets, including functions, data manipulation, and pivot tables. Experience with tools like Python, R, or BigQuery is a plus, offering opportunities to engage in more complex data analysis and automation.
Basic Data Visualisation Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimisation. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.




Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?




Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
We encourage flexible work arrangement.
Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.




Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?




Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!




Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com




Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Show more

  • Basic Data Visualisation Experience: Familiarity with tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar for creating dashboards and visual reports, with opportunities to develop proficiency.
  • Interest in Partnerships and Affiliates: A strong curiosity and willingness to learn about affiliate marketing and partnership strategies, and how different factors affect our KPIs.
  • Proactive, Collaborative, and Solution-Oriented: A self-starter who takes initiative in identifying opportunities for improvement and optimisation. You enjoy developing solutions and contributing to projects, while also working collaboratively with cross-functional teams across different regions to achieve shared goals.


Why Trip.com Group

We offer a stage to unleash your full potential and drive global impact. As an international team, we embrace an open and inclusive culture that supports and respect team members in and out of the workplace. Everyone is on a trip, whether it's a career trip or a life trip. At Trip.com Group, you can define your own trip by setting a goal and celebrate your success by recognizing the progress you have made.

What’s more?


  • Our rapid business growth in global offers abundant career opportunities at various levels and in multiple functions
  • Internal transfer is encouraged, and global job rotation program enable you to pursue a global career path and make global impact
  • We provide learning opportunities to further your career in areas of leadership capability, soft skill and professional expertise.
  • We encourage flexible work arrangement.
  • Have fun with company-sponsored greetings and activities at holidays, birthdays, and colorful team events.


Click the link to learn more about What makes Trip.com Group a leading global travel service provider?


Click the link to learn more about This is a Trip Where Both Your Career and Life Can Flourish!


Find out more job opportunities at https://careers.trip.com


Have a good trip, and see you soon!

Title: Data Analist
HTML:
Als Data Analyst bij DHL eCommerce ben jij de sleutel tot het onderhouden, uitbreiden, rapporteren en analyseren van onze operationele (stuur)informatie. Je zorgt ervoor dat onze informatie altijd accuraat en up-to-date is, zodat we de beste service kunnen bieden aan onze klanten. In een dynamisch netwerk houd je de ontwikkelingen scherp in de gaten, bijvoorbeeld door het begeleiden van aanpassingen in de businesslogica naar aanleiding van wijzigingen in pakketroutes. Je begeleidt de implementatie van nieuwe logicaschema’s door IT. Samen met stakeholders vanuit Operations en Sales breng je nieuwe netwerken in kaart en zorg je ervoor dat deze goed worden geïntegreerd in onze rapportages.


Je rapporteert de informatie die is opgeslagen op het DHL-dataplatform via Microsoft Power BI. Bij complexe vraagstukken bied je ondersteuning en advies en voer je analyses uit in Power BI of Excel om de efficiëntie van onze operaties te verbeteren. Jouw inzichten maken het verschil in onze logistieke processen!


Jouw nieuwe werkplek

Je komt te werken op het hoofdkantoor van DHL e-Commerce in Utrecht. Hier maak je deel uit van een jong en dynamisch team van Data Analysts binnen ons Operations-team. We stimuleren samenwerking en innovatie en luisteren altijd naar jouw ideeën en feedback. Bij DHL e-Commerce hechten we veel waarde aan een inclusieve en ondersteunende werkcultuur, waar iedereen de kans krijgt om te groeien en zich te ontwikkelen.


Dit ben jij

Je hebt ervaring met Microsoft Power BI en Excel en beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden op hbo- of wo-niveau. Communicatieve vaardigheden zijn essentieel, omdat je regelmatig overleg hebt met stakeholders. Je bent probleemoplossend ingesteld en kunt goed samenwerken met IT-teams en andere afdelingen. Daarnaast ben je leergierig en bereid om nieuwe inzichten te verwerven om onze processen te verbeteren.


Dit krijg jij

  • Een salaris tussen de €3700 - €4000 bruto op basis van 40 uur, gebaseerd op je kennis en ervaring;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van €0,23 per kilometer, met een maximum tot 30 km enkele reis;
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Standaard 23 vakantiedagen en 8% vakantiegeld;
  • Cao à la carte: een budget dat je kan inzetten voor extra vakantiedagen of salaris;
  • Een laptop en telefoon van de zaak;
  • Opleidings- en trainingsmogelijkheden vanaf dag één;
  • Mooie doorgroeikansen binnen de organisatie;
  • De mogelijkheid tot hybride werken.


De toekomst van bezorgen is geel-rood

DHL eCommerce is het meest toonaangevende logistiekbedrijf ter wereld. Dat klinkt misschien opschepperig, maar zo bedoelen we het niet: we zien het namelijk niet als een verdienste, maar als een verantwoordelijkheid. Dankzij onze positie kunnen we het verschil maken voor onze mensen, het milieu en de maatschappij. En dat blijkt: we zijn een Great Place to Work, Top Employer 2025 en helpen via DHL Cares ontzettend veel mensen die dat hard kunnen gebruiken – daar zijn we trots op!


Solliciteren?

Solliciteer dan nu met je cv en eventueel een motivatiebrief. Heb je vragen over de vacature of wil je meer informatie? Aarzel dan niet om contact op te nemen met Eva Hazes, Corporate Recruiter, via eva.hazes@dhl.com. We kijken ernaar uit om van je te horen!


Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Gezocht: Senior Data / Business Analist | Utrecht | Salaris tot € 90K




Tech: Azure | Data Vault | SQL | Python




Voor een toonaangevende organisatie in financiële producten, zoals verzekeringen, pensioenen en hypotheken, zijn we op zoek naar een ervaren Senior Data- Business Analist. Deze marktleider, die bekend staat om zijn sterke focus op duurzaamheid, bevindt zich momenteel in een complexe migratieperiode na de overname van een grote concurrent.




Als Senior Data- Business Analist maak je deel uit van het data-klantcontactteam, waar je verantwoordelijk bent voor het ophalen van business requirements en het vertalen hiervan naar Features/EPICS en User Stories. Je zorgt voor de automatisering van bedrijfsprocessen en bent op de hoogte van de lopende processen aan zowel de data engineering- als de businesskant.




Wij zoeken een kandidaat met:

Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als Business Analist.
Meerdere jaren ervaring in een rol als data engineering of data-analyse met tools als SQL, Python, Data Vault en PowerBI
Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands.
Ervaring met SCRUM/Agile werken.




We komen graag met je in contact als je het leuk vindt om vanuit een technische data-achtergrond bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en de spin in het web te zijn tussen Data Engineers en Business Stakeholders. Solliciteer via nielsv@doghouse-recruitment.nl of via de "Nu solliciteren" button.




Salaris: Tot € 90K

Locatie: Utrecht (hybride)

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst / Data Engineer

Location: Amsterdam, Netherlands (Onsite only)

Language Requirement: Dutch (mandatory)

Rate: €350-400/day

Invoicing: ZZP only

Experience: 8–10 years




Role Description:

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst / Data Engineer who can work closely with Business Analysts to query, analyze, and integrate data from multiple databases. The ideal candidate has strong data manipulation skills, basic Python knowledge, and the ability to visualize and validate data insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Write and optimize complex queries across various databases
Analyze and combine data from multiple sources to identify inconsistencies, missing data, and integration opportunities
Collaborate with Business Analysts to understand domain-specific knowledge
Prepare sample datasets, manipulate data using Python, and create visualizations with business users
Validate visualizations for accuracy and business relevance
Provide data to analysts for dashboard creation in Power BI




Essential Skills:

Strong database querying and data integration experience
Python (basic to intermediate)
Data visualization and validation skills
Ability to work full-time onsite in Amsterdam
Fluent Dutch speaker




Desirable Skills:

Power BI
SQL and DBT
GCP (Google Cloud Platform)
Fast learner with strong analytical and communication skills

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst / Developer – Dutch Speaking




Are you a data-savvy problem solver who loves turning raw data into insights? We’re hiring a Data Analyst/Developer to work onsite with a major consultancy client in Amsterdam.




In this role, you’ll query complex databases, blend data from multiple sources, and collaborate closely with business analysts and stakeholders to validate insights, build visualizations, and uncover opportunities for smarter decision-making.




Key Responsibilities:

Query and analyze complex datasets across multiple databases
Identify missing data, inconsistencies, and opportunities to join datasets
Work directly with business analysts to gather domain knowledge
Use Python to manipulate, clean, and prepare data for visualization
Create graphs and visualizations with users, then validate them
Provide clean, structured datasets to support Power BI dashboards

Must-Have Skills:

8–10 years of experience in data analysis or similar roles
Strong SQL skills and hands-on experience querying large datasets
Python (data manipulation and visualization)
Dutch fluency is mandatory
Comfortable working fully onsite in Amsterdam




Nice to Have:

Experience with Power BI, DBT, GCP, or other data platforms
Analytical mindset and strong communication skills
Quick learner, comfortable working cross-functionally




Interested? Let’s talk.




If this sounds like you (or someone in your network), drop me a message to learn more - interviews are moving quickly.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Overview

Crocs is seeking an experienced Data Engineer to design, implement, and maintain scalable data pipelines, decoupled data infrastructure, dynamic transformations and comprehensive orchestration layer using a combination of Snowflake, DBT, PySpark, Airflow, Azure Data Lake, GitHub, and other tools as needed.

In this role, you will solve unique and complex problems at a rapid pace, utilizing the latest technologies to create solutions that are highly scalable. As part of Enterprise Data Platform team, you will help advance the adoption of data-driven insights and advanced AI analytics across multiple business domains within Crocs enterprise.

What You'll Do


Data Modeling – Design, implement, and maintain scalable data models that support the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) and analytical workloads following best practices and restrictions imposed by respective technologies.
ETL/ELT – design and implement efficient, scalable and easy-to-manage data movement processes supporting both batch and near-real-time data streams.
CI/CD – automate code integration, testing, and deployment using Git to ensure fast, reliable, and consistent delivery of data pipelines and ETL code.
Engineering Best Practices – Adhere to engineering standard methodologies, including test-driven development, agile management, and continuous integration pipelines.
Documentation – Create and maintain accurate and complete documentation of the pipelines developed.
Interest in Learning – Stay ahead of what is happening within the BI and analytics space and demonstrate interest and desire in data science and machine learning.


What You'll Bring to the Table


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, mathematics, or equivalent technical degree.
3+ years in Data Engineering roles.
1+ years of direct development in Snowflake.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Python and PySpark.
Solid experience utilizing Git version control in a data environment.
Experience designing data models best practices.
Experience working with/in GitHub, GitActions.
Proficiency in Apache Airflow, preferred.
Experience working with DBT, preferred.
Snowflake certifications, preferred.
Prior experience working in Azure cloud platform, preferred.


The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability, or any other protected classification.

Job Category: Corporate

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who Are We

At Coinmerce, a Dutch-founded European cryptocurrency company, we’re on a mission to make crypto simple, secure, and accessible for everyone—whether individuals or professionals. As a registered crypto broker with De Nederlandsche Bank, we serve customers in over 10 European countries, with plans for global expansion. Transparency is key to everything we do, and our open-door culture at our Schiphol-Rijk office reflects that. With a talented and motivated team, we’re shaping the future of the crypto space—and we want you to be a part of it.

About The Role

The Coinmerce group is growing, and we’re looking for a skilled Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you’ll help shape our product and strategic decisions by transforming complex data into actionable insights. You’ll support multiple teams (like Marketing, Product, and Finance), provide dashboards, reports, and predictive models, and act as a go-to expert for anything data-driven. If you love working with data to uncover trends, optimize processes, and guide strategic decisions, this is the role for you.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, validate, and organize data from various sources to ensure reliability and accuracy.
Analyze datasets to identify patterns, trends, and actionable insights.
Create detailed reports and visually compelling dashboards to communicate findings.
Collaborate closely with internal departments (including Marketing, Finance, and Product) to address data-related questions and deliver data-driven recommendations.
Develop and implement predictive models for forecasting, segmentation, or risk analysis.
Continuously monitor and improve data quality and analysis processes.
Translate business needs into data solutions and support stakeholders in making informed decisions.


What You Bring


A proactive mindset with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
HBO or WO level of education in Data Science, Statistics, Finance, Business Economics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in a similar data analysis role.
Strong skills in SQL in BigQuery (essential), MySQL, and PostgreSQL.
Experience with visualization tools. Looker is a strong plus.
Experience with Python is a strong plus.
Familiarity with marketing analytics and an affinity for crypto and finance.
Experience with predictive analytics or machine learning models is a bonus.
Excellent communication skills in English. Dutch is a plus.
Show more

Title: Treasury Data Analytics Internship
Description:
Company Description

At JDE Peet's (before: JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS), we're not just about Coffee or Tea; we're all about the moments and connections they spark. With a history spanning 270 years, we've been shaping the daily rituals of people worldwide, driven by our dedication to quality products and sustainability.

We are action-driven and deliver our commitments. This means the freedom to challenge the status quo and to look for different perspectives. Our teams work by four fundamental values: We are progressive in outlook, ambitious in nature, resourceful in action and decisive in approach. These values paint the best picture of the kind of fast-moving culture you'll join at JDE Peet's.

Job Description

Join us as Global Treasury Data Analytics Intern at our international headquarters in Amsterdam, starting in September 2025. In this internship, you will support the Global Treasury Front Office in managing cash and risk, and assist the digital transformation of Treasury data analytics and automation.

Your Key Activities Will Be


Support global liquidity and cash management initiatives,
Analyse cash balances and FX exposures to identify risks and propose mitigation actions,
Create and maintain custom BI dashboards using PowerBI and Databricks,
Perform ad hoc data analysis to support decision-making and strategic planning,
Support process automation using PowerAutomate and other digital tools,
Monitor and ensure data quality in Treasury reporting systems


Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our Global Treasury team, where you'll gain valuable insights into corporate finance operations and data-driven treasury optimization.

What's in it for you?


A monthly internship allowance of €525 (full-time),
Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card,
Paid holidays for each internship term,
Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA),
The chance to learn from the best finance, treasury and data analytics professionals out there!


Qualifications

Are you bursting with fresh ideas and a hunger for learning? We want you!

Here's What We're Looking For


Academic Program: You are enrolled in a MSc program for the entirety of the internship, preferably in Finance, Business Analytics, Econometrics, Data Science, or Statistics,
Skillset: You are fluent in Excel, including functions like VLOOKUP, INDEX-MATCH, and SUM-IFs. Experience in BI tools, coding/scripting, and data visualization is a strong advantage,
Personal traits: You have a strong analytical mindset, are a team player, and are eager to work in a fast-paced, international environment,
Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 5 to 6 months to this internship, preferably from September 2025 to February/March 2026,
Availability: You can join the internship for 4 to 5 days per week, including at least three days in-office and one to two days working remotely


As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:


Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results,
Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's,
You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship


Additional Information

Are you ready to Unleash Your Possibility within JDE Peet's?

Here's How To Apply


Upload your resume (in English) using our LinkedIn or career site application form,
After applying, we'll reach out within three weeks to let you know what's next,
During the application process, you'll be asked to do an online assessment and at least one interview at our Amsterdam office


If you have questions, don't hesitate to contact our Campus team at IHQinternships@jdecoffee.com — We're here to help!

Title: Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 



With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.





Job Description



As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.



You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.



What you will do



Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.



Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.



Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.



Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.



Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.



Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.



Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.



Within Sia, you will



Contribute to enhancing Sia’s Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.



Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).



Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.





Qualifications



About You



You bring:



A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.



0–3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.



Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.



Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.



Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.



Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.



Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.



Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.



Your technical toolkit:



Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.



Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.



Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.



Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.







Why Join Us?



Tailored career development with ongoing training in analytics, AI, and consulting skills.



Project diversity: Collaborate on high-impact assignments across sectors and geographies.



Flexibility: Hybrid work model combining office, remote, and client-based work.



Attractive compensation package including annual raises, bonuses, and personalized mobility options.



Global network: Be part of a vibrant international consulting community with thought leaders in AI and analytics.





Additional Information



Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.



Sia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs.











Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Sia is a next-generation, global management consulting group. Founded in 1999, we were born digital. Today our strategy and management capabilities are augmented by data science, enhanced by creativity and driven by responsibility. We’re optimists for change and we help clients initiate, navigate and benefit from transformation. We believe optimism is a force multiplier, helping clients to mitigate downside and maximize opportunity. 

With expertise across a broad range of sectors and services, our 3,000 consultants serve clients worldwide from 48 locations in 19 countries. Our expertise delivers results. Our optimism transforms outcomes.



Job Description

As a Data Analytics Consultant, you will be at the heart of delivering impactful data-driven strategies to our clients. You will collaborate closely with local and international clients to bridge the gap between business objectives and technical execution.

You will help deliver actionable data-driven solutions & insights, and present the results in an interactive, easily understandable manner.

What you will do

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define business goals and shape solution blueprints through workshops and mock-ups.

  • Prepare and validate data by mapping, extracting, cleaning, enriching, and performing feature engineering to establish stable datasets for analysis.

  • Design, implement, and automate interactive dashboards and customized reports that cater to specific client requirements using advanced visualization tools.

  • Conduct comprehensive statistical analysis and exploratory data investigations to extract actionable insights supporting decision-making.

  • Translate complex technical and analytical findings into clear, understandable presentations for non-technical stakeholders.

  • Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, applying innovative approaches to enhance service offerings.

  • Provide guidance and support to business users and team members in leveraging data effectively, contributing to a data-driven culture and continuous learning.

Within Sia, you will

  • Contribute to enhancing Sia’s Data Science and Generative AI offerings through internal training sessions, working groups, and publications.

  • Represent Sia at professional events, actively contributing to thought leadership (articles, white papers, webinars).

  • Support business development by crafting proposals/offers, identifying collaboration opportunities, and nurturing long-term client relationships.



Qualifications

About You

You bring:

  • A Master's degree in Business, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.

  • 0–3 years of experience in data analytics or a relevant consulting or industry role.

  • Fluency in Dutch or French, and English.

  • Strategic thinking with strong analytical skills and a proactive approach.

  • Experience in clearly communicating and presenting complex ideas to varied audiences.

  • Efficient collaboration with various stakeholders, internally and externally, to gather requirements and support data-driven decisions.

  • Eagerness to work alongside and learn from more experienced colleagues while contributing fresh ideas to team projects.

  • Interest in applying innovative analytics and AI solutions to drive sustainability and create meaningful business impact.

Your technical toolkit:

  • Hands-on experience with Python or R for data analysis.

  • Proficiency with SQL and Microsoft Excel for data manipulation.

  • Familiarity with dashboarding tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Looker.

  • Knowledge of cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) is a strong plus.



Why Join Us?

  • Tailored career development with ongoing training in analytics, AI, and consulting skills.

  • Project diversity: Collaborate on high-impact assignments across sectors and geographies.

  • Flexibility: Hybrid work model combining office, remote, and client-based work.

  • Attractive compensation package including annual raises, bonuses, and personalized mobility options.

  • Global network: Be part of a vibrant international consulting community with thought leaders in AI and analytics.



Additional Information

Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a work permit for this position.

Sia is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or disciplinary actions, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, and business needs.





Sia is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Junior Data-analist
Description:
Geodata Beheerder / Data Analist – Lokale overheid




Ben jij analytisch sterk, technisch vaardig en zie jij data als dé sleutel tot slimme oplossingen in de publieke sector? Voor meerdere gemeentes zowel binnen als buiten de randstad zoekt The Trainee Company data talent die aan de slag willen als Junior Geodata Beheerder / Data Analist die klaar is om impact te maken met geografische informatie.




Wat kan je verwachten?

Als Geodata Beheerder / Data Analist werk je binnen een team van analisten aan het beheren én verrijken van geografische data binnen de wettelijke basisregistraties zoals BAG, BGT en BOR. Je zorgt dat data klopt, structuur krijgt én inzichten geeft voor beleidsmakers, bewoners en collega’s.

Je pakt zelfstandig projecten op waarin je data niet alleen beheert en analyseert, maar ook visueel maakt via dashboards door middel van het gebruik van bijvoorbeeld Power BI of Tableau.

Voorbeelden van projecten zijn: Het in kaart brengen van Parken & speeltuinen ten opzichte van het aantal huishoudens binnen een gemeente, een goed overzicht maken van verkeerspleinen/kruispunten in combinatie met gemelde ongevallen of het aantal parkeerplaatsen per wijk in kaart brengen ten opzichte van het aantal voertuigen die aldaar op naam van inwoners staan.

Je leert naast dit alles ook te werken met Geografische informatiesystemen al QGIS of ArcGis en denkt actief mee over hoe geografische data waarde kan toevoegen aan de stad en keuzes voor naar de toekomst toe.




Dit bieden wij jou

Een flitsende start van jouw carrière in Data & Analytics
Bij ons draait alles om jouw persoonlijke groei. We staan je met één-op-één begeleiding bij gedurende het hele traject
Een startsalaris tussen de €2600-€2800 dat past bij jouw ervaringsniveau
Na een jaar bieden we je, op basis van een evaluatieproces, de kans op een salarisverhoging tot maximaal €500 bruto, als erkenning voor je groei en prestaties
Talloze interessante trainingen, masterclasses en de mogelijkheid om waardevolle certificaten te behalen op het gebied van data, projectmatig werken en procesoptimalisatie.
25 Vakantiedagen, vakantiegeld en reiskostenvergoeding op maat
Work hard, play hard! Met leuke borrels, toffe teamuitjes en evenementen houden we het teamgevoel hoog!




Dit vragen wij van jou

Een afgeronde hbo-of wo-opleiding in een technische, geografische of data-gerelateerde richting
Een vlotte babbel, oplossingsgerichtheid en professionaliteit
Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal
Ervaring met kaartviewers en affiniteit met datavisualisatie
Ervaring met QGIS of ArcGIS is een pré
Ervaring met (of interesse in) Power BI, Tableau of vergelijkbare dashboarding tools
Basiskennis van BAG, BGT en BOR is een pré
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - People Analytics
Description:
Who We Are

At Prosus, we improve everyday life for billions across the globe through cutting-edge technology. As a leading global consumer internet group and one of the world's largest technology investors, we nurture and support industry-leading businesses that empower individuals and enrich communities.We are proud to lead the charge in AI innovation, making significant strides in this transformative field. With operations in over 100 countries, our extensive global portfolio includes over 90 companies.

We drive progress in sectors such as online classifieds, food delivery, payments & fintech, and edtech, consistently pushing the boundaries of technology.

The Opportunity

Are you ready to make a difference and elevate your career? As a Data Analyst - HR at Prosus, based in the vibrant city of Amsterdam, NL, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of HR strategies and make a tangible impact on our global workforce. This exciting role is perfect for a junior to mid-level analyst eager to dive into HR data initiatives and provide insights that drive strategic decision-making.

Reporting to the Director of People Analytics & Technology, you will analyse and interpret complex data, transforming it into actionable strategies that enhance our human resources operations and global strategy. Your analytical skills will be at the heart of decisions that matter, enabling you to grow and thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment. If you're looking for a role that offers growth, influence, and the chance to work on impactful initiatives, this is your moment to shine!

Who You Are

You are a motivated and analytical professional with a passion for data and its transformation into meaningful insights. If you're someone who thrives in collaborative settings, values innovation, and enjoys uncovering trends to shape strategies, Prosus is your perfect match. You align with our principles of initiative, ownership, and curiosity, and are eager to make a global impact within a supportive and innovative environment.

What You Bring

A Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Data Science, Business, Human Resources, or a related field.

2-3 years of experience in people data analytics and HRIS experience preferably in a big tech business.

Proficiency in Microsoft Excel for intricate data manipulation and analysis.

Basic knowledge and hands-on experience with Python for data exploration and analysis.

Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities .

Outstanding communication skills with the ability to convey complex ideas clearly.

Experience with creating data visualisations and dashboards (preferred).Familiarity with data privacy and security regulations is a plus.

A collaborative mindset , with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced setting.

Your Typical Day

Your day begins by diving into HR data from around the globe, using Excel and Python to uncover crucial trends. You’ll collaborate closely with HR and cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and develop tailor-made dashboards that track key metrics. Midday, you’ll analyse data patterns and present actionable insights designed to optimize HR operations and strategy. The afternoon might bring ad-hoc requests or exciting new projects, allowing you to sharpen your analytical skills and continuously innovate. Every day offers a perfect blend of analysis, collaboration, and problem-solving!

What We Offer

Global Impact : Play a crucial role in shaping the future of global commerce.

Growth Opportunities: Expand your expertise through diverse global challenges and unique opportunities.

Innovative Culture: Join a forward-thinking team that values strategic insights and fosters continuous innovation.

Creative Environment: Engage in work that encourages creativity and constant improvement.

Collaborative Atmosphere: Benefit from autonomy and self-management in a supportive and positive workspace.

Hybrid Work: Experience the satisfaction of our flexible model tailored to balance work and life.

Competitive Compensation: Enjoy a salary package that reflects your skills and contributions.

More About Prosus & Our Culture

At Prosus, we’re building businesses that empower communities on a global scale. Guided by our core values, Innovation, Results, People, Impact, and Entrepreneurship, we push boundaries, encourage collaboration, and create an environment where diversity and inclusion thrive.

We improve the everyday lives of 2 billion people through the best talent: 30,000 across our owned companies and 200,000 across our group. Our brands, like iFood, OLX, PayU, Stack Overflow, and Tencent, are changing the way people live and work.

Looking ahead, we believe AI has the power to transform lives, solve real-world challenges, and unlock opportunities on an unparalleled scale. That’s why our mission is clear: to build an AI-first world that benefits billions.

We value curiosity, ownership, and resilience. We hire people who take initiative, embrace change, and bring fresh perspectives to everything they do.

For a deeper look at our journey and future plans, explore our latest Annual Report . Stay up to date with our latest news to see what makes Prosus stand out. Learn more at www.prosus.com .

Our Diversity & Inclusion Commitment

We respect the dignity and human rights of individuals and communities wherever we operate in the world. Building an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and can thrive is critical for us. We provide access to education, which helps everyone understand the important role they play and the positive impact they can have.
