Je bent enthousiast en gemotiveerd om samen met het team de vragen te beantwoorden, tickets aan te maken en op te lossen. Je handelt hierbij snel en adequaat. Je kunt luisteren, doorvragen en achterhalen wat precies de vraag is. Je bent communicatief vaardig en je kunt oplossingen vertalen naar de klant. Indien nodig, kun je vanzelfsprekend hulp vragen aan collega’s om samen tot een oplossing te komen.

Vind je het ook leuk om je kennis en ervaring over te dragen aan anderen, dan kun je dit doen tijdens de workshops en trainingen die we regelmatig organiseren voor onze klanten.

 

Werkzaamheden

  • Je neemt samen met je collega’s binnenkomende service calls aan.
  • Je registreert, analyseert en beantwoordt vervolgens de vraag van de klant.
  • Waar nodig zet je de servicecall door naar de juiste afdeling of collega en bewaakt de voortgang/opvolging.
  • Je monitort de SaaS-systemen en dataverbindingen van klanten met een onderhoudscontract en beslist of een field-engineer naar locatie moet
  • Je diagnosticeert defecte OT-hardware en informeert de klant over kosten en verwachte reparatietijd
  • Je traint klanten in het gebruik van onze SaaS-platformen of ondersteunt collega’s tijdens workshops
  • Je denkt mee over de inhoud en aandachtspunten van de workshops

 

Als support-engineer heb je een zeer gevarieerde rol en ben je één van de 1e aanspreekpunten van onze klanten. Het team is heel hecht en kenmerkt zich door een gemoedelijke sfeer, waarbij kennisoverdracht en onderlinge ondersteuning centraal staan. Er heerst een gevoel van loyaliteit en saamhorigheid en er is veel vertrouwen in elkaar.

 

Over ons

Wioniq Benelux BV is onderdeel van de Wioniq BV, een internationale bedrijvengroep met een passie voor het ontwikkelen en toepassen van de nieuwste IT- en IoT-technologieën tot slimme oplossingen voor opdrachtgevers in de sectoren water, energie en gebouwen.

De Wioniq-bedrijven behoren tot de beursgenoteerde Wienerberger Groep met het hoofdkantoor in Wenen (Oostenrijk).

Wij leveren end-to-end oplossingen voor het op afstand monitoren, bewaken en bedienen van technische installaties en meetopstellingen in de infrastructuren van water en duurzaam gas. Met deze oplossingen zorgen we ervoor dat onze opdrachtgevers te allen tijde en op een veilige manier beschikken over actuele en betrouwbare informatie over het functioneren van hun infrastructuur.

Onze slimme oplossingen vereenvoudigen daarbij hun inzichten zodat ze de infrastructuur optimaal kunnen bedrijven en verbeteren, om zich wapenen tegen de effecten van een veranderend klimaat, vuil water en een tekort aan duurzaam gas.

 

Bij Wioniq werken gepassioneerde mensen nauw samen met opdrachtgevers en met elkaar, om de beste oplossingen te realiseren en we zijn ervan overtuigd dat we daarmee het verschil kunnen maken!

 

Profielschets

Jij beschikt over een onderzoekende en nieuwsgierige geest en hebt al wat ervaring met support/servicedesk-werkzaamheden. Je bent empathisch, kunt de juiste vragen stellen en bent gewend om goed na te denken. Je communiceert goed met klanten en collega’s en bent een echte teamspeler.

 

Funtie-eisen

  • Een afgeronde MBO4-opleiding en ITIL opleiding en/of soortgelijke ervaring
  • Minimaal 1 jaar aantoonbare ervaring als Support/Servicedeskmedewerker in de afgelopen 3 jaar.
  • Werkervaring met Microsoft Office 365
  • Interesse in en affiniteit met OT-techniek op basis van Linux
  • Ervaring in het werken met een ticketsysteem en het geven van trainingen of workshops
  • Uitstekende klantgerichte en interne communicatievaardigheden.
  • Goede beheersing van zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.
  • Kun je ook Duits, dan is dit een pré.

 

De functie is gericht op een voltijds dienstverband. Uiteraard zijn wij flexibel in de wijze waarop de dit samen invullen. Hybride werken behoort zeker tot de mogelijkheden, vooral omdat meerdere werkzaamheden eenvoudig vanuit een thuiskantoor kunnen worden uitgevoerd.

 

Wij bieden

  • Allereerst een inspirerende groep collega’s en verder;
  • Een uitdagende baan binnen een ambitieus team met een internationale focus
  • Ruimte en aandacht voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en eigen initiatief
  • De mogelijkheid om te groeien binnen onze organisatie
  • Een inspirerende werkomgeving met een goede balans tussen werk en privé, met mogelijkheden om te werken vanuit onze kantoren in Apeldoorn en Doetinchem of vanuit huis.
  • Een goed salaris en uitstekende arbeidsvoorwaarden.

 

 

Als je meer informatie wilt over deze functie, dan kun je contact opnemen met Marcel Krabbenborg, 0653745447

 

Herken jij jezelf in bovenstaande vacature? Ben jij die klantgerichte energieke persoonlijkheid met passie voor techniek, dan nodigen wij je uit om te solliciteren. Stuur jouw C.V. met jouw motivatie naar recruitment@wienerberger.com

Title: GIS Support Analyst
Description:
At geocgi we pride ourselves on not losing our focus. We started out and remain GIS experts (or geeks. . . depending on your perspective). Since 2006, we’ve evolved into a world-class and world-wide service provider of multiple disciplines. We are a talented, hardworking group that share values and characteristics that drive client, professional, and personal success. geocgi is looking for a GIS Support Analyst for Help desk and Technical Support. GIS Technical Support involves assisting users with the installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of Geographic Information Systems (GIS) software and hardware. Support technicians diagnose and resolve issues related to spatial data management, system performance, and application functionality. They provide technical guidance, ensure system security and stability, and help optimize GIS tools to meet organizational needs. The role requires strong knowledge of GIS platforms, databases, and scripting, along with excellent problem-solving and communication skills to deliver effective technical assistance to end-users and support teams. This role involves resolving complex user issues, supporting system maintenance, and ensuring the integrity and security of NATO’s GIS operational environment. This position is located in The Hague, The Netherlands.




Key Responsibilities:

•    Respond to, diagnose, and resolve Tier 2/3 support tickets related to GIS software and hardware issues.

•    Handle escalated and complex support cases, performing root cause analysis and implementing effective solutions.

•    Provide expert assistance on GIS applications, databases, and spatial data management.

•    Collaborate with Tier 1 support and other IT teams to escalate and resolve complex issues.

•    Perform system configuration, integration, and customization as required.

•    Conduct  proactive system checks and optimize GIS solutions.

•    Assist in the deployment of updates, patches, and new GIS features.

•    Maintain comprehensive records of issues, resolutions, system configurations, and procedures.

•    Document support procedures, resolutions, and system configurations.

•    Provide training and technical guidance/training materials to Tier 1 support team and end-users.

•    Maintain technical knowledge of the latest GIS technologies and best practices.




As an employee of geocgi, the candidate will have access to a generous benefits package, in addition to a corporate culture and community of GIS geeks. Our benefits include but are not limited to:

•    Competitive salaries, commensurate with experience and leading Federal Contractors in the geospatial industry.

•    Opportunities for upward mobility in a dynamic fast paced environment within a small company.

•    Merit-based spot and end of year bonuses.

•    Safe Harbor 401(k) plan with immediate vesting.

•    Flexible work hours and PTO.

•    Complete Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage for individuals.

•    Company paid training, certifications, and professional growth and development.




The following are requirements of the GIS Support Analyst.

•    US Citizen with Active U.S. Passport

•    Active DoD Secret Clearance

•    6+ years of experience plus Bachelor’s or Master's degree in Geography, GIS, Computer Science, or related field.

•    8+ years of experience with ArcGIS Software.

•    Strong understanding of spatial data management and database systems (e.g., SQL Server, Oracle).

•    Hands on experience with Esri's 10.8.1 or higher Enterprise environment; installation, configuration, upgrading and migrating.

•    Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.

•    Knowledge of scripting languages like Python, SQL, PowerShell, or others.

•    Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

•    Good communication skills and customer service orientation.

•    Well-organized, detail-oriented, and collaborative with a proactive approach to client service.

•    Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and SharePoint.

•    Perform responsibilities within a 2week scrum/agile environment.




The following are desired capabilities and experience of the GIS Support Analyst.

•    Proven experience supporting complex GIS environments in a military, governmental, or NATO setting.

•    Experience with Enterprise GIS systems and services.

•    Knowledge of network and system administration.

•    Certifications like GIS Professional (GISP), CSM or related IT certifications.




Please visit our website and careers page at: www.geocgi.com to apply. Geocgi provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. As a U.S. Federal Contractor, geocgi complies with COVID-19 vaccine mandates for all personnel as outlined by Executive Order 14042.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Over ons

Sinds 2006 brengen wij de risico's van software voor onze klanten vakkundig in kaart. We zijn een professionele thuishaven voor software testers, developers, business analysts en scrum masters – een plek waar we consequent streven naar de perfecte balans tussen uitdaging, groei en werkplezier voor onze IT consultants.




Functieomschrijving

Als Senior Business Analyst sta je aan het roer bij het vertalen van business requirements naar praktische oplossingen. Je bent de cruciale schakel tussen business stakeholders en technische teams, terwijl je de marktontwikkelingen nauwlettend volgt om innovatieve oplossingen voor te stellen.




Dit ben jij

Minimaal 5 jaar relevante projectervaring
Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring binnen overheidsorganisaties of semi-overheid
Kennis van en ervaring met BPM, Requirements, Agile/Scrum, User Stories & Use Cases, Functional Design of BABOK
Gedegen kennis van bedrijfsvoering en management
Bewezen ervaring in adviserende rollen
Kennis van IT-ontwikkelmethoden en solution frameworks
Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding




Dit bieden wij

Een vast contract vanaf dag één
Een competitief salarispakket afgestemd op jouw ervaring
28 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om er 5 bij te kopen (want wie wil er nou niet wat extra vrije tijd)
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling
Flexibele mobiliteitsvergoeding voor auto, OV of fiets – of leaseauto
Voordelige fiscale regeling voor technologie-aankopen (50% belastingvoordeel)
Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget (We vergoeden alle opleidingen en trainingen die bijdragen aan jouw professionele ontwikkeling)
Regelmatige teamevents en jaarlijkse internationale trips (We zijn al in Dublin, Mallorca en Lissabon geweest)




Waarom kiezen voor Astek Nederland

We geloven in het écht leren kennen van onze mensen – begrijpen wat je drijft en wat je nodig hebt om te groeien. Als Senior Business Analyst werk je aan uitdagende projecten die je grenzen verleggen, met behoud van een gezonde work-life balance. We vullen professionele groei aan met aansprekende teamevents en onvergetelijke uitjes – dit versterkt de band binnen ons team en helpt ons elkaar op een ander niveau te leren kennen. Ons doel is simpel: ervoor zorgen dat je floreert in je rol én tijd hebt voor alle andere mooie dingen in het leven.




Benieuwd naar je mogelijke salaris? Bezoek: Verdien een goed salaris als consultant bij Astek




Spreekt deze vacature je aan? Aarzel niet om te solliciteren of voor meer informatie contact op te nemen met onze recuiter Maxim (maxim.slavoev@astek.net).

Title: Information Security Analyst (40 hours per week)
Description:
Are you eager to be a driving force in our in-house IT security and compliance activities? Together with your colleagues within IT you will be responsible to implement and maintain security measures to protect company computer networks and systems and the information contained within them. To excel in this position, you are proactive, a real team player and open to be flexible when needed. You like challenges and can always come up with the best solution. If you come across a security risk, you are the best person to coordinate with various teams, resolving the issue at hand in a timely manner.

Key Responsibilities


Ensuring security risks are identified and define technical improvement/action plans
Automate the identification of security events by defining rules in Security systems
Perform regular root causes analysis and suggest actions to be taken based upon outcome
Promote and assess compliance with current rules, policies, and standards
Collect, compile, summarize and record security data and trends
Foresee potential issues and escalate concerns


What You Bring


Bachelors/HBO level education, preferably in Cybersecurity
1+ years of working experience in IT Security
Experience with working with various (network) security solutions such as SIEM, IDS, NDR and EDR systems
Security certification in CEH, CISSP or CASP is preferred
Fluency in English, both written and spoken


What We Offer


An international working environment, fueled by respect and a healthy work-life balance tailored to the business and team member’s needs
27 paid vacation days (based on fulltime contract) with option to purchase five additional days
Commuting allowance of €0,23/km or an NS Business card subscription
A wide variety of internal trainings and development possibilities and a tuition program for external trainings
The opportunity to pro-actively work on your vitality and fitness
State-of-the-art facilities, including green areas, in-house restaurant and gym
Additional benefits, such as:
Attractive pension scheme (your contribution at 4%, ours at 12%)
€50 net monthly health insurance contribution
Two (paid) days per year dedicated to volunteering activities
Several fun company events and meaningful initiatives organized throughout the year

At Applied Medical, we are committed to make a meaningful, positive difference, each and every day. Within our European headquarters in Amersfoort (NL), we develop, manufacture and support the implementation of our advanced medical devices across Europe and the MENA region. Applied’s team members enjoy working in an environmentally friendly and international environment, in which people of diverse backgrounds are valued, challenged, and acknowledged. We support our team members by giving them opportunities of ongoing learning and education, possibilities to take part in community volunteering activities and a variety of onsite exercise classes and health activities.

If you are passionate about working in an organization that allows you to make decisions based upon what is right for the patient, customer, community and environment, Applied Medical is the place for you.

Interested?

Would you like to be part of our expanding team? If the answer is yes, we'd love to get to know you and look forward to hearing from you!

For more information regarding our hiring process, click here. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us via TA-Europe@appliedmedical.com or +31 (0)33 7548713.

Title: Machine Support Engineer
Description:
Werk jij graag aan de nieuwste technologieën en zoek je een internationale uitdaging? In deze rol werk je aan geavanceerde oplossingen die wereldwijd uniek zijn én direct worden toegepast bij klanten. Geen dag is hetzelfde, en je werkt in een professionele en prettige werkomgeving waarin innovatie en klanttevredenheid centraal staan.




Wat ga je doen?

Je lost software- en hardwareproblemen op, zowel op locatie als op afstand.
Je hebt nauw contact met klanten over de hele wereld, ondersteunt bij installaties en geeft trainingen om het maximale uit het systeem te halen.
Je analyseert klantfeedback en testresultaten en stemt af met productie om de technologie continu te verbeteren.
Je helpt bij het verzamelen van waardevolle data (zoals productregistraties) die softwareteams gebruiken om nieuwe algoritmes te ontwikkelen en te testen.
Je voert reparaties en herinstallaties uit aan computers, software en componenten die door klanten zijn opgestuurd.
Je test nieuwe features en software-releases.
Je draagt bij aan het verbeteren van de interne kennisbank en het klantenservicesysteem.
Je adviseert dealers over reserveonderdelen en upgrades van bestaande systemen.




Jouw profiel

Je hebt een technische achtergrond in bijvoorbeeld elektronica, software, elektrotechniek, autotechniek, mechatronica of vergelijkbaar.
Je bent bereid om af en toe naar het buitenland te reizen voor je werk (10% a 15%)
Je bent in het bezit van een geldig rijbewijs en paspoort.




Interesse?

Solliciteer dan direct!

Kijk voor meer vacatures op https://uptec.nl/job-openings/

Show more

  • Je adviseert dealers over reserveonderdelen en upgrades van bestaande systemen.


Jouw profiel

  • Je hebt een technische achtergrond in bijvoorbeeld elektronica, software, elektrotechniek, autotechniek, mechatronica of vergelijkbaar.
  • Je bent bereid om af en toe naar het buitenland te reizen voor je werk (10% a 15%)
  • Je bent in het bezit van een geldig rijbewijs en paspoort.


Interesse?

Solliciteer dan direct!

Kijk voor meer vacatures op https://uptec.nl/job-openings/

Title: Intern – Data Science / Business Administration - GSM BSPI
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a motivated third or fourth year HBO Business Administration or Data Science (or similar) student! Do you want to know what it's like to be part of one of the largest multinational companies in the pharmaceutical industry? We offer an internship opportunity within our Animal Health-Global Supplier Management Business Systems & Process Improvement (AH-GSM BSPI) department where you will have the freedom and space for your own initiative.

Intern – Data Science / Business Administration - GSM BSPI

Welcome to our team

The AH-GSM BSPI department is an essential hub in our organization. This department provides foundational and centralized support for the AH-GSM organization by developing and maintaining excellence in the processes and systems we use, by driving efficiency through our sourcing and contracting work, by creating valuable insights through our data & analytics capabilities, and by continually seeking improvements via our operational excellence programs.

The team consists of 10 employees, all of whom have extensive knowledge and experience in transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights, process improvement and project management. The team works closely with other departments within the company to achieve the stated goals.

Your internship assignment

As an intern, you will use SAP Ariba data and other enterprise data to create visualizations and reports with the MAH preferred data tool. Your tasks include extracting, integrating, preparing, and validating data from Ariba and other sources. You will build dashboards to support data-driven decisions and communicate insights into contracts, savings, sourcing, and other processes to stakeholders. By integrating Ariba's procurement data with other datasets, you will provide a unified business view, saving time and enabling faster, informed decision-making. Effective communication is crucial to ensure stakeholders' needs are met.

Your Responsibilities


Validate data in Data Lake Review the extracted Ariba data in the enterprise data lake (Redshift).
Data Transformation & Integration Clean and transform the raw data as needed and integrate it with other datasets in the lake.
Publishing to Aera Make the prepared data available to MAH preferred data tool. The data is harmonized into the Decision Data Model, where it can be used to build real-time dashboards and analytics.
Visualization & Analysis in Aera Create visualizations, reports, and possibly automated insights on the integrated data.
Collect Stakeholder Feedback Conduct focus groups and research best practices to ensure data visualizations and reports meet stakeholder needs.
Communications and Collaboration Collaborate with a global team, sharing insights and learning from professionals. Maintain a learning mindset to grow skills in procurement systems and process improvement while enjoying the work.
Offer fresh perspectives by sharing your opinions.


The described tasks form the basic package and will often be performed independently after a proper training and learning period. These tasks may be supplemented with other projects and/or tasks on your own initiative or at the request of the organization.

What Is Required


A third or fourth year HBO student in Business Administration, Data Science or similar field
Familiarity with data analysis, possess strong analytical skills to understand and interpret data from various sources.
Knowledge of PowerBI, Tableau or QlikView. Experience working with relational databases and programming experience.
Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal
Available for a period of 5 or 6 months for 5 days per week (hybrid working possible)


What We Offer

Interning at our company means working together with your team towards health in an international work environment. As an intern, you will have the opportunity to work closely with experts and learn from them. In addition, we offer


The chance to gain experience in the pharmaceutical industry
An opportunity to showcase yourself for potential opportunities after your internship period
A challenging and dynamic work environment with plenty of room for personal development and initiative
Good guidance from an experienced specialist
A gross monthly internship allowance of €500,- based on a 40-hour workweek


Animal Health Division

Our Animal Health Division is a trusted global leader in animal healthcare. We are committed to preserving and improving the health, well-being, and performance of animals and the people who care for them. As a global team of professionals, we work together to make a positive difference in animal care and the world's food chain. We also have a deep sense of responsibility towards our customers, consumers, animals, society, and our planet.

By being dedicated to The Science of Healthier Animals®, we provide veterinarians, farmers, pet owners, and governments with one of the broadest ranges of animal health products, vaccines, and solutions and services for health management. Additionally, we deliver a comprehensive range of digitally connected identification, traceability, and monitoring products. We invest in dynamic and extensive R&D capabilities and a modern, global supply chain. We are present in more than 50 countries, and our products are available in approximately 150 markets.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for this role would be a person with good experience on PowerBi and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users.

Responsibilities for this position include:

Understand business requirements in the BI context and design data models to convert raw data to meaningful insights.
Understand existing dashboards and visual interactive reports.
Identify KPIs with clear objectives and monitor them consistently.
Analyze data and present it through reports that can help in decision-making.
To be able to convert business requirements into technical specifications and decide the timeline to accomplish tasks.
Design, develop, and deploy Power BI scripts and perform efficient detailed analysis.
Analysis of Custom build queries and functions
Write Custom SQL query for best results.
Experience in DB design and best practices fof DB design
Understand filters, parameter, and graphs.
Define and design new systems by analyzing current ETL processes.
Make technical changes to existing BI systems to enhance their functions.
An exposure to agile way of implementation
Experience working on large BI projects/programs.
Experience on creating new data models, reports, and dashboards in target systems.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📈 Data Analyst | Impact-Driven Company | Stockholm | Hybrid




From Raw Data to Real-World Change. Help Drive Smarter Decisions Every Day.




We’re hiring on behalf of a fast-moving company operating in a complex, data-rich industry. Whether it’s optimizing supply chains, improving customer operations, or supporting sustainability goals, data plays a central role in how this team drives performance and long-term impact.




You’ll be joining a company where your insights influence real-world outcomes not just screen metrics.




🔧 Your Role

Analyze operational, financial, and customer data to uncover trends, inefficiencies, and growth opportunities
Work closely with operations, finance, and strategy teams to define KPIs and measure performance
Build dashboards and visualizations that make complex data accessible to decision-makers
Support data governance efforts and help maintain high-quality, trusted datasets
Lead or contribute to deep-dive investigations and data-backed business cases




🔍 You Bring

3+ years of experience in a data analyst or business intelligence role
Proficiency in SQL and experience pulling data from relational databases
Strong analytical thinking and the ability to communicate insights clearly
Familiarity with at least one BI tool (e.g. Power BI, Qlik, Tableau)
Bonus: Experience working with ERP systems, supply chain data, or Excel-based reporting workflows




💼 Why Join?

See your analysis drive decisions across critical areas of the business
Work in a stable, purpose-driven company with real-world impact
Hybrid flexibility and a culture of trust and autonomy
Cross-functional collaboration and exposure to different business units
Competitive salary, long-term stability, and development opportunities




Curious about the numbers behind real operations? This role lets you dig in, explore, and influence. 🧠 Apply today with your CV!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
YOUR MISSION AT VOI

Role

As a Data Analyst at Voi your primary responsibility will be to facilitate informed decision-making by providing actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis. Your contributions will play a pivotal role in our ongoing success in the 12 countries we operate in. By joining Voi, you’re joining a truly data driven company where the data team is at the forefront:


Build decision support tools using data, metrics and dashboards
Guide operational decisions and help product teams build the best products
Solve business and product problems through data analysis
Present your insights and recommendations to stakeholders
Extract, manipulate and visualize data to find and understand patterns
Clean data to develop features and signals in a vast, unordered data set
Help the organization learn from data by advising on performance indicators, tests and analytical methodologies
Teach team members and lead the way for data driven ways of working


What You’ll Need To Embark

Being part of our team means to challenge the status quo and to drive change where you see needed, both in terms of how we work internally and how our operations execute. We believe you have an ability and willingness to learn and adapt to a changing environment, it also means to be a great team player and help us build a fantastic place to work! In addition to being fluent in English we believe the right person has:


Business interest, curiosity and creativity for efficient problem-solving
Experience in translating challenging and open-ended stakeholder needs into valuable analytical solutions
A few years of experience working as a Data Analyst in a autonomous and agile environment
Strong SQL skills
The ability to communicate your insights and findings in a captivating way
Great communication skills, both for collaborating and for sharing insights
Experience working with dbt and python is a plus
A university degree in a relevant field (e.g. Mathematics, Statistics, Science, Engineering, Business)


WHY VOI?

Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voyage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To


Join Europe’s #1 micromobility operator and one of the fastest growing scaleups
Get “skin in the game” through our employee options program
Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
Join the micromobility revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


Since 2018, Voi has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.

Diversity Matters

As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Since you’ve landed on this page, you already know Hedvig is a mover and shaker in insurtech, and think you might have what it takes to join us. We’ve been working hard since the very beginning to change an industry that is hard to love – to something at least likable. At Hedvig, we believe the only way to do so is to work with loveable people.




What about the role?

We are now looking for a Data Analyst to join our ambitious team at Hedvig. This is a role full of opportunities to learn, grow, and make an impact. As a Data analyst you’ll work with a wide range of analytics tasks - transforming raw data into structured models, analyzing trends and delivering actionable insights to the organisation. You’ll work collaboratively with teams from all areas of the organization and support decision making across product, marketing, claims handling, strategy, pricing and more.




You’ll be part of building and maintaining our analytics platform, the backbone of all insights and reports. Collaborating with our experienced team of analysts and a variety of stakeholders across the company, you’ll help ensure we have the right tools, models, and insights to make fast, informed decisions—supporting everything from high-level strategy to day-to-day operations.




In the role, you would:

- Analyse data to provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the organisation

- Develop and build dashboards in our Business Intelligence Tool Looker

- Transform and model data in our data warehouse Google Bigquery using SQL

- Define KPIs to make sure we can measure how we track towards our goals and milestones




About you?

- You have 0–2 years of experience in an analytics or data-focused role

- You have a university degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience

- You’re eager to learn and improve, and you approach problems with curiosity and ownership

- You are business-minded and enjoy working closely with stakeholder

- You thrive in environments with both technical and business related challenges

- You communicate clearly and enjoy collaborating across teams

- You are experienced working with SQL




What about us?

At Hedvig, we challenge assumptions and push boundaries. We believe great ideas can come from anyone, and we care more about what’s being said than who says it. We value trust, ownership, and continuous learning—and we will support you in developing both personally and professionally.

Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Join our Battlefield Analytics team as a Senior Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of gaming! You'll drive key insights into the software and experiential quality of Battlefield, directly impacting player experiences.

In this role, you'll leverage your analytics skills to guide strategic decisions, ensuring our leaders prioritize data-driven choices for product optimization, gameplay features, technology advancements, testing processes, and overall game quality. Reporting to the Senior Analytics Manager, you'll be an integral part of our innovative analytics organization, making a tangible impact in the gaming world.

The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will develop business intelligence products and lead data projects to enhance data maturity for our Development and Quality Assurance teams. Your expertise in SQL, ETL pipelines, and data visualization will be crucial in analysing data and identifying trends to drive decision-making across the organization.


Report to the Senior Analytics Manager.
Influence the data analytics roadmap for major EA titles.
Develop data products to improve decision-making.
Establish best practices in data analytics and visualization.
Influencing data governance practices to enhance data maturity.
Provide coaching to Data Analyst colleagues.


The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires


3+ years of professional analytical experience.
Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


Benefits

We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match, and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes outstanding people to make outstanding games, we offer a culture that's motivated by creativity and individuality.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
Show more
HTML:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

Join our Battlefield Analytics team as a Senior Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of gaming! You'll drive key insights into the software and experiential quality of Battlefield, directly impacting player experiences.

In this role, you'll leverage your analytics skills to guide strategic decisions, ensuring our leaders prioritize data-driven choices for product optimization, gameplay features, technology advancements, testing processes, and overall game quality. Reporting to the Senior Analytics Manager, you'll be an integral part of our innovative analytics organization, making a tangible impact in the gaming world.

The Role

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will develop business intelligence products and lead data projects to enhance data maturity for our Development and Quality Assurance teams. Your expertise in SQL, ETL pipelines, and data visualization will be crucial in analysing data and identifying trends to drive decision-making across the organization.

  • Report to the Senior Analytics Manager.
  • Influence the data analytics roadmap for major EA titles.
  • Develop data products to improve decision-making.
  • Establish best practices in data analytics and visualization.
  • Influencing data governance practices to enhance data maturity.
  • Provide coaching to Data Analyst colleagues.

The Next Great Senior Data Analyst Requires

  • 3+ years of professional analytical experience.
  • Advanced SQL skills and practical experience in other languages such as R, SAS, or Python.
  • Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
  • Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
  • Able to foster working relationships with partners.

Benefits

We are proud of the great perks we offer like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, pension with company match, and, of course, free video games. And since we realize it takes outstanding people to make outstanding games, we offer a culture that's motivated by creativity and individuality.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Inom arbetet med utveckling av våra tariffer ingår det förbättring av vår kostnadsmodellering, automatisering av dataflöden och efterlevnad med lagar och aktuella föreskrifter. Gruppens största leverans är att årligen ta fram priser som dels ger bolaget önskade intäkter för året men som även är rättvist och kostnadsriktigt fördelat bland våra kunder i hela nätet. Gruppens roll innebär att vi ofta arbetar i tät dialog med andra intressenter, verksamheten och våra kunder för att kunna förstå samt agera på deras behov. Nu söker vi en erfaren Data Analyst som kan ta våra analyser till nästa nivå.

Ett datadrivet arbetssätt är en nyckel för effektiviserade arbetssätt och för att skapa långsiktiga förutsättningar i arbetet med tariffer och intäktsuppföljning, där vi söker en person som vill driva på och vara med och utveckla vårt datadrivna arbetssätt.

De regelbundna analyser som utförs av gruppen inkluderar flertalet datakällor, interna såväl som externa, vilka i större utsträckning skulle behöva kopplas samman för att göra kärnfulla analyser. Under 2024 påbörjades ett arbete med att migrera data, samla våra datakällor i ett gemensamt datalager och kartläggning av vad som krävs för att automatisera delar av arbetsflödet. Du kommer vara drivande i arbetet med att möjliggöra ökad datadrivenhet och automatisering och kan komma att få ansvar för att hålla ihop utvecklingsarbetet inom analysområdet kopplat till tariffer och intäkter. Detta kräver samarbete med många olika delar av verksamheten, där ett nyfiket arbetssätt och stark problemlösande förmåga är viktiga nycklar i rollen

Företagsbeskrivning

Vattenfall Eldistribution står mitt i energiomställningen och har en central roll i den kraftfulla elektrifiering som just nu sker på samhällsnivå där nätkapaciteten behöver fördubblas inom de närmsta 10 åren. Omställningen innebär kraftigt ökade kundinteraktioner där avdelningen Tariff och Intäkt har en viktig roll i att utveckla och optimera våra tariffstrukturer för att möta framtidens behov. Vi är idag 9 kollegor och planerar nu att växa med nya medarbetare – däribland en erfaren Data Analyst till vårt kontor i Solna eller Luleå.

Kvalifikationer

För att vara framgångsrik i rollen tror vi att du har:


Flertal års erfarenhet av programmering i Python eller liknande programmeringsspråk
Flertal års erfarenhet av att bygga effektiv och tydlig kod för att automatisera arbetsflöden, från strukturering av inputfiler, bearbetning och slutligen visualisering av data
Flertal års erfarenhet av att analysera stora datamängder
Erfarenhet av statistiks modellering och prognoser
Erfarenhet av visualiseringsprogram som Power BI
Erfarenhet av arbete med datakvalitet; identifiera och adressera brister samt initiera förbättringsinitiativ
Relevant akademisk examen
Goda kunskaper i att förmedla budskap/sätta samman presentationer
Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift


Vi ser det som ett plus om du även har tidigare erfarenhet och/eller insikt i energibranschen. Då avdelningens roll är att förstå vilka behov som finns hos verksamheten inom tariffutvecklingsområdet, så är din kommunikations- och relationsbyggande förmåga både internt och externt viktig. Du har en nytänkande och analytisk sida och styrka i att lösa problem och omvandla insikter till konsekvenser. Vi tror också att du är snabbfotad och initiativtagande för att kunna hantera bredden på rollen.

Ytterligare information

Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.

Placeringsort

Solna, Luleå

För mer information om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Lina Aglén, lina.aglen@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Julia Norberg, julia.norberg@vattenfall.com

Fackliga representanter via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00. Christian Ericsson – Ledarna, Anne-Marie Sjöbohm – Akademikerna, Asim Nokic – Unionen, Ulf Tengman – SEKO.

Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-08-24. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV.

Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.

Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.

Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
Show more

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
💼 Financial/Risk Data Analyst – BSM Expert | Stockholm (Hybrid)

Be the first in Sweden. Help shape the future. Bring your balance sheet wizardry.




We’re on the hunt for a seasoned financial services professional with solid hands-on experience in FIS Balance Sheet Manager (aka FIS Ambit Focus). This is your chance to step into a highly autonomous role in Stockholm and become the local face of a growing international financial tech consultancy that - despite the sector - doesn’t do stiff suits, rigid hierarchies, or soul-sapping meetings.




This isn’t a fix-it firefighting job. We’re already operating well. But we know with the right person on the ground, we could be doing even more - and smarter. You’ll join a team that’s killing it across the Nordics, and you’ll be the first dedicated hire in Sweden. No pressure. But also, lots of opportunity.







🧠 What you’ll be doing:

You'll partner with banking clients to deliver and support BSM solutions - think implementation, technical setups, data pipelines, upgrades, and modelling. You’ll be part business brain, part tech whiz, and (hopefully) part data ninja.




Work on-site with clients and remotely with internal teams.
Tackle ALM and Liquidity modelling like a pro.
Dive into installations, configurations, ETL processes, and module rollouts.
Bonus points if you’ve touched other modules (IFRS9, FTP, Market Risk, etc.).
Contribute to pre-sales discussions and solution discovery.
Play a key role in shaping how we grow in Sweden.




This is a “wear-many-hats” kind of role where you’ll get to influence how things are done - not just do what you’re told.




🧩 We’d love to hear from you if:

You’ve got 3+ Years of hands-on experience with BSM, especially in ALM and Liquidity.
You know your way around SQL and ETL like it’s second nature.
You’ve worked on installations, upgrades, and know how to troubleshoot when things get weird.
You understand a bank’s balance sheet like a chef knows their knives.
You’re a self-starter, but not a lone wolf - you can build trust with clients and work solo or in teams.
You’re fluent in both Swedish and English.
You’re based in (or ready to move to) Stockholm.




You don’t have to tick every box. Maybe you lean more technical, or more on the modelling and reporting side - we’d still love to chat.




🎯 Why this role is special:

You’re first. Be the pioneer in Sweden. Shape the local culture. Influence who gets hired next.
No red tape. Flat hierarchy. Here, titles don’t create distance. Whether you're a newbie or a vet, everyone's voice gets heard - even by the CEO
Community vibes. Over 200 professionals strong, but with a start-up soul. Slack channels for esports, discord community for after work hours, social events in the headquarters.
Growth trajectory. We’ve grown 15-30% year on year. All organic. Zero debt. We’re here for the long haul.
Employee-owned. After 3 years, you can become a shareholder. Yup, we put our money where our culture is.
Flex life. Hybrid working, strong trust culture, low politics. You do your best work, your way.




🌍 A bit about us (anonymously, for now):

We’re a Nordic powerhouse in the world of balance sheet management and risk analytics. While our home base is in Finland, we’ve already got boots on the ground in Sweden - and now we’re ready to give those boots a full-time owner. Our clients are household names in banking, and we’re proud to be long-term partners, not short-term vendors.




If you’re into finance but allergic to dull, love complex puzzles but not endless bureaucracy, and want to be part of something that’s growing fast but staying human - we’d love to hear from you.




Ready to have a real say in how things grow? Apply now. Let’s talk.

Title: Financial Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Position description

Job title

Financial Data Analyst (m/f/d)

Contract type

1 = fulltime - unlimited

About Infront

For 25 years, Infront has been helping financial leaders to make smarter decisions, faster. Today we do this as one of Europe's leading providers of market data and software, or WealthTech as we call it. Thousands of wealth managers, traders and other finance professionals rely on our suite of responsive tools powered by rich, reliable data. So they can think freely, move quickly and make confident calls that deliver returns. Together, we make peak performance possible.

At Infront, we emphasize work-life balance through our hybrid model. With nearly 500 team members representing over 30 nationalities, we are proud to foster a culture of diversity and inclusion. We warmly encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply and be part of our team.

About The Role

As part of Infront Fundamentals team, you’ll dive into the world of financial reporting for approximately 5,000 publicly listed companies, tracking their performance, uploading their reports, and extracting key financial data that powers our systems. You’ll ensure the data is accurate, meaningful, and aligned with accounting standards. If you're detail-oriented, tech-savvy, and excited by the intersection of finance and data, this opportunity is for you.

Your Responsibilities Include


Monitor publicly listed companies and extract financial data from interim and annual reports.
Use tools to clean, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Ensure financial data meets quality standards and complies with accounting taxonomy rules.
Set up new companies and maintain company groups (universes) within the internal system.
Collaborate with developers to add new features and functionality to the internal database.
Continuously improve data collection and processing workflows.
Take ownership of the assigned universe of companies.


Who you are


Education in Accounting, Finance, or Business
A good understanding of financial reports
Good understanding of accounting principles
Good overview of financial markets
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong organizational skills
Responsible and improvement-oriented mindset
Proficiency in English. Swedish is a plus


Position location

Job location

Sweden, Stockholm

Company

Infront Sweden AB (SWE)

Candidate criteria

Languages


English (3- Business fluent)
Swedish (3- Business fluent)


Handled by

Last name

Larios Romo

Forename

Miriam
Show more

  • Strong organizational skills
  • Responsible and improvement-oriented mindset
  • Proficiency in English. Swedish is a plus

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Hur kan vi bäst hjälpa våra kunder till en fossilfri energianskaffning? 

Att erbjuda våra kunder fossilfri el till konkurrenskraftiga priser innebär att vi behöver förstå kundernas behov och marknaden, samt kunna hantera de tillhörande riskerna. Vi söker nu en Business Intelligence Analyst till avdelningen Commodities Intelligence! 

Som Business Intelligence Analyst tillhör du avdelningen Commodities Intelligence som bland annat arbetar med finansiell riskhantering, prissättning av el, miljöprodukter och utveckling av våra BI-verktyg för våra försäljningssegment. Teamet arbetar med alla kunder och segment i Norden och du kommer att ha kollegor både i Sverige och Finland. Förutom dina teamkollegor kommer du att arbeta nära bland annat portföljförvaltare, controllers och Vattenfall IT. 

Ditt främsta ansvar är att utveckla och ansvara för teamets data och BI-verktyg, som är kritiska för vår finansiella riskhantering, affärsanalyser, uppföljning och rapportering. Du bygger, utvecklar och säkerställer god kvalité för nya och befintliga Power BI-rapporter. Du arbetar med rapporterna från start till mål, med start i beställning av data från källsystem till publicering av användarvänliga rapporter som möter våra stakeholders krav på uppföljning, riskhantering, analys och beslutsfattande. Vår ambition är att ditt arbete ska utgöra grunden för förbättrad riskhantering och ökad kvalité i våra analyser och rapporter.   

För att möjliggöra en god affärslogik i transformationen av data är det av vikt att ha eller kunna tillskansa sig en god förståelse för elmarknaden och elförsäljningsprocesser. Det är också av vikt att kunna arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och förstå stakeholders olika krav och behov.  

För rätt person finns möjligheten att ta ansvaret som produktägare över vår lösning för Power BI rapporter och relaterad data. För det krävs erfarenhet av stakeholder management, bra kommunikationsförmåga och att kunna prioritera uppgifter som inkommer inom sprinten. Intresse av och förmåga att se hur vårt arbete påverkar helheten och affären. Erfarenhet att arbeta som scrum master är meriterade men inte nödvändigt.

Företagsbeskrivning

Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 20 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem. 

Kvalifikationer

För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du ha: 


Akademisk examen inom ingenjörsvetenskap, finans, matematik, nationalekonomi eller liknande område.  
Erfarenhet av SQL-programmering, gärna Azure/Databricks. 
Erfarenhet av datamodellering och data management. 
Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du också har: 


Erfarenhet av att arbeta i elmarknaden. 
Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära försäljning och marknad. 
Erfarenhet av Power BI. 
Ytterligare programmeringskunskaper, gärna Python. 
Kunskap inom finansiella derivat. 
Erfarenhet av att arbeta i scrum team eller likvärdig kunskap. 


Som person har du ett analytiskt mindset och förmågan att snabbt bedöma och förstå relationer mellan involverade system och verktyg. Du är kundfokuserad och affärsinriktad, samt en bra lagspelare med goda kommunikationsförmågor. 

Ytterligare information

Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.  

Placeringsort: Solna. 

För mer information om tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef André Hellström, andre.hellstrom@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Catalina Roa Rodriguez, catalina.roarodriguez@vattenfall.com.

Fackliga representanter är Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Mikael Mukka (SEKO) och Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna). Du når samtliga via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00.  

Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 17 augusti 2025. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i ansökan. Du söker snabbt och enkelt genom att svara på urvalsfrågor och bifoga ditt CV. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats. Annonseringsperioden är förlängd med anledning av sommarledighet.

Vi använder oss av tester i denna rekryteringsprocess och ett online-test kommer att skickas ut till alla sökanden som ett första steg i rekryteringsprocessen efter sista ansökningsdag.

På Vattenfall värdesätter vi att vara aktiva, positiva, öppna och säkerhetsmedvetna. Vi söker medarbetare som delar vår vision och kan bidra till att stärka vår företagskultur. Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsvariation. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.  
Show more

Title: Business Analyst, Insights and Research
Description:
We are looking for a skilled and motivated Business Analyst, Insights and Research to join our data-driven team. This role involves market, competitor, and customer analysis, optimizing customer journeys, and driving strategic decisions through insights and analytics. You will analyze market trends, competitor strategies, and customer behavior to provide strategic recommendations that shape business growth. Your insights will empower Consumer Solutions with actionable data, improving performance across the Nordics. You will develop automated reports for situational awareness and performance monitoring, working closely with cross-functional teams to enhance customer journeys and processes. Your expertise will contribute to shaping the next generation of customer experience and influencing key business decisions. Our purpose is to Inform, Inspire, and Challenge through data and insights.

This role is part of a Nordic team of six and reports to the Director, Insight and Customer Journey Orchestration.

About The Role



Development of insights and analytics solutions that support informed, data-driven decision-making in Consumer Solution and provide strategic recommendations.
Manage the MEC unit’s Power BI app and Forsta (customer feedback system) including the underlying data model, ensuring data quality, accessibility and availability.
Use our main sources of insights to collect, analyse and interpret information that can be used to retain and acquire new consumers.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to identify customer-centric opportunities, areas of improvement and share best practices.
Provide training and support to end-users, fostering a culture of insight-driven decision-making.
Drive innovation by exploring new technologies, methodologies, and machine learning techniques to enhance analytics capabilities.
Contribute to our common success in personalization at scale and segmentation



About You



Higher relevant education, preferably in technology or economics, with an emphasis on quantitative subjects.
Work experience in relevant field, with proven track-record of creating business growth or improved collaboration through commercial analysis and visualization of data.
Proficiency in Power BI, including advanced DAX, M-languages, data modelling, and report optimization.
Strong expertise in SQL and experience with data warehouses or data lakes. Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g. Python) with experience in Databricks is preferred, but not required.
Capabilities and experience working with machine learning and the application of AI is a plus, but not required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English; proficiency in a Nordic language is advantageous.



Personal Attributes

To succeed in this position, you need strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a data-driven mindset that supports informed decision-making. The ideal candidate is commercially driven, highly energetic, and target-oriented, with a proactive and innovative approach to achieving goals. You need to be a good team player with strong interpersonal and communication skills, but also self-motivated, organized, and capable of managing multiple priorities effectively.

We offer you

At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.

Interested?

Submit your application by 04.08.2025 at the latest. We will begin screening candidates in August. If you would like to hear more about the position, please contact Pål Gravdahl, through pal.gravdahl@fortum.com.

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.

We are Fortum

Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
For 25 years, Infront has been helping financial leaders to make smarter decisions, faster. Today we do this as one of Europe's leading providers of market data and software, or WealthTech as we call it. Thousands of wealth managers, traders and other finance professionals rely on our suite of responsive tools powered by rich, reliable data. So they can think freely, move quickly and make confident calls that deliver returns. Together, we make peak performance possible.




At Infront, we emphasize work-life balance through our hybrid model. With nearly 500 team members representing over 30 nationalities, we are proud to foster a culture of diversity and inclusion. We warmly encourage individuals of all backgrounds to apply and be part of our team.




About the Role




As part of Infront Fundamentals team, you’ll dive into the world of financial reporting for approximately 5,000 publicly listed companies, tracking their performance, uploading their reports, and extracting key financial data that powers our systems. You’ll ensure the data is accurate, meaningful, and aligned with accounting standards. If you're detail-oriented, tech-savvy, and excited by the intersection of finance and data, this opportunity is for you.




Your responsibilities include




Monitor publicly listed companies and extract financial data from interim and annual reports.
Use tools to clean, organize, analyze, and interpret large datasets.
Ensure financial data meets quality standards and complies with accounting taxonomy rules.
Set up new companies and maintain company groups (universes) within the internal system.
Collaborate with developers to add new features and functionality to the internal database.
Continuously improve data collection and processing workflows.
Take ownership of the assigned universe of companies.




Who you are




Education in Accounting, Finance, or Business
A good understanding of financial reports
Good understanding of accounting principles
Good overview of financial markets
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
Strong organizational skills
Responsible and improvement-oriented mindset
Proficiency in English. Swedish is a plus




Show more

Title: Data Analyst/IT Analyst with Snowflake
Description:
Job ID: 30396

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

We are looking for a Data Analyst/IT Analyst with Snowflake to join our Team in Poland (Warsaw/Gdańsk/Łódź) or Sweden (Stockholm).

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About Our Team

Meet the Common Data Warehouse Requirements and Analysis team. We are responsible for building the bank’s Common Data Warehousing solution using state of the art cloud solutions. We add value by providing expert analysts and data modelling capabilities and expertise in the data warehousing and data integration areas for many solutions in the bank based on cloud-based technologies like Snowflake, and many other modern technologies.

Our team specializes in data analysis, data modelling, and data architecture. As IT Analyst you will play a crucial role in project development lifecycle.

Our technology stack includes, but is not limited to: Snowflake, DataStage, ETL Architecture, Cloud-based databases, Data Mesh, Data Vault.

We are looking for an IT Analyst to perform data analysis and data model transformation tasks. You will be working as an interface between business and IT to help translate the business requirements into IT mappings, as well as help understand data patterns and design innovative solutions.

What you will be doing:


Perform complex data analysis to help IT clarify requirements towards business and test use cases.
Map source data to target data models in the most optimal way (financial services logical data model).
Act as technical SME and help IT development teams in understanding the requirements


Who You Are

This is the right role for you if you have a passion for data analysis and problem solving. You are exceptionally good in interpersonal communications and proficient in English language.

Your background and skills include:


A degree in Computer Science or related field.
At least 5 years’ experience in IT.
Have worked with requirement management.
Experience of working in multinational virtual teams.
Understanding of Data Warehousing industry standards.
Understanding of ETL/BI/Data Analytics/Data Modelling processes.
Experience in writing SQL.
Proficiency in local language is preferred, as it supports collaboration with local teams and stakeholders.
Fluency in English is required to freely communicate with stakeholders.


It would be ideal if you also:


Having experience with Snowflake.
Having knowledge of Data Mesh, Data Virtualization, Data Vault.
Having experience working in SAFe environment.


If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/08/2025.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.

The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Show more
HTML:
Job ID: 30396

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

We are looking for a Data Analyst/IT Analyst with Snowflake to join our Team in Poland (Warsaw/Gdańsk/Łódź) or Sweden (Stockholm).

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About Our Team

Meet the Common Data Warehouse Requirements and Analysis team. We are responsible for building the bank’s Common Data Warehousing solution using state of the art cloud solutions. We add value by providing expert analysts and data modelling capabilities and expertise in the data warehousing and data integration areas for many solutions in the bank based on cloud-based technologies like Snowflake, and many other modern technologies.

Our team specializes in data analysis, data modelling, and data architecture. As IT Analyst you will play a crucial role in project development lifecycle.

Our technology stack includes, but is not limited to: Snowflake, DataStage, ETL Architecture, Cloud-based databases, Data Mesh, Data Vault.

We are looking for an IT Analyst to perform data analysis and data model transformation tasks. You will be working as an interface between business and IT to help translate the business requirements into IT mappings, as well as help understand data patterns and design innovative solutions.

What you will be doing:

  • Perform complex data analysis to help IT clarify requirements towards business and test use cases.
  • Map source data to target data models in the most optimal way (financial services logical data model).
  • Act as technical SME and help IT development teams in understanding the requirements

Who You Are

This is the right role for you if you have a passion for data analysis and problem solving. You are exceptionally good in interpersonal communications and proficient in English language.

Your background and skills include:

  • A degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • At least 5 years’ experience in IT.
  • Have worked with requirement management.
  • Experience of working in multinational virtual teams.
  • Understanding of Data Warehousing industry standards.
  • Understanding of ETL/BI/Data Analytics/Data Modelling processes.
  • Experience in writing SQL.
  • Proficiency in local language is preferred, as it supports collaboration with local teams and stakeholders.
  • Fluency in English is required to freely communicate with stakeholders.

It would be ideal if you also:

  • Having experience with Snowflake.
  • Having knowledge of Data Mesh, Data Virtualization, Data Vault.
  • Having experience working in SAFe environment.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 31/08/2025.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance. Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.

Only for candidates in Poland: Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:

In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’.
