Title: Product Analyst
Description:
In this role you will have the opportunity to drive and develop product analytics in the consumer domain, an area that evolves around the search experience on hemnet.se and in our apps. You will play an important role in the cross functional team that aims to develop and improve our products with a well-proven data and insight driven work method. It is all about understanding user behavior by gathering, interpreting and visualizing data to get powerful insights.

🛑 Last application day August 4th

What You’ll Do

As a Product Analyst at Hemnet, you’ll turn data into actionable insights that drive smarter decisions and shape the future of our product. You’ll be a key part of a cross-functional product team, bringing data into the heart of decision-making to improve user experiences and deepen our understanding of user behavior.

You’ll also be part of Hemnet’s Analytics team, working with other analysts and BI developers to support the entire organization with insights that help us reach our business goals. Together, you’ll contribute to the evolution of our analytics function and drive Hemnet in making faster and better decisions.

In this role, we place a strong emphasis on communication—you’re not just supporting product development, you’re actively driving it forward through insight and collaboration.

You’ll get to:


Drive the analytics work in the Consumer domain and act as a strategic partner on everything from prioritizations to hypothesis testing and insight-driven product development
Analyze user behavior and trends to uncover opportunities and inform product improvements
Build dashboards and reports that provide clear, actionable insights to your team
Design, run and evaluate A/B tests and other experiments to optimize the user experience
Be part of the broader Analytics team at Hemnet – collaborating with other product analysts and BI developers to strengthen how we work with data and insight across the whole company


What We Think You Bring

We’re looking for someone who can clearly communicate complex analyses to a wide range of stakeholders. Your ability to tailor messages, build trust, and turn data into action will be key to shaping product strategy and elevating the user experience.


Extensive experience as a product analyst, preferably in a tech environment, agile team, or data-driven company
Strong communication skills – you know how to turn data into clear insights and guide others to act on them
Solid skills in working with raw data and writing SQL queries
Experience using tools like Google BigQuery, Amplitude, Google Analytics, GTM, Looker Studio or or other similar analytics tools
Experience with experimentation, conversion optimization, and A/B testing
A curious and solution-oriented mindset – you enjoy finding new ways forward and challenging the status quo
For this role, we are looking for someone who has a professional proficiency in both Swedish and English


🏡 Your career at Hemnet

Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.

At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.

Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.

A Hybrid Way of Working

Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

Title: Head of Business Intelligence
Description:
Schibsted Marketing Services has the overall responsibility for all advertising revenue in Schibsted Norway and Sweden. The department is focused on strengthening Schibsted's premium position in the respective advertising markets by:


Providing advertising solutions that create documented effect for customers
Delivering products and services tailored to customer needs and potential
Streamlining processes from customer engagement through invoicing and payment
Forging strategic partnerships


Business Intelligence is a global function within DTO (Data Technology and Operations) department in Schibsted Marketing Services. The team consists of 5 dedicated BI specialists located in Stockholm. The overall mission of BI team is to empower Schibsted Marketing Services with the right information at the right time facilitating data-driven decisions.

Are you the new Head of Business Intelligence in Schibsted Marketing Services?

The Business Intelligence team is responsible for core management analysis and reporting in Schibsted Marketing Services. In addition to providing stable data sources for stakeholders, the BI team provides actionable insight for fact-based management decisions.

As Head of BI you will be hands on in our tech stack, a coaching leader for the team that contributes to the value increase of the existing data warehouse solution and are expected to drive the architectural vision. You are familiar with cloud architecture, preferably AWS, and a champion when it comes to data modelling, databases, the ETL-process and the area of sharing data with others. You are business interested and acknowledge and act on the potential structured data can have.

The position reports to Nicoline Vilpponen, Director of Ad Platform

Important Note:

You must have an existing work permit for this role.

Tasks:


Leadership responsibility of the team
Ensure that the team has the right expertise at all times
Contribute to projects and strategy processes in Schibsted Marketing Services
Hands on responsibility for technical operation, management and further development of the data warehouse, data flow and report.
Further develop super users and the organization's competence within our data and reports
Perform customer, market and competition analysis that includes historical data and prediction of expected behavior
Analyze data and compile reports and dashboard for both sales department and management


Preferred qualifications:


Minimum Bachelor's degree in IT
Operational management experience in business intelligence
Project management experience
Experience with databases and data modeling, preferably within the data warehouses world
Programming experience (eg Python, Scala, R, Matlab etc.)
Experience with presentation of data in programs such as Tableau or QlikView.
Experience with cloud architecture - preferably AWS (servers, databases, etc..)


Location: Stockholm

For questions about the position, please contact Director of Ad Platform,

Nicoline Vilpponen tfn: +47 92488863 nas@schibsted.no
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About us:

We are based in Stockholm and do technical consulting and managed services, with a focus on Data and Machine Learning Engineering.




We help clients architect, build, and run modern data platforms in the cloud, covering everything from data pipelines and governance to MLOps. Whether it’s analytics, automation, or deploying models in production, we enable our clients to turn data into insights and predictions that drive real business value.




About the role:

We are looking for skilled data engineers who are passionate about using their skills to help businesses make better decisions. As a consultant, you will work with clients to understand their data needs, design and implement solutions, and train them on how to use the data to improve their business.




The role involves both consulting projects and contributing to internal product and business development.




What you get:

You'll find a collaborative and fun environment where people are engaged and always willing to help each other out. We also have a lot of fun together, both inside and outside of work.




You can learn more about the role, as well as the perks and benefits we offer, on our website:

https://www.playgrounddata.io/join-us




Requirements: Minimum 3 years of experience in Data Engineering on the public cloud, and you must be based in the Stockholm area.




Buzzword bingo: AWS, Azure, GCP, Databricks, Snowflake, DBT, Python, SQL

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The role: Data Engineer




Data Engineer Position Profile: Osttra's AI & Analytics team is seeking a highly skilled Data Engineer with 3-5 years of experience to join our growing team in Stockholm, Sweden. You will play a critical role in building and maintaining our data platform in Google Cloud Platform (GCP), which supports a wide range of AI and BI initiatives across the organization. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of data engineering principles and hands-on experience with GCP and Python.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines using GCP services (BigQuery, Cloud Run, Google Cloud Storage, etc.)
Collaborate with AI engineers and data analysts to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions
Implement data quality checks and monitoring to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Optimise data processing for efficiency and cost-effectiveness
Contribute to the development of our overall data architecture and strategy
Design and implement infrastructure as code using tools like Terraform




What We're Looking For:




Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
3-5 years of experience in data engineering, with a focus on GCP
Experience with IaC and provisioning of infrastructure as code in a cloud environment.
Strong proficiency in Python and SQL
Experience with data modelling, Container platforms, ETL/ELT processes, and data warehousing
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and workflows is a plus
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Proficient in using version control systems (e.g., Git), CI/CD pipelines, and testing frameworks
Demonstrated interest or experience in financial markets




Benefits:

Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI and BI projects
Work with a talented and supportive team
Chance to make a real impact on the financial industry




About OSTTRA




Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.




OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.

With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.

Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.




Learn more at www.osttra.com.




What’s In It For You?




Benefits:

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.




Our benefits include:

Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.

For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries




-----------------------------------------------------------




Equal Opportunity Employer

S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

US Candidates Only: The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp_%20English_formattedESQA508c.pdf




-----------------------------------------------------------

20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)

Title: Attribution Analyst - Measurement & Analytics, Marketing
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking an Attribution Analyst to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This is a heavily analytical role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, media, and business impact. You’ll be responsible for conducting advanced attribution analyses that inform media investment decisions across the globe and drive marketing effectiveness across channels.

What You’ll Do  

As an Attribution Analyst, you will play a key role in how we measure and optimize the performance of our marketing efforts. Your key responsibilities will include:


Conduct attribution analysis using methods such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) and Regression-Based Attribution (RBA) to evaluate media channel effectiveness.
Support the development and evolution of our measurement framework to ensure it meets business needs and strategic requirements.
Gather, organize, and validate data from multiple media sources, ensuring consistency and accuracy across attribution models.
Generate actionable insights on media performance and recommend budget reallocations and strategy adjustments to improve ROI and support business growth.
Build and present reports and dashboards that clearly communicate attribution findings to stakeholders across marketing and media teams.
Work closely with the Attribution Lead to align on methodology, priorities, and roadmap.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including media, CRM, strategy, and finance to embed attribution insights into planning and execution.
Partner with our regional marketing teams to support local implementation of attribution insights and ensure global consistency.
Contribute to a test-and-learn culture by continuously monitoring campaign performance and refining attribution approaches.



Qualifications

WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH

In this role, you’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Marketing function and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams within the marketing unit—including media operations, CRM, strategy and planning, controlling, and technical product teams—as well as our regional marketing teams and the Attribution Lead to ensure that attribution insights are embedded in decision-making and drive measurable business impact.

Who You Are  


At least 3-5 years of experience with digital advertising, large marketing-related organizations, or measurement suppliers
Experience with advertising agencies or complex marketing data-driven organizations preferred
Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, attribution, or media mix modeling
Knowledge of digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Knowledge of digital media platforms & attribution such as Google Ads, meta ads, TikTok
Familiarity with privacy-first innovation for measurement systems
Strong business acumen with the ability to connect attribution insights to broader marketing and commercial objectives.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working in cross-functional teams and supporting marketing or media planning functions.
A collaborative team player with a proactive mindset and a passion for data-driven marketing in a fast-paced, global environment.



Additional Information

WHO WE ARE

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.  

We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  

WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.


25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).  
H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.  



JOIN US  

This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.

Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.  

Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.

 *We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

Job Description

We are seeking an Attribution Analyst to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This is a heavily analytical role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, media, and business impact. You’ll be responsible for conducting advanced attribution analyses that inform media investment decisions across the globe and drive marketing effectiveness across channels.

What You’ll Do  

As an Attribution Analyst, you will play a key role in how we measure and optimize the performance of our marketing efforts. Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Conduct attribution analysis using methods such as Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) and Regression-Based Attribution (RBA) to evaluate media channel effectiveness.
  • Support the development and evolution of our measurement framework to ensure it meets business needs and strategic requirements.
  • Gather, organize, and validate data from multiple media sources, ensuring consistency and accuracy across attribution models.

Additional Information

Title: Finance Analytics & BI Lead
Description:
We’ve signed up to an ambitious journey. Join us!

As Arrive, we guide customers and communities towards brighter futures and more livable cities, it isn’t a challenge just anyone could take on. Luckily, we have something to help us make it happen. Our people and our values. We Arrive Curious, Focused and Together. Just as our entire brand is inspired by the North Star, the shining light leading travelers to their destinations since time began, our values guide us. They help us be at our best. For our customers. For the cities and communities we serve. For ourselves. As a global team, we are transforming urban mobility. Let’s grow better, together.

The Role: Make Your Mark in a Data-Driven Finance Team

We process millions of parking transactions every month—and this number is only growing. Ensuring our financial data flows seamlessly and accurately across systems (from our parking platform to our ERP and BI tools) is essential. That’s where you come in.

You’ll work at the intersection of Finance and Technology—partnering closely with stakeholders, developing scalable ETL pipelines, and delivering trustworthy financial data models and reports.

🧠 Your Mission


Understand finance requirements and translate them into smart, scalable technical solutions.
Own ETL processes for financial data from systems like Snowflake and NetSuite ERP.
Develop, maintain, and optimize financial reports using tools like QlikSense, Looker, SQL, and dbt.
Ensure data consistency and accuracy across systems
Collaborate with cross-functional data and finance teams to drive automation and transformation initiatives.
Support the implementation of a global ERP system, including data migration and reporting.


🔍 Is This You?

You’re detail-driven and analytical, with the technical expertise and financial fluency to identify data inconsistencies and uncover insights. You’re not afraid to challenge the status quo, automate a clunky process, or dive deep into data to find the story.

Your background


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or BI Specialist working closely with Finance teams.
Strong ETL and data pipeline skills, with a solid grasp of data warehousing concepts.
Advanced SQL and experience with BI/reporting tools such as QlikSense, or Looker.
Understanding of financial reporting requirements and ERP data structures.
A degree in Finance, Mathematics, Engineering or related field (Master’s in Data/Analytics is a plus).
Bonus if you’ve worked with dbt, Planacy or Python.


🧩 The Team: Financial Systems & Data

You’ll Join a Collaborative Team Dedicated To


Streamlining financial processes through data and automation.
Supporting global finance reporting and compliance needs.
Driving adoption of financial tools that enhance insight and efficiency.
Managing data governance, accuracy, and security.


This role is based in Stockholm Sweden.

About Us

Arrive, including brands like EasyPark, Flowbird, RingGo, ParkMobile and Parkopedia, is a leading global mobility platform. Present in over 90 countries and 20,000 cities, the company helps people and decision-makers make smarter decisions about urban mobility and ease the experience of travel worldwide. Arrive delivers a unique combination of the core ingredients to make cities more livable: from smart payments and optimized car parks to data-driven traffic reduction and support for reinvestment in public transport and green space. It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

It’s about more than function, it’s about saving time and simplifying the experience of travel for everyone. Travel is more than a journey, it’s how you Arrive.

Title: Staff Data Scientist
Description:
Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?




Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 450 million active users per month.
Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.




As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team, you’ll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features like Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.




The impact you will create:

Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.




What you bring in:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
At least 7 years of experience in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
A track record leading data science projects in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
Excellent programming skills in Python, SQL
Solid understanding and experience with the tooling for Python - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
Strong problem-solving skills and a results-oriented mindset
Customer obsession
Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time




It would be great if you also have:

Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
Experience with data from mobile applications
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers




Life at Truecaller - Behind the code: https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/




Sounds like your dream job?

We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.




This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.




We only accept applications in English.




What we offer:

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
Great tech tools: Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
Office life: We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!




Come as you are:

Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you

Title: IT/Data/Business Analyst (Credit Risk)
Description:
emagine is looking for a IT/Data/Business Analyst within Credit Risk Area to one of our nordic banking clients.

Start date: ASAP

End date: 2026-03-31

Location: Stockholm (3 days on site, 2 days remote)

About:

We need a IT Analyst, Data Analyst or Business Analyst who has experience in IT SDLC process.

Profile:


Well versed and comfortable in handling Huge Datasets.
Minimum 8-10 years of IT experience and minimum 3-4 years of Analyst experience.
Good Analytical and problem-solving skills.
Should be able to understand the Business terminologies and act as a very good barrier between Business and IT development team.


Must Have:


Banking/Finance experience VITAL
Advanced Data Analyst who has profound experience in doing data Analysis using SQL. VITAL
Credit risk experience VITAL
Communication (stakeholder management) VITAL
Experience in IT SDLC process. VITAL
Minimum 8-10 years of IT experience and minimum 3-4 years of Analyst experience.


Good to have


Knowing SAS/Python is an added advantage.
Independently Convert the Business requirements into High level and low-level Solution design.
Added advantage in creating functional test cases and validating the results.
Should be able to support in UT, ST and end-to-end UAT testing.

Title: 2x Data Engineers
Description:
We are looking for 2 experienced Data Engineers that will join the client's Data Processing product area, to help us increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms, all while maintaining our global cloud cost efficiency. You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers the teams to process data to solve critical business needs.

WHAT YOU'LL DO:


Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
Help scale the new platform to reach targets that ensure the painless and seamless migration of data pipelines from all across the company to the new stack.
Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in the company to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are an experienced Data Engineer, also proficient in backend development using Java.
You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.


Period: 2025-08-18 to 2025-12-31
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
ComeOn Group in short

Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Managing a multi brand portfolio on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.

As our new data engineer, you will be involved in the design, development and maintenance of near real-time data streaming and batch data integrations for regulatory operational reporting, analytics and machine learning initiatives. This is a challenging role with huge growth potential as you will be helping to build the backbone where all our regulatory reporting data will flow through, as well as enabling our teams to gain deeper insights and drive business growth.

Responsibilities:


Design, build and maintain robust, scalable and reliable batch and streaming data pipelines in cloud environment
Assure quality and consistency of data by implementing best practises of data engineering
Troubleshoot and resolve issues with the data feeds
Assist, establish and maintain appropriate communication channels with business and technical teams in the context of company data assets
Work with all parts of the system and through all stages of the development process from analysis to release
Manage infrastructure using terraform and ensure efficient deployment of data services


About you:


Experienced data engineer with 3+ years in data integration / real time streaming / data warehousing
Excellent command of spoken English
Keen attention to detail and data quality
Experience in programming in Scala or Java
Experience in streaming big data sets with Spark, Flink, Kafka or similar
Experience with AWS or GCP Cloud data processing solutions
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment whilst interacting with a variety of different disciplines
Proven ability to prioritise and deal with problems systematically and provide clear communications regarding the issues, resolution times and solutions
Experience with IaC tools like Terraform and deployment tools like Gitlab Runners, Github Actions or similar


& then some nice to haves...


Hold an academic degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science or mathematics
Experience within the iGaming industry and / or regulatory aspect of iGaming would be considered an asset
Experience in SQL query writing and optimisation
Experience with Airflow in GCP environment
Experience in business analysis and requirements gathering
Experience with data warehousing will be considered an asset


So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?


A competitive remuneration package! 💰
Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events 😎
A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we're truly Hybrid!)
On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
30 paid vacation days a year
Generous pension and insurance benefits
Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
Generous health subsidy benefit
Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers


At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.

At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.

Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!

HTML:
ComeOn Group in short

Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Managing a multi brand portfolio on its proprietary platform providing a secure, innovative and entertainment-led player experience across casino and sports betting. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.

As our new data engineer, you will be involved in the design, development and maintenance of near real-time data streaming and batch data integrations for regulatory operational reporting, analytics and machine learning initiatives. This is a challenging role with huge growth potential as you will be helping to build the backbone where all our regulatory reporting data will flow through, as well as enabling our teams to gain deeper insights and drive business growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, build and maintain robust, scalable and reliable batch and streaming data pipelines in cloud environment
  • Assure quality and consistency of data by implementing best practises of data engineering
  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues with the data feeds
  • Assist, establish and maintain appropriate communication channels with business and technical teams in the context of company data assets
  • Work with all parts of the system and through all stages of the development process from analysis to release
  • Manage infrastructure using terraform and ensure efficient deployment of data services

About you:

  • Experienced data engineer with 3+ years in data integration / real time streaming / data warehousing
  • Excellent command of spoken English
  • Keen attention to detail and data quality
  • Experience in programming in Scala or Java
  • Experience in streaming big data sets with Spark, Flink, Kafka or similar
  • Experience with AWS or GCP Cloud data processing solutions
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment whilst interacting with a variety of different disciplines
  • Proven ability to prioritise and deal with problems systematically and provide clear communications regarding the issues, resolution times and solutions
  • Experience with IaC tools like Terraform and deployment tools like Gitlab Runners, Github Actions or similar

& then some nice to haves...

  • Hold an academic degree in a quantitative discipline such as computer science or mathematics
  • Experience within the iGaming industry and / or regulatory aspect of iGaming would be considered an asset
  • Experience in SQL query writing and optimisation
  • Experience with Airflow in GCP environment
  • Experience in business analysis and requirements gathering
  • Experience with data warehousing will be considered an asset

So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?

  • A competitive remuneration package! 💰
  • Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events 😎
  • A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we're truly Hybrid!)
  • On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere 🌎
  • 30 paid vacation days a year
  • Generous pension and insurance benefits
  • Brand new laptop and smartphone with fully paid plan
  • Generous health subsidy benefit
  • Company events, including breakfast mornings and Friday beers

At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.

Title: Integrationsutvecklare - sökes till Accelerate at Iver
Description:
Nu letar vi efter nya medarbetare som vill vara med på vår resa. Som en del av Accelerate at Iver ligger du i teknikens absoluta framkant och arbetar med spännande digitaliserings- och transformationsprojekt hos marknadsledande kunder. Vi är idag över 300 konsulter som brinner för att realisera digitala möjligheter i molnet. Tillsammans med våra kunder stänger vi gapet mellan aspiration och framgångsrik implementation. Nu söker vi en Integrationsutvecklare som vill bli en del av Accelerate at Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?

Din roll på Accelerate at Iver?

Som integrationsutvecklare hos Accelerate at Iver kommer du att bidra till att bygga robusta, moderna och långsiktiga integrationslösningar. Lösningarna byggs främst på Microsoft-teknologi, både cloud och on-prem.

Vi söker en social och lösningsorienterad person som trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Du har ett stort driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad inom den senaste tekniken.

Vill du vara en del av vårt team och bidra till att bygga framtidens integrationslösningar? 

Dina Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar


Utveckling & Implementering: Erfarenhet av att ta fram teknisk och funktionell design för integrationslösningar. Samarbeta med integrationsarkitekter för att utveckla lösningar som uppfyller både verksamhetsmål och tekniska principer.
Kodkvalitet & Optimering: Säkerställ högkvalitativ, underhållbar och återanvändbar kod. Förbättra befintliga integrationer för att uppnå bättre skalbarhet, säkerhet och prestanda.
Samarbete: Arbeta självständigt eller i team tillsammans med bland annat projektledare, arkitekter, testare och produktägare.
Support & Underhåll: Bidra till det löpande underhållet och utvecklingen av integrationslösningar.


Vad erbjuder vi dig?

Accelerate at Iver kan erbjuda dig ett utmanande och varierande jobb som konsult med stora personliga utvecklingsmöjligheter! Vi satsar hårt på kompetensutveckling och att ständigt hålla oss i teknisk framkant.

Hos Accelerate at Iver får du utvecklas tillsammans med duktiga och erfarna kollegor som har arbetat med C#, .Net Core och Microservices i flera stora och utmanade projekt de senaste åren. Våra kunder är nationella och globala både medel och stora bolag.

Vi har intressanta, långsiktiga uppdrag och team-leveranser där du kan utvecklas och arbeta nära kollegor som delar din passion för teknik.

Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver får du ett antal fördelar som:


En trygg och säker anställning
Individuellt anpassad utvecklings- och utbildningsplan
Friskvårdsbidrag
Hälso & sjukvårdsförsäkring
Pensions och försäkringsrådgivning
Förmånsportal
Timbank & volontärdag
Medarbetar och familjeaktiviteter i olika former


Vi Söker Dig Som Har

Erfarenhet av att arbeta med teknologier som:


C#, .NET Core, .NET Framework, XML, JSON, REST-APIer, Biceps
Azure Integration Services: Logic Apps, Service Bus, Azure Functions, Azure API Management
SQL Server, Azure SQL
Azure, men meriterande med erfarenhet av andra plattformar såsom BizTalk, Mulesoft eller andra plattformar


Kunskap om verktyg som Microsoft Visual Studio/Visual Studio Code, Postman, Git och Azure DevOps.

Minst 2–4 års erfarenhet inom integrationsutveckling

Du bör ha jobbat i agila team med scrum- eller kanban som arbetssätt, och vara van vid de olika rollerna och rollfördelningen som ett sådant arbetssätt innebär.

För att trivas i rollen som konsult bör du ha lätt att skapa relationer, kunna arbeta både i team och självständigt och ha stor personlig drivkraft och lösningsfokus.

Är du en social, flexibel och strukturerad person med stort intresse inom av arbeta med och att utvecklas inom de senaste teknologierna så tror vi du kommer passa in och trivas utmärkt hos oss!

För denna position krävs Svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.

Placeringsort

Iver finns på 25 platser i Sverige & Norge. För denna roll ser vi att du utgår från ett av våra kontor i Stockholm.

Sök till oss!

Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag. Accelerate at Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Du är välkommen att kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Välkommen till Accelerate at Iver!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Att jobba som data engineer

Som data engineer kommer du tillhöra vårt Data & Analytics team som är organiserat inom Finance för att stötta hela Skandias verksamhet. Teamet består av arkitekter, systemutvecklare och verksamhetsutvecklare som alla sitter på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm. Vi är med och bidrar till Skandias digitaliseringsresa genom att etablera ett nytt informationsförsörjningssystem och förbättrade analyticsförmågor. Vi säkerställer att rätt data finns tillgänglig på ett effektivt och säkert sätt.

I rollen kommer du bidra till att vi på Skandia ska bli ännu mer datadrivna i våra analyser och beslut där uppdraget spänner sig från kravanalys till färdiga insikter.

Några Exempel På Arbetsuppgifter Är


Kravarbete – förstå affärsutmaningar och omvandla dem till datadrivna lösningar för analys och rapportering.
Datamodellering & visualisering – analysera, modellera och visualisera data från flera källor och domäner i Tableau och Power BI.
Avancerad analys – utnyttja Python/R, Machine Learning och Advanced Analytics för att skapa prediktiva och preskriptiva insikter.
Kommunikation – presentera resultat pedagogiskt för både teknik- och affärssidan.


Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till chefen för Data & Analytics.

För att lyckas i rollen

Som person är du strukturerad, analytisk och kan kommunicera med andra intressenter både internt och externt. Du har ett teknikintresse och stöttar andra medarbetare i ditt vardagliga arbete.

För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har några års erfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Analyst, BI-specialist eller motsvarande. Du har en vana att hantera stora och komplexa datamängder både “on-prem” och i moln-miljöer, gärna Azure eller Snowflake. Vidare har du kunskap i SQL samt erfarenhet av ETL-verktyg. Du har även kunskap i Python och/eller R för databearbetning och analys. Ett grundkrav för rollen är att du kan svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift.

Meriterande är om du har en relevant högskoleutbildning eller har jobbat inom bank-, finans- eller försäkringsområdet sedan tidigare.

Vad händer nu?

Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.

Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Hellen Malmberg på hellen.malmberg@skandia.se.

Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquistion Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.

Vi tar nu en kort paus för sommarledighet. Urvalet påbörjas i augusti och vi kontaktar dig så snart vi är tillbaka.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Mer om Finance

Inom Finance arbetar vi framåt tillsammans för att vara en affärsnära partner och skapa långsiktigt värde för Skandia. Totalt sett består vi av fem olika avdelningar med ungefär 120 medarbetare som alla sitter i Stockholm på Lindhagensgatan 86.

Våra avdelningar inom Finance är: Finance Transformation & Infomation , Accounting & Reporting, Aktuarie & Modellering, Inköp & Support samt Group Planning & Control.

Tillsammans strävar vi efter att skapa ett effektivt och värdeskapande Finance. Vi arbetar proaktivt för att säkerställa effektiva kärnprocesser genom att följa externa och interna krav. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att stödja koncernledningen med analyser och strategiska beslutsunderlag samt övriga verksamhetsområden inom koncernen. Vi stödjer även våra funktioner med finansiell analys och rapportering. Vårt gemensamma arbete ska hålla hög kvalitet och skapa värde för Skandia. Tillsammans optimerar vi financeområdet genom nya teknologier, arbetssätt och kompetenser. Detta åstadkommer vi genom gott ledarskap, samarbete och engagemang.


Show more

Title: Analytiker inom ledningsstöd och analys i Stockholm
Description:
Placeringsort StockholmDiarienummer FK 2025/016652

Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster

Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan cirka 20 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför sätter vi oss in i varje ärende, följer lagar och regler, informerar och vägleder, bryr oss och visar omtanke. Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar. Välkommen till Försäkringskassan.

Området Officiell statistik ansvarar för Försäkringskassans uppdrag som statistikansvarig myndighet inom socialförsäkringsområdet. Vi kan erbjuda dig stor variation i arbetsuppgifterna där du kommer att röra dig i gränslandet mellan IT, data, programmering, statistik, juridik, kommunikation och analys. Ditt arbete kommer att spela en viktig roll för kunskapsbyggande, forskning och i samhällsdebatten.

Analytiker med inriktning statistik och programmering

Vi söker nu en samhällsintresserad analytiker med goda programmeringskunskaper som vill vara med och vidareutveckla Försäkringskassans data och statistik till område Officiell statistik.

Tillsammans med andra analytiker och på egen hand, arbetar du med att utveckla och sprida myndighetens officiella statistik om socialförsäkringen. Du arbetar med utveckling av Försäkringskassans datalager och bearbetar registerdata. Data ska sättas i ett sammanhang och ge förutsättningar för vidare arbete inom eller utanför vår myndighet. Du är noggrann, jobbar systematiskt och kan hantera flera olika arbetsuppgifter under en dag. Som myndighet jobbar vi med klarspråk. Det ställer krav på att du har god förmåga att uttrycka dig och kan förklara komplexa frågor och samband på ett enkelt sätt. Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.

Det Innebär Att


du använder SAS för att bearbeta och utveckla data från Försäkringskassans datalager för att ta fram samhällsrelevant och efterfrågad statistik
du är med och tar fram och sammanställer mikrodata till forskare och andra myndigheter
du tillgängliggör och sprider statistiken genom vår hemsida och vår statistikdatabas
du ger våra intressenter stöd till tolkning av statistiken, både muntligt och skriftligt
du arbetar både enskilt och tillsammans med andra analytiker, verksamhetsutvecklare, IT-arkitekter, specialister, systemutvecklare och kommunikatörer
du kan arbeta med flera olika arbetsuppgifter under en dag
du kan arbeta med samordnande roller som t.ex. att ansvara för områdets datautlämningar. Det innebär att du behöver kunna arbeta administrativt med beställningar av data från externa parter såsom forskare och andra myndigheter.


Vi söker dig som


har högskoleexamen inom företrädesvis samhälls- eller systemvetenskapliga ämnen med inriktning statistik eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
har erfarenhet av att använda programmeringsverktyg för statistikframställning i tidigare arbete
har erfarenhet av att arbeta med och analysera stora mängder data
är bra på att samarbeta
kan prioritera och driva frågor på egen hand
kan uttrycka dig tydligt och pedagogiskt på svenska i tal och skrift
har intresse av att arbeta med samhällsfrågor.


Det är meriterande om du


har erfarenhet av SQL- eller SAS programmering
har erfarenhet av arbete med förädling av stora datamängder i syfte att underlätta analysarbete
har erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila IT-utvecklingsprojekt.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.

Övrigt

En tjänst, tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering och en anställning hos oss kan även innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. I den här rekryteringen kan arbetspsykologiska test användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsort: Stockholm, Telefonplan med möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till två dagar per vecka.

Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs

Kontaktpersoner

Chef: Andrea Kolk, 010-116 92 26 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Emil Jarengrim, emil.jarengrim@forsakringskassan.se, (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). ST: Carolina Mancho, 010-116 28 80 Saco-S: Lars-Göran Karlsson, 010-116 92 52, Seko: Johanna Grundström, 010-115 30 44.

Ansökan

Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 24 augusti 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.

Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id ringer du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.

Vi ska i allt vi gör, agera med utgångspunkt i principen om alla människors lika värde, rättssäkerhet och med god service till medborgarna.
Show more
HTML:
Placeringsort StockholmDiarienummer FK 2025/016652

Logga in och sök jobbet Öppnas i nytt fönster

Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan cirka 20 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför sätter vi oss in i varje ärende, följer lagar och regler, informerar och vägleder, bryr oss och visar omtanke. Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar. Välkommen till Försäkringskassan.

Området Officiell statistik ansvarar för Försäkringskassans uppdrag som statistikansvarig myndighet inom socialförsäkringsområdet. Vi kan erbjuda dig stor variation i arbetsuppgifterna där du kommer att röra dig i gränslandet mellan IT, data, programmering, statistik, juridik, kommunikation och analys. Ditt arbete kommer att spela en viktig roll för kunskapsbyggande, forskning och i samhällsdebatten.

Analytiker med inriktning statistik och programmering

Det ställer krav på att du har god förmåga att uttrycka dig och kan förklara komplexa frågor och samband på ett enkelt sätt. Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.

  • du tillgängliggör och sprider statistiken genom vår hemsida och vår statistikdatabas
  • du ger våra intressenter stöd till tolkning av statistiken, både muntligt och skriftligt
  • du arbetar både enskilt och tillsammans med andra analytiker, verksamhetsutvecklare, IT-arkitekter, specialister, systemutvecklare och kommunikatörer
  • du kan arbeta med flera olika arbetsuppgifter under en dag
  • du kan arbeta med samordnande roller som t.ex. att ansvara för områdets datautlämningar. Det innebär att du behöver kunna arbeta administrativt med beställningar av data från externa parter såsom forskare och andra myndigheter.

Vi söker dig som

  • har högskoleexamen inom företrädesvis samhälls- eller systemvetenskapliga ämnen med inriktning statistik eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga

  • kan prioritera och driva frågor på egen hand
  • kan uttrycka dig tydligt och pedagogiskt på svenska i tal och skrift
  • har intresse av att arbeta med samhällsfrågor.

Det är meriterande om du

  • har erfarenhet av SQL- eller SAS programmering
  • har erfarenhet av arbete med förädling av stora datamängder i syfte att underlätta analysarbete
  • har erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila IT-utvecklingsprojekt.

I enlighet med Försäkringskassans riktlinje för säkerhet genomförs bakgrundskontroller i denna rekrytering och en anställning hos oss kan även innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I have a new role for an experienced Data Engineer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.




There are based both in Stockholm and this is a Hybrid position.




Responsibilities:

Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.
Use various technologies and resources to achieve desired results: SQL Server, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Lakehouse, etc.
Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.




Tech Stack - Microsoft Technologies




Salary - Up to 70,000 SEK p/m Depending on experience




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Microsoft tool (Power BI / SQL / Databricks / Azure / Fabric)
Fluent Swedish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Title: Dataanalytiker inom kreditrisk
Description:
Letar du efter en möjlighet att få jobba med dataanalys och samtidigt lära dig mer om kreditrisk?

Hos oss på Swedbank har du en möjlighet att:


Analysera data relaterat till bankens låneportfölj och ta fram underlag som används för intern styrning och uppföljning
Förbättra befintliga och utveckla nya metoder för analys av kreditrisk
Automatisera manuella processer, t.ex. genom att skapa dashboards i Power BI
Arbeta i en varierad arbetsmiljö där utveckling av nya metoder och projekt kombineras med återkommande analyser som följer utvecklingen av bankens kreditrisk



I denna roll behöver du:


En universitetsexamen i något kvantitativt område, t.ex. civilingenjör, statistik, datavetenskap eller liknande
Kunskap inom programmering och vana att arbeta med stora datamängder i t.ex. SQL och SAS
God kommunikationsförmåga såväl på engelska som svenska i både tal och skrift
Ett analytiskt tankesätt, vilja att lära sig och utvecklas och dela med sig av sina kunskaper till kollegor
Erfarenhet från versionshantering med Git och GitHub är meriterande men inte ett krav
Kunskap inom BI verktyg som Power BI är meriterande men inte ett krav
Tidigare erfarenhet från arbete inom bank och kreditrisk är meriterande men inte ett krav



Hos oss kan du uppleva:


Personlig och professionell utveckling genom självledarskap och kontinuerlig utveckling.
Meningsfullt arbete som positivt påverkar vår arbetsplats, våra kunder och samhället.
En öppen och samarbetsinriktad kultur som uppmuntrar tvärfunktionellt teamarbete och erbjuder nätverksmöjligheter.
En stöttande och inkluderande miljö som främjar en balanserad och hållbar arbetslivssituation, med flexibla arbetsförhållanden när det passar rollen.
Förmåner såsom vårt erbjudanden för bankprodukter för anställda, tjänstepensionsplan, aktiebaserade belöningsprogram Eken, och frivillig gruppförsäkring.



"Bli en del av vårt team och...

forma din framtid! Välkommen till en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får ta ansvar, fatta egna beslut och driva arbetet framåt. Tillsammans med engagerade och kompetenta kollegor kommer du att analysera och mäta riskutvecklingen inom Swedbanks kreditportfölj, vilket ger dig chansen att fördjupa din förståelse för kreditrisk och datahantering. Vi värdesätter frihet under ansvar och tror på att upprätthålla en harmonisk balans mellan arbete och fritid. Här har du möjligheten att växa både professionellt och som individ!" Karin Svensson, din framtida chef

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan senast den 2025-08-31.

Placeringsort: Sundbyberg

Rekryterande chef: Karin Svensson

Vänligen observera att rekryteringsarbetet kan ta lite längre tid än normalt då det är sommarsemester.

Vi har gjort vårt medieval för rekrytering och undanber oss därför kontakt med annonssäljare eller säljare av andra rekryteringstjänster.

Swedbank är en inkluderande arbetsgivare och diskriminerar ingen utifrån kön, ålder, sexuell läggning eller sexuell identitet, etnicitet, religion eller funktionsnedsättning - alla är välkomna.


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service is looking for a Data Engineer to join the band in a consultant assignment. The client has transformed music listening forever when launched in 2008.




Period: 2025-08-18 to 2025-12-31 (full-time), with a possibility of extension.




About the role

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer that will join the client's Data Processing product area, in LilEngine squad, to help the team increase productivity, optionality and flexibility for data practitioners through scalable, portable and reliable data processing platforms, all while maintaining our global cloud cost efficiency. You’ll collaborate with product and engineering to build and support the infrastructure that empowers the teams to process data to solve critical business needs. Above all, your work will impact the way the world experiences music.




What you'll do

Increase developer productivity by building innovative tools that reduce overhead of working with data pipelines, help increase platform reliability, and are cost-efficient.
Help scale the new platform to reach targets that ensure the painless and seamless migration of data pipelines from all across the company to the new stack.
Work with engineers with deep expertise in data and collaborate closely with squads in the company to drive improvements in the data processing ecosystem through support, best-practices and standards.




Who you are

You are an experienced Data Engineer, also proficient in backend development using Java.
You are comfortable working with big data using SQL and data analytics platforms such as BigQuery.
You have experience with one or more higher-level JVM-based data processing frameworks such as Flink, Beam, Dataflow, Spark, etc.
Devops is part of your day-to-day work and you are used to working with cloud-based infrastructure and services, containerised applications.
You have some experience working with Kubernetes and are familiar with its basic concepts.
You have experience of working with data engineering pipelines in Scala and/or Python.
Quality is important to you and you know what it means to ship high-quality code.
You appreciate agile software processes, and sound engineering practices like continuous delivery, defensive programming, and automated testing.
You love working in an environment where you constantly experiment and iterate quickly.
You are comfortable with ambiguity, enjoy working on open ended problems, and believe data is the most powerful tool for informed decision-making.




We are Market Partner

Market Partner is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome to our community regardless of who you are, no matter where you come from, or what you look like. We apply ongoing selection and may fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Microsoft Specialised - Senior Data Engineer




Looking for a role where you can shape meaningful projects, grow your skills, and actually enjoy the people you work with?




We’re working with a specialist Microsoft data consultancy in Sweden that blends the best of both worlds:




“The opportunities of the big company. The thoughtfulness of the small company.”




They’re part of a larger tech group, which gives them access to a broad client base and long-term projects across industries like finance, defence, public sector, and retail. But day-to-day, you’ll be part of a close-knit 45-person consultancy that values autonomy, collaboration, and community.




This team is known for its award-winning culture - consistently ranked among Europe’s best workplaces, based on employee feedback. They invest heavily in knowledge-sharing, competence development, and creating an environment where engineers genuinely enjoy their work.




🔍 The Role

Work on client projects where you’ll build and run data platforms from the ground up
Collaborate with experienced engineers in a high-trust, low-hierarchy environment
Focus on backend data engineering (not front-end BI/reporting)
Tech stack includes Python, PySpark, Databricks, CI/CD, orchestration, and Terraform
Microsoft Fabric experience is a bonus, but not essential




✅ What They’re Looking For

3+ years of experience in data engineering (especially from long-term projects at major banks, insurers, or public sector clients)
Strong backend engineering skills and a solid understanding of modern data platforms
A collaborative mindset and eagerness to contribute to a knowledge-sharing culture
Curiosity, autonomy, and a desire to grow in a supportive, people-first environment




🌟 Why Join?

7 weeks vacation!!!
Full flexibility in how much you work and what you learn - no cap on development
Regular conferences abroad, social events, and a strong internal community
A simple, human interview process - just a conversation to see if there’s a mutual fit
A team that genuinely enjoys working together and takes pride in doing great work




If you’re looking for a role that combines meaningful projects with a genuinely great place to do them, this could be the one.

Show more

✅ What They’re Looking For

  • 3+ years of experience in data engineering (especially from long-term projects at major banks, insurers, or public sector clients)
  • Strong backend engineering skills and a solid understanding of modern data platforms
  • A collaborative mindset and eagerness to contribute to a knowledge-sharing culture
  • Curiosity, autonomy, and a desire to grow in a supportive, people-first environment


🌟 Why Join?

  • 7 weeks vacation!!!
  • Full flexibility in how much you work and what you learn - no cap on development
  • Regular conferences abroad, social events, and a strong internal community
  • A simple, human interview process - just a conversation to see if there’s a mutual fit
  • A team that genuinely enjoys working together and takes pride in doing great work


If you’re looking for a role that combines meaningful projects with a genuinely great place to do them, this could be the one.

Title: Uppdragsbeskrivning:
Description:
Uppdragsbeskrivning

Ett utvecklingsteam inom digital matchningstjänst söker en konsult inom backendutveckling för arbete med nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av en tjänst för platsannonsering. Arbetet sker främst i Java och Spring Boot, i nära samarbete med teammedlemmar som testare, systemutvecklare, scrum master och produktägare. Samverkan sker även med andra utvecklings- och plattformsteam, med fokus på kontinuerlig leverans. Kvalitet är en prioritet och utvecklingsmiljön är komplex.

Konsulten förväntas vara tillgänglig för intervju vid behov.

Obligatoriska Krav


Kompetensnivå 3 (motsvarande 4–8 års erfarenhet).
Minst tre (3) års dokumenterad erfarenhet av Javautveckling.
Minst tre (3) års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling med Spring Framework.
Minst tre (3) års dokumenterad erfarenhet av utveckling av REST API:er för webbtjänster.
Praktisk erfarenhet och kunskap om CI/CD-verktyg i containerbaserade miljöer.
Erfarenhet av Git/Bitbucket och OpenShift, inklusive konfiguration och förvaltning.
Dokumenterad erfarenhet av arbete i autonoma agila utvecklingsteam.
Erfarenhet av att arbeta enligt SCRUM och god förståelse för dess ceremonier samt användning av verktyg som Jira och Confluence.
Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på svenska i både tal och skrift.


Meriterande Erfarenheter


Erfarenhet av clean code-principer.
Erfarenhet av komplexa utvecklingsmiljöer med många systemintegrationer.
Erfarenhet av incidenthantering, drift, förvaltning och nyutveckling.
Förmåga att samarbeta effektivt i team, bidra till förbättringsarbete, ta styrning från produktledning samt driva egna åtaganden samtidigt som ansvar tas för hela teamets leveranser.


Placering


Stationeringsort är Stockholm. Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 49 % kan diskuteras med ansvarig chef.


Uppdragsperiod


Start: 26 maj 2025
Varaktighet: 1 år, med option på förlängning i ytterligare 11 månader.


Omfattning


Heltid, 100 %.


Om Rasulson Consulting

Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.
Show more

Title: Business Systems Analyst, Workforce Management
Description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

At Wolt, people are our most important asset. The People Technology Team helps to deliver and facilitate strategic technology projects within the People Team. This role will be focused on supporting our People Technology function as we continue to optimize the advancement of our organization. We’re looking for business system analysts to help us scale Wolt + DoorDash’s enormous growth. Come help shape a best in class People Technology team!

About The Role

We are looking for a Business System Analyst with demonstrated HRIS experience to assist with strategic initiatives across our organization. Experience with Workday HCM is preferable for this role. You will work cross-functionally to achieve business goals through system configuration, testing and documentation. As a Business System Analyst you will help deliver solutions to support business strategy, and assist in the implementation, maintenance and enhancement of people technology systems.

Please note that this position is initially open through a 12-month contract.

What you’ll be doing


Play an integral role in the configuration, testing, support, and success of People Technology at DoorDash/Wolt as we grow our existing businesses and enter new verticals, and additional countries
Work to uncover underlying issues or business problems and turn those issues into solutions
Identify, prioritize, and implement best practices from a solutions perspective based on gathered requirements
Support system troubleshooting, configuration, testing, and deployment of assigned applications to meet requirements, timelines, and execution standards
Support high-volume data loads via Enterprise Interface Builder (EIB) templates
Provide global production analysis and support (break/fix analysis, reporting, business process administration, etc.)
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ascertain and maintain the best possible configuration solution
Rigorously document system requirements and configuration to build operational excellence
Ensure data integrity by understanding and identifying opportunities to improve, working closely with cross-functional teams
Train end-users and peers on new processes and functionality as needed


Our humble expectations


You have 1+ years of work experience in Workday maintenance/configuration, both domestic and international.
You are passionate about system optimization and employee experience
You are a strong business thinker, able to use ‘first principles’ to solve challenging business problems at their root level
You are data-driven, able to analyze data with strong attention to detail and accuracy, and passionate about telling the story behind the data hence turning the data into configuration
You are a self-motivated, rapid learner, excited about further developing your analytical and problem-solving skills
You are results-oriented, always evaluating whether our team's activities are achieving the desired, measurable impact
You are an owner, always looking for opportunities to learn and better your work product
You are comfortable and thrive in a fast-paced, continually changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously.
You have a BA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience
You have an analytical mindset and a “People First” mentality with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data and creating configuration solutions based on that data
You have strong written/verbal communication


Next steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our job portal.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.
Show more

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

Please note that we do not accept applications coming in via email. Please submit your application in English via our job portal.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

Title: Google Data Engineer
Description:
Google Data Engineer




We are seeking a skilled and motivated Google Data Engineer to join our client’s forward-thinking data team. This role offers the opportunity to work on innovative data products, leveraging modern cloud technologies, with a strong focus on GCP (Google Cloud Platform), DevOps, and advanced data engineering practices. You'll take end-to-end ownership of both existing and greenfield data solutions, helping deliver high-value insights and scalable data architectures.




Key Responsibilities:

Take end-to-end responsibility for building, optimizing, and supporting data products aligned to the target data vision.
Champion a DevOps mindset, managing CI/CD pipelines, Terraform, and cloud infrastructure (GCP).
Transform data into meaningful insights using DBT and BigQuery.
Ensure all data products are independently deployable and adhere to standards for security, scalability, observability, and performance.
Collaborate with Product Owners and stakeholders to refine existing data products and shape new ones.
Contribute to cross-functional initiatives related to data mesh architecture.
Drive continuous improvement and actively reduce technical debt.
Stay current on the latest in data engineering and cloud technologies.
Participate in root cause analysis and problem resolution to ensure system reliability.

Required Skills & Experience:

4+ years of hands-on experience as a Data Engineer on modern cloud data platforms or in advanced analytics environments.
Strong hands-on experience with DBT and BigQuery.
Hands-on experience with GCP tools such as Dataflow, Dataproc, and BigQuery.
Familiarity with data processing frameworks: Apache Beam, Spark, Hive, or Flink.
Proficiency in data query languages such as SQL.
Experience with data-centric programming using Python, Java, and/or Scala.
Understanding of various data formats (e.g., Avro, Parquet).
Solid grasp of data modelling techniques and trade-offs.
Experience with both NoSQL and RDBMS databases.
Knowledge of CI/CD, Terraform, and infrastructure-as-code concepts.
Collaborative mindset with strong communication skills.
Self-starter comfortable working independently and making decisions.
Experience with data visualization tools.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.




Desirable Skills:

Understanding of data mesh principles and distributed data architecture.

Show more
