Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you thrive at the intersection of data and strategy? Are you excited about turning complex analytics into impactful marketing insights? Then you might be our new Marketing Data Analyst, ready to join our dynamic and international marketing team!

First, who on earth is Dalux?

Dalux is an innovative Contech company committed to push the boundaries of how technology can secure a smarter and more efficient construction and real estate industry. Today we provide our user-friendly digital tools and BIM Technology (3D information models) to leading contractors and advisors in more than 147 countries. And we are not slowing down our expansion journey anytime soon, so this is a great time to join us and directly influence the future of Dalux! Today we are present in 24 countries and counting, and therefore this is a great time to join us, and directly influence the future of Dalux!

Awesome! But what will my new role be?

In this role, you’ll work at the intersection of data and marketing, analyzing and interpreting data from a wide variety of marketing channels such as ads, social media, website performance, webinars, events, and more. Your insights will drive decision-making, shape marketing strategies, and optimize performance across the organization.

Your responsibilities will include:


Collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data from various marketing sources (e.g., Google Analytics, Google Ads, social platforms, events, webinars).
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports using tools like Power BI, SQL, and Access.
Providing actionable insights to optimize campaign performance and achieve marketing goals.
Collaborating with Performance Marketing and other teams (Content, Events, Commercial Revenue Operations) to align on data-driven strategies.
Monitoring and reporting on KPIs, campaign ROI, and trends to guide both short-term and long-term planning.
Identifying areas of opportunity and proposing data-informed strategies for growth and efficiency.


Sure, sounds exciting! How can I be considered for this role?

You have +5 years of experience in marketing data analysis or a related field, with proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and Microsoft Access. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics and Google Ads dashboards, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills, are essential. Experience visualizing data for non-technical stakeholders and strong collaboration skills are also key.

Preferred qualifications include experience in performance marketing or commercial revenue operations, familiarity with A/B testing, and additional data visualization tools.

If you’re collaborative, curious, and eager to learn, you’ll thrive in our supportive and creative environment.

Why Choose Dalux?

At Dalux, we care—not just about our work and customers but about each other. We believe in creating a work environment that is light-hearted, informal, and welcoming, with room for everyone. Forget fancy titles and rigid dress codes; we’re here to make your work life both rewarding and enjoyable.

At our HQ in Østerbro, you’ll join a team of 17 skilled colleagues dedicated to driving high customer engagement. Networking with our users is our passion, and we deliver great content, engaging events, and cutting-edge ConTech insights.

Being part of a social company, you’ll also enjoy activities like wine tasting, running club, knitting club, and more. At Dalux, your personal and professional growth is important to us.

Application deadline:

As soon as possible

Title: Senior Specialist, Data and Analytics
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Senior Specialist, Data & Analytics

Customer, Loyalty & Marketing

Type of Employment: Permanent

Location: Copenhagen, Denmark

Visa requirements: A valid work permit from the EU/EEA (relocation assistance is not provided)

THE ROLE

As a member of the Global Data & Analytics Team, the Senior Specialist is an everyday partner with the European Loyalty team centrally and across business units. In this role, you’ll be responsible for doing data analysis and delivering insights into one of the top loyalty programs globally. You will have a unique opportunity to get to know our business through our data, influence how this program develops, and grow and learn professionally.

Our Global Loyalty program is one of our most valuable assets, boasting millions of members across North America and Europe. Highly data-driven and innovative, the program leverages advanced segmentation, behavioral analysis, and predictive modeling to create personalized offers that enhance customer engagement and long-term value. As the program continues to grow rapidly, it plays a critical role in building lasting relationships and driving our business forward.

What You’ll Do


Work closely with Loyalty Managers and our Loyalty Analytics team to do data analysis and provide fact based actionable insights into our CRM communications (all direct marketing efforts including e-mail, SMS, and push notifications)
Devise and implement Customer Science and Automation work such as Customer Segmentations, Personalization, Churn Prevention, Fraud Detection, Customer Lifetime Value into the Loyalty Analytics ecosystem
Independently carry out ad-hoc analytical support to business stakeholders to achieve key business objectives and to guide and support data-driven decision-making using test and
control analytics, dashboard analytics, benchmarking, statistical concepts, and financial measures
Facilitate best practice sharing and contribute to automation and improvement of existing processes.
Present actionable insights and recommendations to loyalty business managers to influence business strategies and continuously enhance the value generation from loyalty programs.


What You’ll Need


Higher degree in an analytical or financial discipline like Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Financial Economics or similar
3+ years working experience in applied analytics for solving business problems (entry-level applicants are also encouraged to apply)
Experience with BI and analytical tools (Power BI, Tableau, Databricks or similar)
Proficiency in query processing languages such as SQL and PySpark, along with hands-on experience on cloud-based platforms (e.g., Azure).
Excellent communication skills with the ability to clearly articulate technical information to all levels of the organization and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong stakeholder management skills, with experience engaging diverse teams and senior leaders across geographies.
Collaborative and proactive, with the initiative to drive projects to successful completion.
Adaptable to new and evolving technologies and business needs. Curious and committed to continuous learning in both business and technology domain.


What You Can Expect At Circle k


Alimentation Couche-Tard is a proud receiver Gallup Exceptional Workplace Award (GEWA) for 4 years in a row.
Complete benefits package.
Work in a collaborative, dynamic, high performing and diverse team.
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and to evolve professionally in a fast-growing company.


At Circle K, our culture is shaped by our team members and how we treat each other. Our guiding principles are the core values we live by and inform all our actions and business decisions. You can find them at Values and Culture | Circle K. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

INTERESTED?

We encourage you to apply by August 12, 2025. The candidates will be reviewed on continuous basis.

We know great companies are built from within, by great people like you. Come grow with us!
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions. In this role, you'll bejoining our Data & Analytics team and will be reporting to our Head of Data.






You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices. Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels. Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage expert proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.







Success looks like

Creating exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactively delivering actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Developing and implementing intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Providing insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Communicating complex data insights clearly, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Solving problems proactively and addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Sucessfully exploring and implementing advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven expertise in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Mastery of advanced statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, various regression models, and time series analysis for forecasting.
Solid understanding and practical experience with user activity tracking tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar product analytics platforms.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (e.g., A/B tests) to establish causal relationships and inform data-driven decision-making.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation
On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan
Growth and progression opportunities – we want you to grow with us
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.






All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.



Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.



As a Senior Data Analyst, you'll play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions. In this role, you'll bejoining our Data & Analytics team and will be reporting to our Head of Data.



You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices. Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels. Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.



What you'll do

    • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
    • Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
    • Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
    • Leverage expert proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
    • Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
    • Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.



Success looks like

    • Creating exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
    • Proactively delivering actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
    • Developing and implementing intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
    • Providing insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
    • Communicating complex data insights clearly, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
    • Solving problems proactively and addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
    • Sucessfully exploring and implementing advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.



What you'll bring with you

    • Proven expertise in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
    • Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
    • Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
    • Mastery of advanced statistical analysis techniques, including hypothesis testing, various regression models, and time series analysis for forecasting.
    • Solid understanding and practical experience with user activity tracking tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar product analytics platforms.
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (e.g., A/B tests) to establish causal relationships and inform data-driven decision-making.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance, inclusive support for new parents and generous vacation
    • On top of your annual base salary, you are offered to be part of an Employee Share Plan
    • Growth and progression opportunities – we want you to grow with us
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.



All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data and insights analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.

To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...

Job Details

HamiltonAI is a cutting-edge Media & Marketing AI Platform that helps marketers optimize media investments and predict business outcomes with confidence. Our platform leverages artificial intelligence and machine learning to support strategic media planning across all offline and online channels.

Come and join our Customer Success team as a Data & Insights Analyst where you will provide media and business insights to our customers, using our models and other marketing data.

Our Customer Success team is at the heart of turning advanced analytics into real business value. We partner closely with clients to ensure a smooth onboarding experience, seamless implementation of our AI-driven models, and ongoing strategic and operational support.

The team bridges the gap between technology and business, working alongside our Product Delivery, AI, and Data teams. As trusted advisors, we help clients interpret model outputs, uncover insights, and drive better media and marketing decisions. Our goal is simple: empower clients to succeed using our platform.

What You'll Do

As a member of our growing Customer Success team, this is what you will typically spend most of your time on:


Demonstrate a high sensitivity to the structure, quality, and meaning of media, marketing, and business data. You’ll process large datasets efficiently, detect patterns quickly, and extract insights that are accurate, actionable, and aligned with the customer’s business context.
Leverage outputs from our Bayesian Marketing Mix Models (MMM) and other analytical tools to deliver strategic recommendations for media optimization.
Conduct deep-dive analyses and ad hoc explorations using client data, and communicate findings through clear, tailored presentations that resonate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams—including modeling, product, AI, and data experts—to ensure seamless onboarding, model implementation, and customer engagement.
Assess and ensure the quality and relevance of customer data throughout the client journey, helping to maximize model reliability and output accuracy.
Serve as a trusted thought partner to clients by connecting data insights to broader marketing and business strategy.
Contribute to the development and enhancement of our analytics frameworks, supporting continuous improvement and innovation within the Customer Success team.


What You Bring

We imagine that you are an ambitious, data savvy person who takes pride in getting the details right, but at the same time is concerned with the overall end outcome. You have some years of experience with MMM and have drive and talent, take responsibility and are eager to learn and grow fast.

Moreover, You Exhibit Some Of The Following Personality Traits


Highly customer oriented mindset
Sharp attention to detail
Good communicator
Logical and critical thinker
Ability to work on several customer projects concurrently
Patient and focused
Learning, sparring, asking questions


Requirements


Advanced data skills with strong proficiency in data processing, manipulation, and analysis using tools such as Python, R, SQL, or BI platforms. You’re comfortable working with large, complex datasets and can quickly extract meaningful, actionable insights.
Proven experience in marketing or media analytics, consulting, or related roles—ideally with direct client-facing responsibilities.
Hands-on expertise with Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) is essential; familiarity Bayesian model or other regression model is a plus.
An advanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as Business Analytics, Econometrics, Statistics, or equivalent practical experience.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, able to clearly explain complex data insights to technical and non-technical audiences, including clients.
Highly organized and adaptable, with the ability to manage multiple client projects efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
A collaborative, curious mindset with a sharp attention to detail and strong data sensitivity.


Bonus Competencies


Strong interpersonal and communication skills, including explaining and discussing modeling outputs or other analytics approaches with other team members or customers at all levels
Experience in a SaaS, AI, or technology-driven product company.


Why Join HamiltonAI


Be part of a fast-growing team transforming marketing analytics through AI.
Work in a supportive, multicultural environment that values autonomy and growth.
Gain exposure to global clients and real-world applications of cutting-edge modeling techniques.
Collaborate with experienced professionals across disciplines—AI, data science, product, and strategy.


If you see yourself as a part of our team at Kantar and believe that you can contribute something valuable, apply for the position!

About Us

We are very agile and follow modern software engineering best practices. We believe that technology and creativity are the most powerful tools to disrupt and set the standards of a new era. Most of all, we believe in people. The way that we work is guided by some fundamental values:

Trust

We believe that our colleagues will do their best to perform their tasks and to realize our goals. We believe that our colleagues are trustworthy, hardworking, and honest.

Equal worth

We believe that everyone has the same right to make and influence decisions. This means that we safely trust our colleagues to make the majority of the decisions relevant for the role they are filling in the team.

Transparency

We believe that everyone needs full access to all knowledge in order to have the best possible basis for making decisions. We believe that they may have valuable ideas that we otherwise might miss.

If you see yourself as a part of our team and believe that you can contribute with something valuable, apply for the position!

Location

Copenhagen, RaadhuspladsenDenmark

Kantar Rewards Statement

At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.

We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.

Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.


Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for at omdanne data til indsigt, og vil du være med til at udvikle innovative og værdiskabende løsninger og rapporter - og løfte den måde vi anvender data på?

Ligger din faglige interesse og motivation i at forvandle data til indsigter og løsninger, der skaber konkret værdi for både kolleger, kunder og partnere? Så har vi det helt rigtige job klar til dig!

Alm. Brand Group er en af Danmarks førende skadeforsikringskoncerner, der består af Alm. Brand Forsikring, Codan Forsikring og Privatsikring. Vi er i konstant udvikling og har stor appetit på innovative data-løsninger, der kan understøtte vores strategiske mål, rådgive og hjælpe vores kunder når de har mest brug for det.

Du skaber indsigt i data som skaber grundlag for handling

Som Data Analyst skal du på den ene side kunne identificere behov og specificere disse i en datamæssig sammenhæng. Hvor du også udfordrer og inspirerer dine kolleger konstruktivt med nye indsigter og ideer. På den anden side skal du kunne udvikle dataløsninger og rapporteringer med data, hvor genanvendelse og standardisering er vigtigt. Dette sker alt sammen med udgangspunkt i vores nye konsoliderede og cloudbaserede dataplatform i et stærkt datafagligt miljø sammen med et fast forretningsvendt team, som har et specifikt data- og forretningsdomæne fokus.

Dine Primære Opgaver Bliver At


Sparre med kollegaer omkring deres udfordringer og behov for rapportering og indsigt i data
Udvikle data- og rapporteringsløsninger vha. Microsoft Power BI og andre dataværktøjer
Bidrage til forretningsmæssige afklaringer og udvikling af datastrukturer på ny data platform
Bidrage med adoptionen af nye og eksisterende dataløsninger hos brugerne
Udarbejde dataanalyser og indsigter baseret på data i samarbejde med brugerne
Vedligeholde og videreudvikle eksisterende løsninger


Erfaring med udvikling af løsninger baseret på data fra en struktureret dataplatform

Vi leder efter en faglig profil, som har lyst til at forstå forretningsmæssige udfordringer og kunne se muligheder i løsninger med dataindsigter og løsninger. Du skal kunne udvikle løsningerne med moderne data og business intelligence værktøjer i samarbejde med et tværfagligt team og i dialog med flere forskellige forretningsmæssige interessenter. Du kan derfor begå dig med både meget faglige dygtige specialister og mere strategisk orienterede ledere.

Derudover Rummer Dit CV


En videregående uddannelse med vægt på dataanalyse og IT
Erfaring med at samle, analysere og afklare behov og krav
Erfaring med udvikling af løsninger og rapporteringer baseret på data fra en struktureret dataplatform eller data warehouse
Erfaring med dataudtræk vha. SQL, dataanalyse og præsentation af data i Microsoft Power BI
Gerne erfaring som business intelligence analytiker, udvikler eller konsulent
Gode dansk- og engelskkundskaber, skriftligt og mundtligt


Din nye afdeling og team

Din nye arbejdsplads bliver Alm. Brand Groups hovedsæde på Midtermolen nær Østerport Station og Langelinie. Her får du godt 50 gode kolleger og faste konsulenter i vores centrale dataafdelinger, hvor vi arbejder tæt integreret i fagligt tværgående teams og på tværs af landegrænser. Du vil arbejde fast sammen med det samme team på typisk 4-6 data engineers, udviklere og analytikere. Du kan se frem til at komme ind i et ambitiøst og meget positivt miljø, hvor alle hjælper hinanden, og hvor der også er god plads til at have det sjovt sammen.

Ansøgning og kontakt

Er du vores nye kollega, så send os din ansøgning med CV snarest muligt.

Ansøgningsfristen er 3. august, og vi behandler herefter ansøgninger. Vi forventer at afholde 1. runde samtaler i uge 33 og 2. runde i uge 34. Opstart efter aftale.

For spørgsmål, kontakt venligst chef for Data Solutions, Ole Michelsen på 3047 8921.

Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og håber, du vil være med til at forme fremtiden for data i Alm. Brand Group!

Alm. Brand Group er en af Danmarks største forsikringsselskaber, og omfatter både Alm. Brand, Codan, Privatsikring og Erhvervssikring. Vi er over 2000 medarbejdere, der arbejder for at sikre og forsikre vores flere end 700.000 kunder. Vores fundament er fokus på kunden, høj arbejdsglæde og vores værdisæt: Vi er ambitiøse, Vi er ordentlige, Vi udviser tillid. Læs mere om Alm. Brand Group på almbrandgroup.com. Følg os på LinkedIn: Alm. Brand Group. Vi opfordrer alle uanset alder, køn, baggrund, handicap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen.
Show more

For spørgsmål, kontakt venligst chef for Data Solutions, Ole Michelsen på 3047 8921.

Title: Data Analyst - Maternity Cover (7 months)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.






At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.






Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.






As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.


You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.


Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.


Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.






This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.







What you'll do

Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.







Success looks like

Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.







What you'll bring with you

Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.







At Planday, we offer you

Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
Flexible remote work
Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities







Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.






At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.






As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.


All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Show more
HTML:
Scheduling isn't simply filling shifts. It's finding the sweet spot that enables businesses to grow and team members to enjoy the perfect work/life balance.



At Planday from Xero, we aim to use Agentic AI to build a future where managers can seamlessly free up invaluable time for their business and teams. We're not just building software: we're on a mission to make shift work more human, to change work/life balance from a luxury to a reality for all shift workers. We're using advanced technology to help humans reach their full potential. At work and in life.



Founded in 2004, Planday is headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark and helps create perfect schedules for hundreds of thousands of users across the world.



As a Data Analyst, you'll be reporting directly to our Head of Data & Analytics and will play a strategic role in transforming complex data into actionable insights that directly fuel our business growth and critical decisions.

You'll craft compelling data narratives, turning raw information into valuable assets that guide product development and key strategic choices.

Collaborating across teams, you'll uncover pivotal metrics and deep customer insights, empowering informed decisions throughout Planday. Through impactful visualizations and persuasive communication, you'll ensure these insights resonate with stakeholders at all levels.

Furthermore, you'll leverage advanced analytical techniques to pioneer predictive modeling and automation, fostering a culture of data-driven innovation that is central to Planday's continued success.



This role is a maternity cover role for about 7 months.



What you'll do

    • Collaborate cross-functionally with product, commercial, and leadership teams to define, track, and report critical metrics, delivering comprehensive customer insights.
    • Design and maintain robust data models that transform raw data into high-value assets, ensuring accuracy and quality.
    • Develop impactful, hands-on solutions, visualizations, and dashboards across the business, primarily utilizing Tableau to communicate insights effectively.
    • Leverage proficiency in Python, R, and SQL for advanced data manipulation, statistical analysis, and ensuring high data quality.
    • Apply advanced statistical analysis techniques for summarizing, interpreting, and predicting data, alongside machine learning concepts for predictive modeling techniques.
    • Translate complex data into clear, actionable narratives through compelling data storytelling, impactful presentations, and strong interpersonal communication.
    • During your time with us we’re expecting key projects to include: Product-Market-Fit analysis, customer lifecycle insights, as well as supporting product teams.



Success looks like

    • Exceptional data models that consistently deliver accurate, high-quality data assets, underpinning strategic initiatives.
    • Proactive delivery of actionable insights and critical metrics that directly lead to informed decisions and tangible business improvements for product and commercial teams.
    • Development and implementation of intuitive and highly impactful visualizations and dashboards that significantly elevate data-driven decision-making across Planday.
    • Insights and recommendations that are consistently trusted and acted upon by product and commercial teams, stemming from rigorous analysis and robust data practices.
    • Clear and compelling communication of complex data insights, fostering understanding and alignment among stakeholders, resulting in measurable positive business impact.
    • Proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking in addressing data-related challenges, leading to continuous improvement and advancement in our analytical capabilities.
    • Successful exploration and implementation of advanced analytical techniques, including machine learning, to unlock new opportunities and generate groundbreaking insights.



What you'll bring with you

    • Proven experience in Python, R, and advanced SQL (including window functions, CTEs) for advanced data management and statistical analysis.
    • Proficiency in crafting compelling data stories, leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to transform complex datasets into clear, impactful visualizations that resonate with diverse stakeholders.
    • Proven capability in product opportunity sizing, metric development, and building robust metric trees to guide product strategy and evaluation.
    • Demonstrated ability to lead and optimize data wrangling and cleaning processes across multiple, complex projects.
    • Exceptional communication skills, capable of translating complex data insights into compelling narratives through data storytelling and high-impact presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
    • A highly analytical mindset, consistently identifying and solving complex data challenges with innovative solutions that directly drive data-driven strategic decisions.
    • Practical application of machine learning fundamentals to solve specific business problems through predictive modeling.



At Planday, we offer you

    • Benefits like pension, health insurance and generous vacation
    • Flexible remote work
    • Strong social culture with lots of team and company activities
    • Meaningful work – everyone at Planday contributes to improving the lives of shift workers around the globe
    • Healthy work-life balance and autonomous approach to work. We trust in you and your abilities



Finally, our offices are not just workplaces (although they are pretty nice and well-located, we have to say!). Plandayers are open and welcoming and at Planday, everyone has the freedom and support to show their true self at work.



At Planday, we firmly believe that diversity and inclusion are the cornerstones of innovation and a vibrant workplace culture, and we highly value the strength that diverse backgrounds offer.



As an equal opportunity employer, we strive to create an equitable experience for all our candidates throughout the process. Please let us know if you need reasonable accommodation during the application or interview process.

All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to any personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Fredericia, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du nysgerrig af natur og elsker at dykke ned i store datamængder for at finde mønstre, sammenhænge og indsigter? Vil du bruge dine analytiske evner til at hjælpe kolleger og kunder med at træffe bedre beslutninger? Så er du måske vores næste Data Analyst.

Missionen: Brug data til at gøre en forskel

I Bankdata har vi oceaner af data, der bare venter på at blive omsat til viden, der skaber værdi for vores kunder – de danske pengeinstitutter – og for vores egne teams. Som Data Analyst bliver du en del af et dedikeret team, hvor vi hjælper hinanden, deler viden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Vi arbejder agilt med korte iterationer og hurtige feedbackloops, og du bliver en del af et stærkt dataområde, hvor vi inspirerer hinanden til at udnytte datapotentialet endnu bedre.

Dit bidrag – Fra data til adfærdsændrende indsigter

Som vores nye Data Analyst får du en central rolle i at:


Finde, modellere og visualisere data, så både interne teams og eksterne kunder kan handle på dem.
Udvikle rapporter og dashboards i Power BI, der skaber storytelling og understøtter forretningskritiske beslutninger.
Identificere anvendelsesmuligheder for advanced analytics sammen med forretningen.
Drifte og forbedre eksisterende rapporteringsløsninger samt komme med input til automatisering og nye løsninger.
Være en del af Bankdatas Power BI-kompetencecenter og hjælpe kolleger med at blive endnu stærkere på datavisualisering.



De første 6-12 måneder vil du:


Opbygge en solid forståelse for vores systemer, datas livscyklus og dataværdikæde.
Bygge Power BI-rapporter for både interne kunder og banker med fokus på best practice og storytelling.
Sætte dig ind i et avanceret rapporteringssystem og med friske øjne foreslå forbedringer.
Arbejde både på vores on-prem SQL-platform og i vores cloud-miljø (Fabric).



Er du vores næste datadetektiv?

Vi forestiller os, at du har:


Erfaring med Power BI, SQL og gerne også Python.
Indblik i dataplatforme i cloud-miljøer.
En kandidatgrad i fx naturvidenskab, økonomi, data science eller lignende – men din nysgerrighed og praktiske erfaring vægter tungere end en bestemt uddannelse.
Evnen til at identificere de vigtigste indsigter i store datasæt og formidle dem via storytelling.
En samarbejdende, tillidsfuld tilgang og lyst til at dele viden og sparre med kolleger.



Hvad tilbyder vi?

Masser af data at arbejde med og muligheden for at gøre en reel forskel for danske pengeinstitutter.

Et stærkt fagligt miljø med hjælpsomme kolleger og en kultur præget af psykologisk tryghed.

Gode udviklingsmuligheder – vi investerer i din læring og holder dig på forkant med de nyeste teknologier.

Fleksibilitet i hverdagen, inkl. mulighed for hjemmearbejde.

Vil du være med?

Send os dit CV allerede i dag via linket nedenfor. Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Manager Ditte Mølgård Heidi-Jørgensen, dmh@bankdata.dk eller +45 2116 2438.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Velkommen til Bankdata

Bankdata bygger software til finanssektoren. Vi er næsten 1000 kolleger på holdet, og vi udvikler digitale produkter, platforme og infrastruktur, som ca. hver tredje dansker, 200.000 virksomheder og flere tusinde bankansatte bruger hver dag.

Vi tror på struktureret personlig udvikling, et stærkt kollegialt fællesskab og at ambitiøse medarbejdere med fleksible og bæredygtige arbejdsliv præsterer bedre. Bliv klogere på arbejdslivet i Bankdata her.

Hos Bankdata arbejder vi aktivt med at fremme mangfoldighed og diversitet blandt vores medarbejdere, og vi opfordrer derfor alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder og kulturel baggrund til at søge job hos os.

Bankdata er en af Danmarks vigtigste teknologivirksomheder. Vi går på arbejde for at finde teknologiske svar på finanssektorens forretningsproblemer. For at udvikle og bygge fremtidens digitale bank.
Show more

Hos Bankdata arbejder vi aktivt med at fremme mangfoldighed og diversitet blandt vores medarbejdere, og vi opfordrer derfor alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder og kulturel baggrund til at søge job hos os.

Bankdata er en af Danmarks vigtigste teknologivirksomheder. Vi går på arbejde for at finde teknologiske svar på finanssektorens forretningsproblemer. For at udvikle og bygge fremtidens digitale bank.

Title: Senior Data Analyst – Finance
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our Finance team and help us grow smarter as a scale-up. This new role has been created to address the need for stronger data control and quality assurance, particularly to support billing accuracy, Accounts Receivable (AR), Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and management reporting. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring data integrity, creating reports, and providing data-driven insights to enable more accurate financial processes and decision-making.

This role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer (CFO).

Main Responsibilities


Data Integrity Assurance:
Ensure the accuracy and integrity of data used for client invoicing and self-billing processes.
Work closely with the Accounts Receivable team to ensure data used for account reconciliation is reliable and accurate.
Support FP&A and management by providing quality data for in-depth analysis.
Data Extraction & Reporting:
Extract, manipulate, and provide data to support the Accounts Receivable team with client queries and account reconciliations.
Develop and provide reports to support group reporting processes.
Provide ad-hoc data and reports to the CFO and management on company performance, sales trends, and financial metrics.
Enable detailed financial analysis through accurate data sets, helping to drive strategic decisions.
Database Management & Querying:
Utilize your technical skills to ensure the smooth extraction, indexing, and organization of financial data across various databases.
Create and optimize SQL queries for data extraction and reporting, ensuring accuracy and speed.
Manage and improve the database structure, ensuring links, indices, and relationships are properly established for efficiency.
Cross-functional Support:
Act as a bridge between finance and other departments by providing essential data support.
Collaborate with the AR team, FP&A, and management to ensure data quality is maintained across various financial processes.

Profile


Experience:
5-7 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with exposure to finance, accounting, or FP&A functions.
Strong background in data extraction, reporting, and ensuring data accuracy.
Experience with tools and technologies such as SQL (queries), Python, Metabase, and Power BI for reporting and data analysis.
Technical Skills:
Advanced proficiency in SQL for querying databases, as well as experience with Python for automation or data manipulation.
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI or Metabase for creating dynamic reports and dashboards.
Good understanding of database structures, including indexing and linking, to optimize performance and reporting accuracy.
Experience working with data extracted from ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics 365 (D365), including familiarity with its structure and reporting outputs.
Finance Knowledge:
Basic understanding of finance processes, including billing, accounts receivable, financial analysis, and group reporting.
Knowledge of key financial metrics and how to manipulate data for FP&A purposes.
Personal Attributes:
Hands-on, flexible, and agile with a “can-do” attitude—able to manage competing priorities and adapt to a fast-changing environment.
Eager to be part of a transformative journey within the finance function, with a focus on improving data quality and analytical capabilities.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Benefits


Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy a collaborative, inclusive, and open workplace designed to fit your needs and support work-life balance.
Competitive Package: Receive a competitive salary, an 11% company pension plan, and a comprehensive benefits package.
Time to Recharge: Benefit from 32 paid vacation days (5 weeks + 5 extra) and paid parental leave to focus on what matters most.
Career Growth: Access professional development opportunities and grow your career in a high-impact, high-growth industry.
Stay Energized: Enjoy excellent coffee, tea, free snacks, and subsidized lunches at the office.
Stay Active: Use our Spirii gym and shared company car to keep moving.
Make an Impact: Be part of a team driving the future of sustainable energy while working on meaningful projects.


Why Join Us?

As the Senior Data Analyst in our rapidly growing scale-up, you will play a key role in transforming how we manage and utilize data across the finance function. You will have the opportunity to shape the future of our financial reporting, billing, and analysis processes, all while being a key player in a high-growth environment. This is a great opportunity for someone who is passionate about data and finance, and who wants to make a significant impact in a dynamic, fast-paced company.

About Spirii – Who We Are

Spirii is a full-service e-Mobility provider, which offers hardware and software charging solutions to companies in the private and the public sector. Spirii has recently celebrated its four-year anniversary as a founded company, however the people in Spirii have extensive experience working with electric cars and charging, as well as development of future transport- and energy systems.

Spirii is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences. Spirii strives to create an inclusive and diverse workplace, and we encourage all qualified applicants to apply regardless of age, gender, race, sexual/religious orientation, or disability.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data & Automation Engineer




PNO Group, Copenhagen




PNO is the Nordic’s largest trailer rental company. We are a family-owned company established in 1975 with our head oce in Copenhagen, and with branches in Germany, Finland, Norway, Sweden, Denmark & the Netherlands.




At PNO, we are looking for smart people who are curious at heart and always looking for new ways of doing things. In a nutshell, we are a human-centred organisation looking for team players who bring their honest selves to work every day.




About the job




We are looking for a tech savvy individual to take our data and automation setup to the next level. Over the past years we have built up base infrastructure for data and reporting mainly using PowerBI, PostgreSQL, Azure data factory and Databricks.




We are now looking for someone to help take that to the next level especially focusing more on data sync and alignment between systems including automation of that.




You will be required to have an eye on the strategic aspect in terms of how we structure our data landscape and connect systems, but still enjoy spending most of your time with getting your hands dirty developing pipelines and automations.




You’ll play a central role in syncing and aligning data between systems and automating where it really matters. You care about impact, not complexity, and are able to make strategic calls about where to focus, while being hands-on with implementation.




One day you might be helping design how we align data models between our ERP and CRM, while you the other day will code robots to handle data in our AP system.




Skills, experience and background




5+ years Data engineering experience with ETL/ELT pipeline development and data architecture.
Comfortable navigating real world, resource-constrained environment and prioritising what moves the needle.
Knowledge of all or some of PowerBI, Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and PostgreSQL, Power Automate.
Experience working with a stack of loosely connected cloud systems and using scripts, APIs, automated browser robots and similar to bridge the gaps.
Proven ability to design practical data models that connect operational and commercial systems (e.g. ERP and CRM).
A sharp, structured thinker who values rational decision-making and can clearly communicate trade-offs.
Strong ownership mindset and an instinct for simple, high-leverage solutions over engineering.




We invest in your success




An organization with a dynamic team of smart and thoughtful individuals.
A team-first culture with high ambition and low ego.
Competitive salary and meaningful work.
Regular coaching from experienced leaders.




If you’re excited by this opportunity and see yourself in this role, we’d love to hear from you.

Show more

Title: Junior Fundamentals Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you prepared to explore the ever-changing landscape of global commodity prices, forecasts, and market intelligence? Expana is a leading independent provider of this data for the food, consumer packaged goods (CPG), and capital goods industries. We offer our data and insights through various cloud-based SaaS products, as well as APIs and Data Feeds.

Join us in contributing to our continued success!

The successful candidate will be a valuable member of the forecasting team and will update and develop analyses of market developments within a range of commodities, including metals, energy sources, plastics, and edibles.

As a student employee at Expana you will be able to schedule your working hours to a great extent. The working hours will be 15-20 per week. We expect a certain degree of flexibility near deadlines, but we will accommodate your requests in relation to your exams and schedule.

Responsibilities


Maintain fundamental analyses of commodities, which analyse supply, demand, inventory levels, cost driver developments and financial measures
Support the identification and development of additional analytical indicators
Analyse data from a wide range of sources including industry organizations, The Federal Reserve, Eurostat, Census Bureau, CFTC, BLS, and many more.


Skills & Requirements


Is a bachelor student or a 1st year master student at KU or CBS studying e.g. Economics, HA (almen), Finance or similar.
Possesses strong quantitative and analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Is fluent in English
Speaks Danish at an intermediate level or better
Works independently, professionally and in a well-structured manner
Is able to identify problems, to collect data, to establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Enjoys repetitive tasks based on practical procedures and systems
Has an interest in econometric techniques
Has a solid knowledge of Excel


Our Core Values at Expana

At Expana, we take great pride in our core values, which guide our actions and shape our culture:

Brilliance: We strive for excellence in everything we do, pushing the boundaries of creativity and innovation to deliver outstanding results.

Connected: We believe in the power of collaboration and communication. By fostering strong relationships within our teams and with our partners, we create a supportive environment that drives success.

Make a Difference: We are committed to making a positive impact in our industry and community. Our actions reflect our dedication to sustainability, social responsibility, and delivering value to our stakeholders.

Other values such as trust, transparency, creativity, and ownership define our brand and company culture. These qualities are what we seek in our teams as well. Your unique communication style and optimistic vision will inspire harmony with colleagues, customers, and business partners. Your commitment to excellence and strong relationship skills are also valued. Positive energy and strategic skills are key to succeeding at Expana. We value both individual success and collaboration, seeking dynamic team players who think outside the box. Everyone's development is integral to our collective success, so we foster and support each person's strengths and talents.

In return for your hard work and dedication, we offer fantastic rewards. Please note that we operate with an agile working model, allowing for remote work and occasional travel to our offices.

It is important to mention that we use E-Verify with third-party suppliers in our hiring practices to ensure compliance with employment laws.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Mantell Associates is partnered with a pioneering MedTech organisation that is transforming biotech workflows through Robotics, AI, and Cloud infrastructure.




This business is looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer to help drive innovation through data integration, ETL automation, and cloud-native architecture. This is a unique opportunity to join a growing, mission-driven team focused on redefining the future of biotech R&D and clinical development.




Data Engineer - Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain robust, scalable ETL pipelines using Python to support real-time and batch data workflows
Architect and manage cloud-native data solutions using AWS (including Lambda, S3, Redshift, and related services)
Collaborate cross-functionally with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to ensure data accuracy, accessibility, and integrity
Develop and maintain data models and warehouse structures to support analytics and operational decision-making
Perform advanced data wrangling, transformation, and validation across structured and unstructured datasets
Monitor data pipeline performance and implement enhancements for reliability, security, and scalability
Document architecture and contribute to best practices across the data engineering function




Data Engineer – Requirements:

4–6+ years of experience in a Data Engineering role, ideally within Biotech, MedTech, HealthTech, or Life Sciences
Strong hands-on expertise with AWS services including Lambda, S3, Redshift, Glue, and related technologies
Advanced proficiency in Python for building ETL pipelines and automation workflows
Deep understanding of SQL, data modeling, and data warehouse architecture
Experience working with complex biological or healthcare data preferred
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong attention to detail
Ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, innovative environment




Mantell Associates is a specialist Pharmaceutical and Life Sciences headhunting firm. For more information on this opportunity, contact us at +44 (0)20 3854 7700.

Title: Business Insights & Report Specialist
Description:
We are seeking an experienced Business Insight & Reporting Specialist with expertise in Power BI Reporting/Front-end to join our Data & Digitalization team. This role will be instrumental in developing, maintaining, and optimizing reporting solutions that drive business insights, using a combination of tabular models and diverse data sources. The individual will also be a key player in implementing our data strategy. 
 

The role:

This role will focus on designing dynamic performance reports and dashboards, mainly using Power BI, to provide valuable insights for business evaluation and strategic planning. The right candidate will collaborate with senior leadership from all departments and IT teams to ensure data integrity and accessible reporting.

Furthermore, you will:

Design and deliver Power BI reports and dashboards highlighting KPIs on a strategic, tactical and an operational level.
Provide regular and ad-hoc reporting to support the whole business to become more data driven.
Collaborate with teams to align reports with organizational goals.
Develop interactive reports and dashboards integrating data from multiple sources using Power BI.
Ensure reports are accessible and actionable, supporting business users in decision-making.
Maintain comprehensive documentation for reports, models, and data processes.
Implement controls to ensure data quality and manage access protocols.
 


The Team:

The Data & Digitalization team consists of three sub-departments: Applications, Data Strategy & Governance and BI & Architecture. You will be in the BI & Architecture team with four colleagues. All of them are located at the Aarhus office. However, you will be working closely together with Data Strategy & Governance and Applications. You will be working with and reporting for the senior leaders to support strategic decision-making based on Power BI reports.


Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will have strong experience in Power BI Front-end development, with a demonstrated ability to track, analyze, and communicate financial and operational performance metrics to support informed decision-making across the business.
 

Furthermore, you have:

A Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Business Intelligence, Finance, Data Science, UX Design, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in Power BI front-end, financial reporting, or business intelligence, with a strong focus on performance management reporting.
Proven expertise in Power BI, including creating visually compelling, report and dashboards development, data modelling, DAX, and Power Query.
Worked with tabular models and the creating of semantic models.
In-depth knowledge of financial and operational performance metrics and experience reporting on KPIs such as revenue, margins, costs, and profitability.
Excellent problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing reporting issues.


What will make you stand out:

Power BI certification (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate).
Experience with Microsoft Fabric.
Understanding of SQL for querying data sources and enhancing reporting capabilities.
 


We offer

At Stibo System, we offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.

We care about our colleague’s work-life balance, and we offer flexibility through a hybrid work model

International: A growing global company, worldwide career opportunities, and multicultural teams

Well-being: A caring and inspiring environment, promoting a happy and healthy lifestyle through a wide range of facilities and activities
 



Join Stibo Systems, where we embrace 'All Kinds of Data Minds.' 

Stibo Systems is a global company with a Nordic heritage. We help companies transform into digital leaders through market-leading multidomain master data management that delivers transparency. Through our solution, large brands (our customers) connect data across their products, customers, stores, employees, suppliers, digital assets and much, much more.


Our people are key to our success and at Stibo Systems, you'll find an environment that values data driven, creativity, curiosity, and analytical thinking. We're committed to making you feel trusted, invested in, and connected, fostering a workplace where every data mind thrives. Be part of our journey to digital leadership!


Interested?

We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

Show more

Title: Data and Use-Case Analyst – SupTech Solutions
Description:
Data and Use-Case Analyst – SupTech Solutions




Location: Europe

Duration: Short- to medium-term

Estimated Workload: Short-term assignments / task-based consultancy




About the Opportunity: We are creating a pool of Data and Use-Case Analysts – SupTech Solutions for a new FWC Contract: EC-SG REFORM/2025/OP/0001: Provision of consultancy services to support the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of structural reforms in EU Member State. Experts in this pool will be contacted for specific assignments as they arise. If you have relevant experience we encourage you to apply.




Key Responsibilities:

Work with NCAs to define, document, and deploy a selected number of SupTech use cases.
Provide analytics support to monitor case performance and feasibility.
Advise on data collection standards and feedback loops for solution refinement.
Support the development of technical documentation and case evaluation reports.




Qualifications:

Degree in data science, public sector analytics, or fintech.
5+ years in data-driven regulatory solutions, use-case validation, or supervisory analytics.
Familiarity with dashboarding, data visualisation, and SupTech/RegTech ecosystems.
Experience with cross-border data harmonisation is a plus.

Title: Junior Data Analyst & Scientist – Bliv bindeleddet mellem data og forretning
Description:
Er du vild med data og nysgerrig på, hvordan tal og analyser kan skabe værdi i en virksomhed? Har du lyst til at kickstarte din karriere i en rolle, hvor du får lov at prøve kræfter med både analyse, samarbejde og forretningsforståelse? Så har vi måske jobbet til dig!

Lige nu leder vi efter en Junior Data Analyst til vores Marketing-team – en rolle, hvor du får masser af ansvar, læring og mulighed for at udvikle dig i krydsfeltet mellem forskellige afdelinger og stakeholders.

Hvad går jobbet ud på?

Du bliver en del af vores Marketing Data Insights-team, hvor vi hjælper forretningen med at træffe de rigtige beslutninger baseret på data. Du får chancen for at arbejde tæt sammen med både Product Marketing, Digital Marketing og andre nøglefunktioner.

Vi leder ikke efter én med mange års erfaring – vi leder efter dig, der har mod på at lære og har lyst til at bruge dine tekniske evner i en mere kommerciel kontekst. Vi sørger for, at du får den oplæring og sparring, du har brug for, så du kan vokse i rollen.

Når du er kommet godt ind i jobbet, vil du bl.a. arbejde med:


Supplier Management & Analyse: Understøtte Product Marketing med værktøjer, statistik og KPI-overvågning for vores leverandører. Du sikrer, at vi har styr på leverandørpræstationer, bonusberegninger og kontraktstatus.



Kampagneanalyse & Digital Marketing:

Evaluere og analysere marketingkampagner og bidrage med optimeringsforslag. Opbygge dashboards og datarutiner, der sikrer transparens og forbedret beslutningsgrundlag.


Projektledelse: Drive og koordinere projekter på tværs af Marketing og øvrige afdelinger, herunder budgetarbejde, sortimentsvalg og systemintegrationer.
Data & Systemudvikling: Være med til at videreudvikle og vedligeholde vores dataprocesser.



Hvem er du?

Du behøver ikke have mange års erfaring – det vigtigste for os er, at du:


Har en relevant uddannelse inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence eller lignende
Har arbejdet med SQL, Python eller lignende programmeringssprog og har et ønske om at blive endnu dygtigere på området
Har erfaring med databaser og Cloud (Google Cloud, Power BI eller lign.)
Har superbrugerkompetencer i Excel
Evt har erfaring med analyse, dataflows og performance management – gerne i en kommerciel kontekst
Er flydende engelsk i skrift og tale



Og vigtigst af alt: Du har lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vi tør prøve nyt, hjælper hinanden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Hvad får du hos os?


En plads i en international virksomhed.
Mulighed for både faglig og personlig udvikling.
Fantastiske kolleger og en stærk social kultur.
Svanemærket kantine og god kaffe.
Sundheds- og tandforsikring, pension og personaleforening.



Læs mere om os her

Klar til at tage det første skridt?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst, hvor du fortæller, hvorfor du vil arbejde hos os. Ansøgningsfristen er d. 18. august 2025.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Dennis Rømer Jensen, Head of Marketing Data Insights på telefon 23331102 eller e-mail dennis.jensen@lyreco.com. (ferie frem til 14. juli 2025.)

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hos Lyreco ønsker vi at fremme ligestilling og mangfoldighed. Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksuel orientering eller handicap.

Lokation Roskilde


Show more
