Lokation Roskilde

Title: ESG & Impact Analyst
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.

As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.

This is a hands-on student position role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.


What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.

You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.

You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.

You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.

You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.


What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.

We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?

We think this might look like:

You’re studying at your BSc or MSc in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.
You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.
You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)
You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.
You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides.

In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.

We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Show more
HTML:
We’re looking for a sharp, curious ESG & Impact Analyst to help shape how we measure what matters.

As a venture house spanning evergreen investment company PSV Foundry and the two individual VC funds PSV Tech and PSV Hafnium, we bring two decades of experience in VC fund building, startup investing and portfolio management to the table. Born out of DTU – The Technical University of Denmark – we’re not here to box-tick compliance. We’re all in on the one-to-one correlation between impact and business success. In this role, you’ll be key to making that connection real.

This is a hands-on student position role, ideal for someone who wants to work at the frontier of impact, tech, and venture. You’ll get a front-row seat to a vibrant community of founders and ecosystem players, and the chance to leave your fingerprints on something that’s built to scale.

What you’ll (actually) be doing

You’ll be working alongside our Head of ESG & Impact, directly supporting our mission to make ESG and Impact data useful, actionable, and founder-friendly. Your work help lay the foundation for how future startups across the Nordics, and possibly beyond, integrate impact strategy into their core business.

  • You’ll assist founders in understanding sustainability expectations, navigating early-stage ESG & Impact challenges, and co-creating simple, scalable impact strategies. Think; practical input on KPIs, diversity metrics, responsible AI use – and practical, founder-first playbooks.
  • You’ll support VC funds through due diligence processes, build and verify emissions baselines for target companies, and turn ESG-speak into clear, actionable reporting that matters to LPs. Think: Scope 3 progress across PSV, tailored impact frameworks aligned with funds strategies, policies that make sense for early-stage investing, systems to track, aggregate, and improve both financial and impact KPIs - from first deal to exit.
  • You’ll manage the backend of our ESG & Impact reporting process – collecting the right data, ensuring regulatory alignment (hello SFRD, CSRD and the Taxonomy), and improving how we use that data sheet to sharpen strategy and decision-making. Think: regular data collection, structuring, and analysis of ESG & Impact data – ensuring data accuracy and timely reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
  • You’ll assist in peer research on ESG regulation, impact trends, and responsible investment practices to keep PSV ahead of the curve.

What we think you bring

Let’s be honest we’re not hiring your CV. We’re hiring your brain. Your bias for action. Your “I haven’t tried it before, but I Googled it, or maybe more relevant, I asked the chat and made it work” kind of energy.

We want you who turns messy questions into clarity without asking for a 40-slide brief. The one who looks at a dashboard and thinks: Cool, but how does this help founders actually do better stuff?

We think this might look like:

  • You’re studying at your BSc or MSc in something like data science, sustainability, innovation, economics, or something similar that sounds clever on Linkedin.
  • You’re a student who flinches at the phrase “business as usual” and physically recoils when someone brings up CSR like it’s still 2006.
  • You’re “structured”, “data-driven”, and “know your way around a spreadsheet (don’t we all, after crying over one too many Google Sheets?)
  • You’re familiar with frameworks like the GHG Protocol and accounting, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxanomy assessments etc. – aka the alphabet soup of sustainability.
  • You’re a person who “cares deeply about people and planet” and dreams in systems-thinking slides.

In fewer words, if you’re someone who can hold a climate report and a commercial mindset in the same hand, then we really want to talk.

We’d love to hear from you - even if you don’t tick every box. This is just our best attempt to describe the role realistically. We don’t care about traditional credentials if your drive and mindset are aligned. Sometimes, the right person is someone we haven’t yet had the imagination to look for.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Azure Data Engineer




Som Data Engineer hos cVation bygger du dataplatforme, datawarehouses og MLOps løsninger i skyen for vores kunder. Vi bruger teknologier som Databricks, Fabric, Spark, Azure Machine Learning, Data Factory og Azure Synapse. Vi søger profiler med erfaring inden for enten MLOps, datawarehouses eller dataplatforme, som vil bygge innovative dataløsninger.




cVation er et dansk udviklings- og konsulenthus, som bygger avancerede cloudløsninger på Azure med afsæt i markedets hurtigste og mest agile metoder. cVation blev stiftet i 2014, har modtaget tre Børsen Gazeller og vundet Microsofts Partner Award for App Innovation tre år i træk. Vi arbejder dedikeret med agile arbejdsmetoder, DevOps og Test Driven Development. Vi sætter en ære i at levere software af den højeste kvalitet, og tager desuden principperne fra DevOps og software engineering med i vores dataprojekter, hvilket betyder, at tests, Infrastructure as Code og automatisering er i fokus.




Hvilken rolle får du?




Du kommer til at arbejde på et af vores dataprojekter med et projektteam bestående af arkitekter, software udviklere og DevOps specialister. Du vil have fuldt fokus på ét projekt og være tilknyttet ét team ad gangen.




Din rolle bliver at




rådgive om og bygge datawarehouse/dataplatformsløsninger i skyen
rådgive om og bygge løsninger indenfor MLOps
bidrage til design og implementering af den optimale Azure infrastruktur
sikre, at alt opsætning og provisionering sker som infrastructure as code, fx. Terraform
fuldautomatiseret overvågning og skalering af løsninger




Hvad forventer vi af dig?




Du har en videregående uddannelse i software engineering, human centered AI el lign. fra DTU, ITU eller KU samt erfaring i data engineering
Du har enten fullstack MLOps erfaring, kan skrive Python og har lyst til data engineering-delen - eller måske kommer du i stedet med erfaring i at bygge datawarehouse og dataplatforme.
Du vil gerne arbejde med de nyeste teknologier i Azure
Du har erfaring med - og vil gerne blive klogere på - flere af følgende teknologier: Data Factory - Databricks - Fabric - Spark - Azure Synapse - Azure Machine Learning - MLflow - Data Warehouse - Data platform - Python - Azure DevOps, Powershell, Azure CLI, ARM templates, YAML, Bicep, Terraform, Git
Du vil gerne indgå i et agilt setup, hvor krav og retning hurtigt kan ændres, men hvor medbestemmelse og frihed er i højsædet
Du er flydende i skrift og tale på dansk og engelsk, og trives med at have den daglige kontakt med kunden
Du har evnen til at omsætte kundebehov til handling




Det vil være en fordel, hvis:

Du er vant til at arbejde som konsulent i et udviklingsteam i tæt samarbejde med arkitekter og software udviklere




Som person er du selvstændig, ansvarsbevidst, initiativrig, eksekverende og serviceminded. Du er drevet af at lære nyt og vild med at holde dig ajour med de nyeste metoder og teknologier. Du er engageret og motiveret i alt hvad du foretager dig. Hvis du også er glad for at sparre med dygtige kollegaer og trives med at løfte i flok, vil du passe perfekt ind hos os.




Hvad tilbyder vi?




Du kommer til at indgå i vores voksende team, hvor høj faglighed, innovation og arbejdsglæde er i højsæde. Det høje faglige niveau blandt dine kollegaer giver en unik mulighed for at arbejde med de bedste, og vi tager din faglige udvikling alvorligt. Vi har en flad organisation med et minimum af administration, hvor ledelsens døre altid er åbne, og der er god plads til både bordfodbold, fredagsbar, frokost på kajen og et aktivt liv udenfor arbejdstid. Flere gange om året afholder vi hackathons, hvor vi i teams dykker ned i præcis de emner, som udviklerne finder interessante. En del af vores kultur er også, at vi gerne ser alle komme med input til hvordan vi kan optimere, udvikle og forbedre cVation.




Hvorfor vælge os som din nye arbejdsplads?




Vores fundament er løsninger bygget på Microsoft Azure Cloud. Alle vores medarbejdere mestrer cloud-native udvikling og DevOps. Vi arbejder i projekter og engagerer os hands-on i fælles teams med vores kunder for at sikre kvalitet og effektiv videndeling.




Vi er passionerede omkring at hjælpe vores kunder med at få det maksimale ud af cloudteknologien. For os er cloud ikke blot infrastruktur eller et nyt datacenter i skyen. Teknologien giver virksomheder mulighed for at skabe væsentligt mere værdi og arbejde med agilitet og innovation på en helt ny måde.




Vi har været med fra starten, da cloud blev udviklet og tilgængeligt. Vi tilbyder således vores årelange erfaring og dybe cloud ekspertise samt en værktøjskasse med alle vores best practices i form af accelerationsplatformen CADD. Den dækker over gennemprøvede værktøjer, rammeværk, effektive udviklingsmetoder og færdige automatiseringskomponenter. Alt dette for at sikre, at projekter kommer hurtigt og sikkert fra start.




Du vil blive en del af en virksomhed, som tror på, at alle har betydning, og at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde hver dag. Du vil få kollegaer, der er interesseret i at lære og har ønske om at blive de bedste til det, de gør. Vi tilbyder derfor gode muligheder for at udvikle dig.




Interesseret?




Klik på Easy Apply knappen, hvis du vil arbejde med de nyeste teknologier. Hvis du har under 5 års erfaring, bedes du også vedhæfte dine karakterblade i samme fil som dit CV. Vi behandler din ansøgning fortroligt og arrangerer løbende interviews.




Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, eller vil du høre mere om cVation, er du meget velkommen til at kontakte:




Maiken Pelby, Head of People & Culture, T/ 42612828, map@cvation.com




Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig!

Show more

Title: Freelance: Data Engineer
Description:
We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our client's dynamic team.




Key Responsibilities:




Provide analytical insights and support the development applications through close collaboration with other products teams.
Ensure data accuracy and consistency by implementing validation checks and cleaning processes to maintain high-quality data.
Engineer products to the highest standards of security and data privacy by implementing and following security and data privacy principles from ideation to production release and beyond.​
Engineer products that implement business logic, modern design patterns and architectural principles​.
Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions aligned with organizational goals.




Required Skills & Experience:




Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and C#/TypeScript
Solid experience with Databricks or equivalent cloud-based data engineering platforms
In-depth knowledge of data engineering principles and practices, with an emphasis on data transformation, integration and analytics
Experience with SQL would be beneficial also
Familiarity with data modelling concepts and practices, and data visualization tools
Practical experience with AWS and/or Azure cloud platforms in deploying and managing data solutions
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to quality
Superb communication skills, capable of effectively collaborating with diverse collaborators

HTML:
We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our client's dynamic team.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Provide analytical insights and support the development applications through close collaboration with other products teams.
  • Ensure data accuracy and consistency by implementing validation checks and cleaning processes to maintain high-quality data.
  • Engineer products to the highest standards of security and data privacy by implementing and following security and data privacy principles from ideation to production release and beyond.​
  • Engineer products that implement business logic, modern design patterns and architectural principles​.
  • Work with stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver solutions aligned with organizational goals.


Required Skills & Experience:


  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and C#/TypeScript
  • Solid experience with Databricks or equivalent cloud-based data engineering platforms
  • In-depth knowledge of data engineering principles and practices, with an emphasis on data transformation, integration and analytics
  • Experience with SQL would be beneficial also
  • Familiarity with data modelling concepts and practices, and data visualization tools
  • Practical experience with AWS and/or Azure cloud platforms in deploying and managing data solutions
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and a commitment to quality
  • Superb communication skills, capable of effectively collaborating with diverse collaborators


Nice to Have:


  • Curious about API-design.
  • Curious about SAP.
  • Curious about infrastructure.
  • Curious about Terraform
  • Experience with automated testing.



📍 Location: Copenhagen (Hybrid – 3 days onsite/week)

📅 Start Date: 1st August 2025

📆 Contract Duration: Until end of 2025

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (Temporary paternity leave cover)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Bring more to life.

Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?

At Radiometer, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.

You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.

At Radiometer, life comes first. Our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses. We’re a team that celebrates diverse ideas and continuous improvement. Here, you’ll find a place to grow and make a real impact, with your unique perspective driving us forward in improving patient care. At Radiometer, our vision is to improve global healthcare with reliable, fast, and easy patient diagnoses.

Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for


Lead transition from Qlickview to Power BI
Create impactful BI reports
Collaborate with cross-functional teams
Maintenance of reports and data quality
Ownership of GSC databases and data flow into these


This position is part of the Business Intelligence Analyst located in Radiometer Headquarter, Brønshøj, Denmark and will be onsite. The role is temporary paternity leave cover with estimated duration of 5 months. The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for analyzing complex data sets, creating impactful BI reports, providing strategic recommendations to support key business decisions, facilitate the development of BI applications that will be used across sites, and lead the transition from QlikView to Microsoft Power BI. Thereby enabling Radiometer Operations to take the next step in analytics and usage of big data.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in using Microsoft Power BI to develop interactive and intuitive dashboards, as well as a strong background in data analysis and visualization. They should possess exceptional analytical skills, be detail-oriented, and have a deep understanding of data modeling and manipulation. The ability to effectively communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders is also essential.

You will be a part of the Supply Chain and Logistics Department and report to the Sr. Manager, Supply Chain Development.

The essential requirements of the job include:


+3 years working with Power BI and developing BI applications and skilled or expert in SQL language, QlikView & experience with Microsoft Dynamics Axapta or similar ERP system is an advantage
Exceptional analytical skills.
Have a deep understanding of data modeling and manipulation.
Ability to effectively communicate complex findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with transactional data flow for Microsoft Dynamics Axapta or similar ERP system is an advantage.


Application

We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in the application. The recruitment will be completed as soon as a suitable candidate is found. Due to the summer holiday period there might be some delays in the process.

We look forward to seeing your application.

We thank you for your interest. Please read our Applicant Data Privacy Notice carefully here.

Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.

For more information, visit www.danaher.com.

At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
I have a new role for an experienced Data Engineer to work for a leading digital transformation partner, driving innovation with tailored IT solutions, expert consulting, and secure technology for businesses across diverse industries worldwide, who are going through an exciting growth phase.




There are based both in Denmark and this is a Hybrid position.




Responsibilities:

Create and optimize data platforms: Microsoft Fabric and Azure
Help future-proof customers' data platforms through cloud migration projects.
Use various technologies and resources to achieve desired results: SQL Server, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake, Lakehouse, etc.
Collaborate throughout the development cycle – from ideation and requirements to development, testing and delivery, to ensure the Business Intelligence of the future.




Tech Stack - Microsoft Technologies




Salary - Up to 70,000 SEK p/m Depending on experience




Qualifications:

Minimum 5 years experience as a Data Engineer
Experience with Microsoft tool (Power BI / SQL / Databricks / Azure / Fabric)
Fluent Danish & English




This is a great opportunity for anyone that's looking for growth opportunities with one of the worlds biggest consultancies

Title: Lead Data / IT Analyst - Payments Data
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30308

Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We're not just a bank, we're a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.

About This Opportunity

To strengthen our team we are looking for an experienced Lead Data/IT Analyst who has skills to do hands-on data and requirement analysis work. The right candidate also understands other aspects of software development: Are we making solid architectural decisions? Are we able to improve our tech stack? Are we focusing on right things?

As the Lead Data/IT Analyst, you’ll engage with many different stakeholders, so the person we are looking for, is an outgoing individual who is self-motivated and contributes to a good team spirit. You are an experienced and passionate analyst, always seeking the best solution.

Your main responsibilities will be around the consolidation and harmonization, sourcing, storage and distribution of Payments Data to other solutions. It also includes integrations supporting different End2End payment flows in Nordea´s target payment architecture.

What you’ll be doing:


Contributing to solution architecture, design and maintainability of applications
Designing, building and maintaining near real-time data pipelines
Interacting with product owners and stakeholders to clarify, elicit and translate requirements into implementation specifications
Data mapping, data modelling, solution design and working with Information architects
Performing quantitative data analysis with the aim to understand identified issues, and to explain implications and recommend solutions
Collaborating with developers and engineers and properly document your design and solutions
Eliciting requirements (functional and non-functional) by co-operating with different stakeholders in a complex environment
Be responsible for requirements documentation (inc. use cases) and quality improvement
Accessing complex and distributed datasets and perform statistical analysis


The role is based in Copenhagen / Taastrup.

Who You Are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:


Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team


Your experience and background:


Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups


What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance.

Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.
Show more

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

  • Are a team player who takes ownership, builds cross-functional relationships and loves sharing knowledge
  • Have a consultant mindset – actively participate in multiple initiatives at once
  • Can communicate constructively, and contribute to a productive work environment and good atmosphere in the team

Your experience and background:

  • Expert in data modelling principles, data architectures and integration patterns
  • Expert in in requirement elicitation / analysis
  • Expert in SQL (Oracle, MSSQL or similar RDBMS)
  • Experience in one or more cloud platforms (AWS/Azure/Google)
  • Knowledge of the banking sector and payment domain (ISO20022 standard, SEPA and Swift messages)
  • Hands on knowledge of practices like Domain driven design, Event sourcing architecture patterns, microservices architecture and clean code.
  • Hands on knowledge of CI/CD, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes, REST, Maven and JUnit and also to have experience building distributed, highly available and high throughput applications
  • Degree in computer science and engineering, mathematical modelling or similar
  • Excellent written and spoken English communication skills, and familiar with international collaboration with different stakeholder groups

What We Offer

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions – and that we imagine you share with us.

People are driven by many different factors. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/08/2025. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Finn Abildgaard at finn.abildgaard@nordea.com.

We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do – when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customers’ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

Studies show that members of underrepresented communities don’t apply for jobs unless they tick all the qualification boxes. If this is part of why you hesitate to apply, we would like you to reconsider and give it a chance.

Maybe your profile fits our needs much better than you think.

Title: 🔍 BI-analyst med blik for både mennesker og forretning
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Brænder du for data – og er du nysgerrig på forretningen bag tallene? Kan du oversætte behov og systemer til output, der skaber reel værdi og gør en forskel? Så er du måske vores næste kollega.

🚀 Din hverdag

Hos os handler BI ikke om dashboards i sig selv – men om at hjælpe forretningen med at tage bedre beslutninger. Du bliver bindeleddet mellem de mennesker, der har behovene, og den data, der kan besvare dem.

Du Kommer Til At


arbejde tæt sammen med kolleger på tværs af teams og fagligheder
forstå og omsætte forretningsmål samt behov til konkrete løsninger med den tilgængelige data
gøre komplekst data forståeligt, så de faktisk kan blive anvendt med lethed til indsigter
udfordre vanetænkning, når ting kan effektiviseres eller når dataen viser en anden vej
sikre, at vi prioriterer det vigtigste først – og skaber værdi hurtigt
hjælpe forretningen hen mod data democratisation for at dine kolleger selv kan forstå og bruge data i hverdagen – vi tror nemlig på, at data også skal leve uden for BI-teamet.


Det er ikke afgørende, om du har erfaring fra vores branche – men det er vigtigt, at du brænder for at skabe sammenhæng mellem data, mennesker og retning.

💬 Dit kommende team

Du bliver en del af Finance & BI teamet, hvor der er højt til loftet, masser af idéer og hvor vi sætter pris på både innovation, ansvarlighed og nysgerrighed. Du kommer til at referere til vores Finance Director Annie, og får en nøglerolle i at løfte vores datamodenhed samt gøre BI til en naturlig del af forretningens beslutningsgrundlag.

“Noget af det fedeste ved rollen er, at det man laver faktisk bliver brugt og skaber værdi for dine kollegaer i hverdagen – også bare de små ting. Du behøver ikke lave store forkromede løsninger for at gøre en forskel. Tilgængeligheden og lysten til at hjælpe, betyder virkelig noget for kollegerne.” – din kommende kollega i BI, Fillip

🤝 Sådan arbejder vi

Vi arbejder tæt sammen, både i vores eget team og med resten af organisationen. Det betyder, at du sjældent sidder alene med en opgave, og at dialog med forretningen er en naturlig del af hverdagen. Vi tror på, at det bedste sker i samspil mellem data, mennesker og forretning.

Du bliver en aktiv sparringspartner for forretningen og hjælper kolleger med at forstå og anvende data i praksis. Det handler ikke bare om at præsentere tal, men om at omsætte dem til meningsfulde fortællinger, der understøtter beslutninger og giver retning.

Vi har en pragmatisk tilgang: Vi prioriterer det vigtigste først og prøver tingene af i små, men værdifulde skridt. Det behøver ikke være perfekt fra start – hellere en MVP vi lærer af, end en løsning der aldrig kommer i brug.

Vi værdsætter nysgerrighed, faglig sparring og evnen til at stille spørgsmål. Vi hjælper hinanden med at finde retningen, når opgaven er kompleks eller løsningen ikke er givet på forhånd.

🛠️ Værktøjskassen

Vi Arbejder Bl.a. Med


BigQuery og Dataform til datamodellering
Tableau til visualisering, erfaring med lignende er et krav
SQL – som du skal være rigtig skarp til
Kendskab til AI/predictive analytics er et plus, men ikke et krav
Kendskab til ETL og integrationer er også en fordel


Du behøver ikke kunne det hele – men du skal have lyst til at lære og bygge videre på det, du kan.

👀 Vi forestiller os, at du


Har erfaring som BI-analyst eller lignende
Tænker forretningsmæssigt og forstår, hvordan data skaber værdi
Har stærke kommunikationsevner – og formidler data og løsninger på en måde, der giver mening for både non-techy og techy kolleger.
Er selvstændig og tager ansvar, men trives i samarbejdet
Har blik for de tendenser og mønstre, som ikke altid er tydelige ved første øjekast – og du bruger dem til at stille de rigtige spørgsmål.
Tænker i større helheder, ikke kun i enkeltstående løsninger


🤖AI-kompetencer

Som medstiftere af AI-Kompetencepagten og med vores adm. direktør som viceforperson i AI-Kompetencerådet, er vi drevet af en vision om at fremme AI-forståelse bredt, både internt og eksternt. Hos os er AI ikke bare et værktøj, men en mulighed for at tænke nyt, skabe forandring, og finde innovative løsninger til vores kunder og medarbejdere.

Hvis du er nysgerrig og ser AI som en vej til at gøre en forskel for dig selv, dine kollegaer og vores kunder, så vil vi gerne have dig med på vores rejse.

⚖️Sund work-life balance og gode udviklingsmuligheder

Du får stadig tid til familie og venner! Hos os går vi op i, at dit arbejdsliv og privatliv er i harmoni. Derfor har du rig mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra, når det giver mening. Derudover får du gode karriere- og udviklingsmuligheder, som vi understøtter med din individuelle udviklingsplan, kurser og videndeling på tværs af hele Visma.

Du bliver fri for at smøre madpakke, for vi har den lækreste frokostordning, og når du har spist for meget, kan du gå med dine kolleger i vores eget fitnesscenter og kæmpe dig tilbage til den gode samvittighed. Eller få inspiration til fysisk og mental træning samt kost enten individuelt eller sammen med dine kolleger via vores program Visma Health.

Vi er gode til at være sociale sammen, og vores fest/aktivitetsudvalg arrangerer ofte fredagsbarer og udflugter ud af huset. Vi har desuden en årlig, stor sommerfest, som holdes i fællesskab med alle danske Visma-selskaber.

🚀Vil du med på holdet?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst i toppen og fortæl, hvorfor du gerne vil arbejde hos os. Søg allerede i dag ved at klikke på ”Ansøg om dette job”.

Vores mission er at skabe diversitet i vores teams, og vi tilskynder til inklusion, accept og forståelse ved at ansætte personer, der bringer unikke perspektiver til vores virksomhed.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, kan du skrive til Fillip på fillip.andreasen@visma.com eller Berit på berit.sogaard@visma.com.

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

🏢Din nye arbejdsplads

Carlsberg Byen er hjemstedet for samtlige af Vismas selskaber i hovedstadsområdet. Domicilet på 20.000 m² betegnes officielt som Emil Christian Hansen Hus og har plads til over 1100 medarbejdere. I daglig tale kalder vi domicilet for "Visma House", og det er placeret i gåafstand til både S-tog og metro.

Ud over store lyse kontorlokaler, rummer huset også atrium, gårdhaver, tagterrasse og kantine.

🔥Få plads blandt et hold af løn- og HR-ildsjæle

Hos Visma Enterprise er vi mere end 180 medarbejdere som servicerer mere end 1.300 kunder og deres 250.000 lønmodtagere. Vores kunder er primært mellemstore og store virksomheder med et behov for digitaliserede HRM-løsninger inden for personale-, løn-, tidsregistrering- og rekrutteringsprocesser.

Vi kan lidt af hvert og brænder for det vi laver. Alle arbejder vi sammen på kryds og tværs for at spille hinanden bedre. For vi tror på, at vi sammen skaber den bedste oplevelse for vores kunder og den bedste arbejdsplads for os alle!

🌐En del af noget meget stort

Visma er en af Europas førende udbydere af software og services, der forenkler og automatiserer administrative forretningsprocesser. Vi er stolte over at være del af Visma-familien, som har ca. 16.000 medarbejdere og 1,9 millioner kunder inden for den offentlige og private sektor fordelt over hele verden.

Title: Insights Trainee
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Company Description

Data science studiejob hos Publicis Groupe

Besidder du en solid matematisk profil med interesse for analyse, indsigter og strategi? Drømmer du om en karriere inden for konsulentbranchen, hvor du udforsker store datamængder for at opdage sammenhænge og indsigter, som du anvender til at levere strategisk rådgivning til nogle af landets største virksomheder samt internationale kunder? Så er du måske vores nye Junior Data Scientist!

Du vil blive en del af et ambitiøst Insights team, der stræber efter at blive de bedste inden for vores fag, hvor vi løbende arbejder med banebrydende projekter inden for marketingvidenskab. Vi er et travlt og målrettet team med en uformel omgangstone, hvor stærke kollegiale relationer vægter højt. Vi løfter i flok og har mange tværfaglige projekter, hvorfor intern sparring og kompetenceudvikling danner grundstenen for vores måde at arbejde på. Dette gælder også vores studentermedhjælpere, og du vil have mulighed for at skrive din kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.

Om jobbet

I Publicis Insights kommer du til at arbejde med mange aspekter inden for markedsanalyse og forbrugerindsigter. Du vil have din primære arbejdsgang i tæt samarbejde med resten af Insights teamets konsulenter hvor du vil komme til at arbejde med vores spritnye dataplatform.

Som Junior Data Scientist, kommer du primært til at supportere konsulenterne i teamet med udførelse af dataopgaver til forbruger- og markedsanalyser til bureauets kunder.

Stillingen er 15-20 timer om ugen med opstart hurtigst muligt.

Din Arbejdsdag Vil Typisk Bestå Af Nedenstående Arbejdsopgaver


Databearbejdning i Python, R, Excel eller Alteryx
Validering og kvalitetstjek af data
Udarbejdelse af analyser som kan præsenteres af teamets konsulenter
Ad hoc markedsanalyser eller analyser om forbrugeradfærd i f.eks. Index Danmark


Hvad vi leder efter


Du er i slutningen af din bachelor eller lige startet på din kandidat i fx Data Science, Matematik, Erhvervsøkonomilign.
Du er superbruger af Office-pakken.
Du er udpræget analytisk med forståelse af datastruktur.
Du har kendskab til Alteryx, Python, R og/eller SPSS.
Det vil være en fordel, men ikke et krav, at du har erfaring med et dataanalyse- og visualiseringsværktøj, såsom Power BI eller Tableau.
Du har drive, engagement og er opsøgende, samt ikke er bange for at påtage dig ansvar, som du selvstændigt trives med at bære.
Du kan formulere dig klart og tydeligt på både dansk og engelsk - både i skrift og i tale.
Du er villig til at arbejde med korte deadlines og mere intensivt i perioder med spidsbelastning.


Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?


Et lærerigt arbejdsmiljø med fokus på personlig og faglig udvikling, hvor du selv er med til at definere retningen for egen udvikling samt egne interesseområder.
Et selvstændigt og ansvarsfuldt job i et team med stærke ambitioner og mål.
Fleksible arbejdstider, som du selv planlægger inden for det aftalte timeantal, samt særlig fleksibilitet i eksamensperioder.
Mulighed for at skrive kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.
Gode kollegiale relationer i et livligt kontormiljø placeret i hjertet af København K med masser af sociale og faglige arrangementer.


Er du interesseret?

Så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning! Hvis du har spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Maya Jensen på maya.jensen@publicisgroupe.com.

Vi holder løbende samtaler, så send din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Ansøgningen skal sendes sammen med dit cv og eventuelle referencer.

Om Publicis Groupe

Publicis Groupe er den andenstørste medie- og reklamebureaugruppe i verden med over 85.000 specialister. Vi har en holistisk tilgang til at løse vores kunders udfordringer, da vi forener vores ekspertise inden for medier, kreativitet, data og teknologi og tilbyder integrerede løsninger, transformative ideer og overbevisende forbrugeroplevelser. Vi kalder det Power Of One.

På vores danske kontor sidder vi 60 medarbejdere fokuseret på at levere integrerede løsninger til vores lokale og internationale kunder inden for medier, kreativitet, data & teknologi samt forskning & strategi. Vi er stolte vindere af mange priser og nomineringer, både i Danmark og internationalt. Men intet gør os stoltere end at arbejde med kunder og brands som Salling Group, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Renault, Nestlé, Disney, Pfizer, Haleon og mange flere.

Vores fantastisk kontor er lokaliseret i centrum af København tæt placeret på bus, Metro og togstation.
Show more
HTML:

Du vil blive en del af et ambitiøst Insights team, der stræber efter at blive de bedste inden for vores fag, hvor vi løbende arbejder med banebrydende projekter inden for marketingvidenskab. Vi er et travlt og målrettet team med en uformel omgangstone, hvor stærke kollegiale relationer vægter højt. Vi løfter i flok og har mange tværfaglige projekter, hvorfor intern sparring og kompetenceudvikling danner grundstenen for vores måde at arbejde på. Dette gælder også vores studentermedhjælpere, og du vil have mulighed for at skrive din kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.

Om jobbet

I Publicis Insights kommer du til at arbejde med mange aspekter inden for markedsanalyse og forbrugerindsigter. Du vil have din primære arbejdsgang i tæt samarbejde med resten af Insights teamets konsulenter hvor du vil komme til at arbejde med vores spritnye dataplatform.

Som Junior Data Scientist, kommer du primært til at supportere konsulenterne i teamet med udførelse af dataopgaver til forbruger- og markedsanalyser til bureauets kunder.

Stillingen er 15-20 timer om ugen med opstart hurtigst muligt.

Din Arbejdsdag Vil Typisk Bestå Af Nedenstående Arbejdsopgaver

  • Databearbejdning i Python, R, Excel eller Alteryx
  • Validering og kvalitetstjek af data
  • Udarbejdelse af analyser som kan præsenteres af teamets konsulenter
  • Ad hoc markedsanalyser eller analyser om forbrugeradfærd i f.eks. Index Danmark

Hvad vi leder efter

  • Du er i slutningen af din bachelor eller lige startet på din kandidat i fx Data Science, Matematik, Erhvervsøkonomilign.
  • Du er superbruger af Office-pakken.
  • Du er udpræget analytisk med forståelse af datastruktur.
  • Du har kendskab til Alteryx, Python, R og/eller SPSS.
  • Det vil være en fordel, men ikke et krav, at du har erfaring med et dataanalyse- og visualiseringsværktøj, såsom Power BI eller Tableau.
  • Du har drive, engagement og er opsøgende, samt ikke er bange for at påtage dig ansvar, som du selvstændigt trives med at bære.
  • Du kan formulere dig klart og tydeligt på både dansk og engelsk - både i skrift og i tale.
  • Du er villig til at arbejde med korte deadlines og mere intensivt i perioder med spidsbelastning.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde dig?

  • Et lærerigt arbejdsmiljø med fokus på personlig og faglig udvikling, hvor du selv er med til at definere retningen for egen udvikling samt egne interesseområder.
  • Et selvstændigt og ansvarsfuldt job i et team med stærke ambitioner og mål.
  • Fleksible arbejdstider, som du selv planlægger inden for det aftalte timeantal, samt særlig fleksibilitet i eksamensperioder.
  • Mulighed for at skrive kandidatafhandling i forlængelse af arbejdet, hvor teamet vil stå til rådighed med leveringen af data og løbende sparring.
  • Gode kollegiale relationer i et livligt kontormiljø placeret i hjertet af København K med masser af sociale og faglige arrangementer.

Er du interesseret?

Så ser vi frem til at modtage din ansøgning! Hvis du har spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Maya Jensen på maya.jensen@publicisgroupe.com.

Vi holder løbende samtaler, så send din ansøgning hurtigst muligt. Ansøgningen skal sendes sammen med dit cv og eventuelle referencer.

Om Publicis Groupe

Publicis Groupe er den andenstørste medie- og reklamebureaugruppe i verden med over 85.000 specialister. Vi har en holistisk tilgang til at løse vores kunders udfordringer, da vi forener vores ekspertise inden for medier, kreativitet, data og teknologi og tilbyder integrerede løsninger, transformative ideer og overbevisende forbrugeroplevelser. Vi kalder det Power Of One.

På vores danske kontor sidder vi 60 medarbejdere fokuseret på at levere integrerede løsninger til vores lokale og internationale kunder inden for medier, kreativitet, data & teknologi samt forskning & strategi. Vi er stolte vindere af mange priser og nomineringer, både i Danmark og internationalt. Men intet gør os stoltere end at arbejde med kunder og brands som Salling Group, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Renault, Nestlé, Disney, Pfizer, Haleon og mange flere.

Vores fantastisk kontor er lokaliseret i centrum af København tæt placeret på bus, Metro og togstation.

Title: Senior Global Logistics Data Analyst - Viby J
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK

Are you passionate about transforming logistics data into actionable insights that drive global impact?

Join us at a pivotal moment as we build our global logistics data analytics foundation—shape how we work, scale, and create value from day one!

"You'll be joining a small, focused team at the early stage of building a global logistics data analytics setup. That means you’ll help shape how we work, how we scale, and how we unlock value from our data foundation,” says Yien Lai Bech.

How You Will Make An Impact

As our new Senior Global Logistics Data Analyst, you will be hands-on in developing structured, well-governed data products that bring clarity to operational decisions. You’ll collaborate closely with both technical and business stakeholders, connecting data, tools, and teams to create scalable impact across our logistics operations.

Your Key Responsibilities


Build and maintain data pipelines, models, and transformations in Databricks (preferably on Azure) using SQL and Python.
Design and optimise mart-layer data models to support self-service analytics and seamless Power BI integration.
Develop advanced Power BI reports, ensuring best practices in data model design, DAX, visualisation, and report performance.
Drive data governance by managing ownership, documentation, access control, and quality monitoring.
Evaluate and harmonise local analytics use cases, guiding standardisation and strategy for global vs. local data ownership.


You will be part of a small, agile team within our global logistics organisation, collaborating across markets. Occasional travel to logistics sites in Denmark, Sweden, Germany, UK, and Poland is expected (20–30 days/year).

What Will Make You Successful

You have a Master’s degree in Supply Chain Management, or a similar field, with a solid academic foundation and work experience in data modelling, statistics, or programming.

We are looking for a hands-on data professional with


Advanced skills in SQL and Python, and extensive experience with Databricks on Azure.
Proven expertise in data architecture (raw, curated, mart layers) and Power BI development.
Familiarity with data governance, documentation, and version control tools like GitHub.
Ability to understand complex logistics operations and translate business needs into structured data solutions.
Strategic thinking to harmonise and scale analytics products, with a proactive, self-directed approach.
At least 3 years’ experience within Supply Chain, with strong project management skills and a deep understanding of production and logistics processes.


What sets you apart is your ability to think beyond the immediate request. You look at local reporting solutions and see opportunities to harmonise, standardise, and scale. You can assess whether something should remain locally owned or be elevated to a global product — and you’re confident making those calls with business stakeholders.

What do we offer?

We’re committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. You’ll join a market leader who produces nutritious household-favourite brands in a way that makes things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world. Here, your curiosity and willingness to lead will be valued as you help shape our analytics journey from the ground up.

Would you like to join us?

If you want to play a key role in shaping the future of our global logistics analytics, seize this exciting opportunity. Please apply as soon as possible, as we will process applications on a continuous basis and close the recruitment once the right candidate is found.

For additional information, please contact Senior Logistics Development Manager, Yien Lai Bech at +45 9131 2840.

Shape the Future of Dairy

Arla is a global leader in the dairy industry, committed to producing high-quality products while championing sustainability and innovation. We're passionate about people and our planet, striving to unleash the full potential in each of us. Our goal is to make healthy dairy nutrition and good food habits accessible to all. Join us at Arla Foods and become part of a worldwide cooperative dedicated to making a significant impact on the planet and steering the dairy industry towards a sustainable future.

We are devoted to creating a workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered to bring their authentic selves to work. Diversity and collaboration are key to our success, propelling us to new heights in the dairy industry.

Ref. 101873

Title: Student Data Scientist (ML)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you a student interested in data and ready to apply your skills to real-world challenges? At Danske Bank, we’re looking for a Student Assistant in Data Science to join our Customer Intelligence team — where we use data and machine learning to better understand and serve our customers.

You’ll support projects that shape how we personalize experiences, predict customer needs, and drive smarter marketing and service decisions.

💼 What You’ll Do

As part of a skilled and supportive team, you’ll assist with a range of tasks that support the development and deployment of machine learning models for retail banking use cases:


Help prepare and explore customer data (transactional, behavioral, demographic)
Support ongoing work on churn prediction, propensity modelling, segmentation, and CLV estimation
Run exploratory analyses and assist with feature engineering and data validation
Contribute to internal documentation, data quality checks, and model evaluation
Learn about model governance, responsible AI, and data-driven decision-making in banking
Work closely with experienced data scientists in an environment focused on learning and collaboration


📚 What We’re Looking For


You’re currently enrolled in a relevant degree (e.g., Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics with a quantitative focus)
You have a strong interest in machine learning, customer behavior, and applied data analytics
You’re comfortable with Python and familiar with tools like pandas, NumPy, or scikit-learn
You’re proactive, analytical, and curious — with a willingness to learn and contribute
You can commit to working 15–20 hours per week alongside your studies


💡 Nice To Have (But Not Required)


Experience working with real-world datasets in a project or internship
Familiarity with SQL, cloud platforms (e.g., Azure), or MLOps tools
Interest in retail banking, financial services, or digital marketing analytics


🌟 What We Offer


A hands-on opportunity to work with real customer data in a leading bank
A friendly and collaborative team culture that values learning and development
Flexible working hours tailored to your academic schedule
The chance to see how AI and data science are used in a highly regulated, customer-focused industry
Working in our new HQ with great facilities


📩 Interested?

Please apply for the position by submitting your CV and cover letter through our careers page or LinkedIn ! Let’s build the future of AI together!

First interviews will take place in August, so don’t hold back!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)
Description:
Denmark

Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)

Organization


UN High Commissioner for Refugees


Posted 24 Jul 2025 Closing date 7 Aug 2025

Deadline for Applications

August 7, 2025

Terms of Reference

UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is offering a full-time internship with the Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section of the Global Data Service (GDS) in Copenhagen, Denmark. UNHCR is a global organization dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for asylum seekers, refugees, returnees, internally displaced communities and stateless people.

Access to reliable, timely, relevant and accurate data on these populations is essential to enhance their protection and support the achievement of durable solutions. The Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section develops statistical definitions and standards and oversees the production of global statistics on refugees and other populations of concern to UNHCR. The Agency’s Data Transformation Strategy 2020-2025 aims to position UNHCR as a trusted leader on data and information related to refugees and other populations of concern.

The internship is based in Copenhagen with GDS’ Statistics, Data Science, and Survey Section (SDSS). The intern will join the Secretariat of the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), work under the direct supervision of the Head of the Secretariat and in close collaboration with other secretariat colleagues and units within SDSS.

Title: Statistics Project Intern (EGRISS Monitoring and Coordination)

Duty Station: Copenhagen, Denmark

Duration: 6 months (with possible 2-month extension)

Contract Type: Internship

Start date: 01 October 2025

Organizational context

Increasingly, UNHCR’s data efforts rely on joint engagements with partners to better achieve outcomes for those affected by forced displacement. As part of these efforts, UNHCR has taken a leading role in the Expert Group on Refugee, IDP and Statelessness Statistics (EGRISS), both as a Steering Committee member and through hosting its Secretariat. The EGRISS currently consists of 61 countries and 38 international and regional organisations.

The EGRISS was established in 2016 by the UN Statistical Commission to develop recommendations on refugee and IDP statistics and produce guidance for their implementation at country level. The International Recommendations on Refugee (IRRS) and IDP (IRIS) Statistics were endorsed in 2018 and 2020, respectively, and implementation work is ongoing through advocacy, capacity building, and further methodological development. Most recently, the International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) have been endorsed by the UN Statistical Commission in 2023. All three sets of recommendations aim to contribute to the improvement of official statistics on the identified populations produced through the national statistical systems of affected countries.

A central focus of EGRISS’ third mandate (2020-2025) concerns capacity development which is pursued through regional engagement, technical support, guidance provision and online learning. The Secretariat also invests in monitoring the application of the international statistical recommendations by countries and institutions alike to feed into annual reporting processes. During the period 2020-2024, over 253 concrete examples of implementation have been identified. In 2023, the EGRISS Secretariat has revised its implementation monitoring system, launching it as Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey improving the quality of the data it collects, and the insights that can be drawn from analysis of collected data. In following years, Secretariat has conducted annual evaluations of GAIN survey, to further improve scope and coverage of monitoring progress made by countries and international organizations to pursue statistical inclusion of refugees, IDPs and stateless persons. Implementation of identified improvements in GAIN 2025 round, will enable more precise identification of best practices, upcoming activities, enhance knowledge dissemination, inform peer-to peer learning and future improvements of the recommendations.

The position

We are seeking an intern to assist the EGRISS Secretariat in a range of activities with a focus on in the revision and implementation of the EGRISS GAIN survey and management of the associated monitoring database that tracks the application of international recommendations. As an intern, you will work closely with the EGRISS Secretariat staff and relevant EGRISS members to ensure the successful planning, execution, and reporting of the GAIN survey. The internship will provide you with hands-on experience in survey design, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

Duties and responsibilities


Support EGRISS monitoring & evaluation activities, including updates and implementation of EGRISS Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey:
Assist in the updates to GAIN survey questionnaire, based on lessons learned from the evaluation process, questionnaire translation in survey languages, update of survey protocols, including a pilot test for 2025 round of the survey
Help implement survey schedule and logistics plan
Assist in identification of additional focal points from national statistical systems to enhance the scope of GAIN 2025 survey and obtain necessary permissions and clearances to include them in the 2025 data collection
Participate in pre-survey briefings with institutional respondents (e.g., regional EGRISS partners, national and global institutions with large number of examples) for coordinating dissemination
Help conduct the GAIN 2025 survey as per the updated and approved methodology and protocols
Assist respondents with any additional information during data collection to ensure adherence to protocols
Support follow up interviews with selected respondents to complete GAIN survey dataset
Help compile and organize the collected data
Assist in cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy and completeness
Assist in analysing the data using appropriate statistical techniques
Help prepare GAIN survey results based on identified tables needed for EGRISS annual and supplemental reporting, workplans of technical sub-working groups, regional engagement and other dissemination efforts
Help update other dissemination tools, like GAIN survey dashboards and infographics.
Assist in disseminating the report to stakeholders
Document lessons learned and best practices through 2026 round of GAIN survey evaluation
Assist in preparing an annual archive of implemented documents, datasets, and reports
Other duties as assigned
Support the implementation of other EGRISS activities possibly including:
Annual Report, including development of case studies.
Research, analysis or editorial work related to ongoing methodological papers on topics such as identification questions for household surveys or measuring progress towards durable solutions for IDPs.
Support organization and coordination of meetings, documentation of decisions and actions agreed and necessary logistical arrangements.
Support the effective implementation of EGRISS Secretariat’s responsibilities.


Minimum Qualifications Required

In order to be considered for an internship, candidates must meet the following eligibility criteria:


Be either a recent graduate (having completed their studies within two years of


applying) or a current student in a graduate/undergraduate school programme from a university or higher education facility accredited by IAU/UNESCO1; and


Have completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of UNHCR.
not have exhausted the maximum cumulative internship period with UNHCR, including any prior internships (8 months for full-time and 12 months for part-time)


NOTE: An individual who bears the relationship of parent, child or sibling or step-parent, step-child or step-sibling to a current UNHCR staff member or affiliate is not eligible for an internship.

Required Experience And Competencies


Fluency in English language
The intern has displayed an interest in and comprehension of official statistics (and/or operational data) from a variety of sources, such as surveys, administrative data, census data, operational data, big data, and other types of data.
Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Interest to pursue career in humanitarian/development action, forced displacement, migration or related field.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience with statistical software (e.g., SPSS, Stata, R, Pyhton)
Experience with data visualization software (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau)
Ability to work independently and in a team setting
Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines


Desirable Qualifications And Skills


Have completed university degree (BA) of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of EGRISS, in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Economics, International Relations, Social Science or any other related field
Knowledge of survey methodology and data analysis techniques is a plus
Knowledge of another UN language such as French, Spanish, Russian or Arabic is an asset


Conditions

It is a full-time role with working hours starting from 8.30am to 5:00pm Monday to Friday (40 hours per week). The successful candidate will be assigned to support the team in Copenhagen and must be available to work full-time for the duration of the internship.

Allowance: Interns who do not receive financial support from an outside party will receive an allowance to partially help to cover the cost of food, local transportation and living expenses.

Travel: Unless provided or paid by external sponsoring entities, UNHCR reimburse interns engaged from a location outside of the country of the duty station for the ticket costs of their outward and return travel to/from the duty station by the most economical route available on economy class, irrespective of the duration of the journey. Reimbursement shall be limited to the authorized outward and return travel between the intern’s country of residence and the intern’s duty station, or actual route of travel, whichever is lower.

How to apply

Interested applicants should submit their application through www.unhcr.org/careers.html

Obligations

Acquiring and renewing current visas, residence permits including all associated costs, obtaining medical certification and compliance with taxation requirements (if applicable), are the responsibility of the intern. However, the office can assist interns with the initiation of the visa process.

The selected candidate will need to provide UNHCR with a proof of health insurance coverage applicable to the assigned internship location and a certificate of good health from a qualified medical practitioner certifying their fitness for work and travel. In the event the selected candidate is not able to produce the required certificates, they will not be admitted to the Internship Programme.

If you are a person with a disability and you expect you may face challenges during the recruitment process, you can indicate it in your application form.

There are options to select any health conditions you may have and outline any necessary adjustments related to disabilities during the recruitment phases. Providing this information is optional. It will be treated as strictly confidential and used only for the purpose of finding out how to better assist you during the recruitment process.

Adjustments for candidates with disabilities will be provided as best as possible and as needed upon request.

All candidates will be assessed based on meeting the requirements for each vacancy in relation to experience, skills, and education.

The UNHCR workforce consists of many diverse nationalities, cultures, languages and opinions. UNHCR seeks to sustain and strengthen this diversity to ensure equal opportunities as well as an inclusive working environment for its entire workforce. Applications are encouraged from all qualified candidates without distinction on grounds of race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing or training.

We welcome applications from candidates with a refugee or stateless background.

In the education section of the application, please make sure that your school is selected from the list of accredited higher education institutions when creating a profile in UNHCR Recruitment Portal - Workday. To do this, click on the magnifying glass next to Select School, then select Contains next to Description, type in the name of the school, click Look up and finally click on the result.

How to apply

Please apply here before 07 August 2025 23:59 (CEST).

Job details

Denmark


City Copenhagen Source


UN High Commissioner for Refugees


Type


Internship


Career category


Information Management


Years of experience


0-2 years


Theme


Water Sanitation Hygiene
