Most recently, the International Recommendations on Statelessness Statistics (IROSS) have been endorsed by the UN Statistical Commission in 2023. All three sets of recommendations aim to contribute to the improvement of official statistics on the identified populations produced through the national statistical systems of affected countries.

A central focus of EGRISS’ third mandate (2020-2025) concerns capacity development which is pursued through regional engagement, technical support, guidance provision and online learning. The Secretariat also invests in monitoring the application of the international statistical recommendations by countries and institutions alike to feed into annual reporting processes. During the period 2020-2024, over 253 concrete examples of implementation have been identified. In 2023, the EGRISS Secretariat has revised its implementation monitoring system, launching it as Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey improving the quality of the data it collects, and the insights that can be drawn from analysis of collected data. In following years, Secretariat has conducted annual evaluations of GAIN survey, to further improve scope and coverage of monitoring progress made by countries and international organizations to pursue statistical inclusion of refugees, IDPs and stateless persons. Implementation of identified improvements in GAIN 2025 round, will enable more precise identification of best practices, upcoming activities, enhance knowledge dissemination, inform peer-to peer learning and future improvements of the recommendations.

The position

We are seeking an intern to assist the EGRISS Secretariat in a range of activities with a focus on in the revision and implementation of the EGRISS GAIN survey and management of the associated monitoring database that tracks the application of international recommendations. As an intern, you will work closely with the EGRISS Secretariat staff and relevant EGRISS members to ensure the successful planning, execution, and reporting of the GAIN survey. The internship will provide you with hands-on experience in survey design, data collection, analysis, and reporting.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Support EGRISS monitoring & evaluation activities, including updates and implementation of EGRISS Global Annual Inclusion (GAIN) survey:
  • Assist in the updates to GAIN survey questionnaire, based on lessons learned from the evaluation process, questionnaire translation in survey languages, update of survey protocols, including a pilot test for 2025 round of the survey
  • Help implement survey schedule and logistics plan
  • Assist in identification of additional focal points from national statistical systems to enhance the scope of GAIN 2025 survey and obtain necessary permissions and clearances to include them in the 2025 data collection
  • Participate in pre-survey briefings with institutional respondents (e.g., regional EGRISS partners, national and global institutions with large number of examples) for coordinating dissemination
  • Help conduct the GAIN 2025 survey as per the updated and approved methodology and protocols
  • Assist respondents with any additional information during data collection to ensure adherence to protocols
  • Support follow up interviews with selected respondents to complete GAIN survey dataset
  • Help compile and organize the collected data
  • Assist in cleaning and validating the data to ensure accuracy and completeness
  • Assist in analysing the data using appropriate statistical techniques
  • Help prepare GAIN survey results based on identified tables needed for EGRISS annual and supplemental reporting, workplans of technical sub-working groups, regional engagement and other dissemination efforts
  • Help update other dissemination tools, like GAIN survey dashboards and infographics.
  • Assist in disseminating the report to stakeholders
  • Document lessons learned and best practices through 2026 round of GAIN survey evaluation
  • Assist in preparing an annual archive of implemented documents, datasets, and reports
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Support the implementation of other EGRISS activities possibly including:
  • Annual Report, including development of case studies.
  • Research, analysis or editorial work related to ongoing methodological papers on topics such as identification questions for household surveys or measuring progress towards durable solutions for IDPs.
  • Support organization and coordination of meetings, documentation of decisions and actions agreed and necessary logistical arrangements.
  • Support the effective implementation of EGRISS Secretariat’s responsibilities.

Minimum Qualifications Required

In order to be considered for an internship, candidates must meet the following eligibility criteria:

  • Be either a recent graduate (having completed their studies within two years of

applying) or a current student in a graduate/undergraduate school programme from a university or higher education facility accredited by IAU/UNESCO1; and

  • Have completed at least two years of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of UNHCR.
  • not have exhausted the maximum cumulative internship period with UNHCR, including any prior internships (8 months for full-time and 12 months for part-time)

NOTE: An individual who bears the relationship of parent, child or sibling or step-parent, step-child or step-sibling to a current UNHCR staff member or affiliate is not eligible for an internship.

Required Experience And Competencies

  • Fluency in English language
  • The intern has displayed an interest in and comprehension of official statistics (and/or operational data) from a variety of sources, such as surveys, administrative data, census data, operational data, big data, and other types of data.
  • Strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Interest to pursue career in humanitarian/development action, forced displacement, migration or related field.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
  • Experience with statistical software (e.g., SPSS, Stata, R, Pyhton)
  • Experience with data visualization software (e.g., PowerBI, Tableau)
  • Ability to work independently and in a team setting
  • Ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines

Desirable Qualifications And Skills

  • Have completed university degree (BA) of undergraduate studies in a field relevant or of interest to the work of EGRISS, in Statistics, Demography, Public Policy, Economics, International Relations, Social Science or any other related field
  • Knowledge of survey methodology and data analysis techniques is a plus
  • Knowledge of another UN language such as French, Spanish, Russian or Arabic is an asset

Conditions

It is a full-time role with working hours starting from 8.30am to 5:00pm Monday to Friday (40 hours per week). The successful candidate will be assigned to support the team in Copenhagen and must be available to work full-time for the duration of the internship.

Allowance: Interns who do not receive financial support from an outside party will receive an allowance to partially help to cover the cost of food, local transportation and living expenses.

Travel: Unless provided or paid by external sponsoring entities, UNHCR reimburse interns engaged from a location outside of the country of the duty station for the ticket costs of their outward and return travel to/from the duty station by the most economical route available on economy class, irrespective of the duration of the journey. Reimbursement shall be limited to the authorized outward and return travel between the intern’s country of residence and the intern’s duty station, or actual route of travel, whichever is lower.

How to apply

Interested applicants should submit their application through www.unhcr.org/careers.html

Obligations

Acquiring and renewing current visas, residence permits including all associated costs, obtaining medical certification and compliance with taxation requirements (if applicable), are the responsibility of the intern. However, the office can assist interns with the initiation of the visa process.

The selected candidate will need to provide UNHCR with a proof of health insurance coverage applicable to the assigned internship location and a certificate of good health from a qualified medical practitioner certifying their fitness for work and travel. In the event the selected candidate is not able to produce the required certificates, they will not be admitted to the Internship Programme.

If you are a person with a disability and you expect you may face challenges during the recruitment process, you can indicate it in your application form.

There are options to select any health conditions you may have and outline any necessary adjustments related to disabilities during the recruitment phases. Providing this information is optional. It will be treated as strictly confidential and used only for the purpose of finding out how to better assist you during the recruitment process.

Adjustments for candidates with disabilities will be provided as best as possible and as needed upon request.

All candidates will be assessed based on meeting the requirements for each vacancy in relation to experience, skills, and education.

The UNHCR workforce consists of many diverse nationalities, cultures, languages and opinions. UNHCR seeks to sustain and strengthen this diversity to ensure equal opportunities as well as an inclusive working environment for its entire workforce. Applications are encouraged from all qualified candidates without distinction on grounds of race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

UNHCR does not charge a fee at any stage of its recruitment process (application, interview, meeting, travelling, processing or training.

We welcome applications from candidates with a refugee or stateless background.

In the education section of the application, please make sure that your school is selected from the list of accredited higher education institutions when creating a profile in UNHCR Recruitment Portal - Workday. To do this, click on the magnifying glass next to Select School, then select Contains next to Description, type in the name of the school, click Look up and finally click on the result.

How to apply

Please apply here before 07 August 2025 23:59 (CEST).

  • Denmark

City Copenhagen Source

  • UN High Commissioner for Refugees

Type

  • Internship

Career category

  • Information Management

Years of experience

  • 0-2 years

Theme

  • Water Sanitation Hygiene

Title: Student Assistant Insights and analytics
Description:
Student Assistant Insights and Analytics

Please apply for this role with an English CV







About PureGym

Since our launch in 2009, Puregym has been pioneering the model for affordable, flexible, high-quality gyms and our mission to inspire a healthier nation by helping more people in more places live healthier lives has led us to be Denmark’s leading gym chain with over 160 sites. Alongside our Danish success, we are also a leading international operator with 360+ clubs in UK, 40+ clubs in Switzerland and new openings in the USA, Saudi Arabia and UAE.




We are driven by the passionate people of PureGym, who create brilliant environments for our members and the communities we serve. Our unique "Everybody Welcome" approach provides a friendly, warm and welcoming environment for our members and our ambition to double in size over the next few years gives a great opportunity for our teams to grow and accelerate their careers.




The Role

We are a value business, focused on making gyms and fitness accessible to as many people as possible. Data is at the heart of how we run our business, starting from where to open our gyms, through what we offer within them through to how we engage with past, current, and future members. Combining the data from our over 2 million members with data about locations, operations, and performance allows us to unlock industry leading insights and drive a better member experience and commercial performance.




Data is a core competitive advantage to use as market leader, helping us guide decisions at scale and personalisation at the member level. To unlock the value of data, PureGym has built a Group Insights & Analytics function, comprised of an Insights, a Data Engineering, and a Data Science team, recognising the importance of close collaboration of data teams to quickly and efficiently deliver business value.




We are looking to hire a Student Analyst into our Insights team, which includes:

Delivering parts of data-driven insights projects across the entire PureGym Group
Maintain and develop our suite of Business Intelligence dashboards serving insights to the PureGym DK organisation
Undertake deep-dive data analyses to better how we can a improve the member experience and create business value
Leverage PureGym's unique data assets and work with Azure Databricks technology, leveraging modern cloud-native technologies and data lakehouse architecture
Opportunities to work with our data scientists and data engineers to get a broad exposure to data projects and applications




The person

Currently studying for a degree in data science, economics or similar with a strong quantitative focus.
Proficient in Python and SQL.
Experience building data visualisations
Knowledge of data scraping is a plus.
Innovative and curious: constantly seek to learn and find new and better ways of doing things; always interested to find new and better methods and technologies.
Excellent organisational and time management skills, with willingness and ability to take ownership of projects.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Vil du være med til at sætte retningen inden for Jyske Banks fremtidige datafundament og bidrage til udviklingen af løsninger, der optimerer vores datahåndtering? Er du klar til at forme Jyske Banks Data Warehouse?

Jobbet

Du vil arbejde i et erfarent udviklingsteam, Data Warehouse - Bank, der udvikler, driver og vedligeholder Jyske Banks Data Warehouse. Vores mission er at udstille data, til at sikre at Jyske Bank kan træffe de bedst mulige beslutninger. Teamets opgaver løses i tæt samarbejde med vores interessenter.

I teamet arbejder vi med:



At forbedre det eksisterende Data Warehouse med nye datadomæner for at imødekomme interessenternes behov
At sikre balance mellem kvalitet og udviklingshastighed
At indgå i dialog med forretningsenhederne om ønsker til datamodeller, forretningslogik og præsentation af data, så det kan nedbrydes i logiske leverancer
En agil organisering med SCRUM events, som sikrer en medledende og løsningsorienteret teamkultur, med solidt fokus på videndeling og personlig udvikling.
Support og drift af Jyske Banks Data Warehouse



Vi er professionelle og gør os umage hver dag, og har et stort fokus på at det skal være sjovt at gå på arbejde. Vi forventer at alle bidrager med konstruktiv feedback og input til løsninger. Du vil få et grundigt introduktionsforløb, så du har det bedst mulige udgangspunkt for at komme godt i gang med opgaverne.

Vores ønsker:

Vi forventer, at du har en relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau og en stor interesse for Data Warehouse i en forretningsmæssig kontekst. Alternativt har du opnået tilsvarende akademiske færdigheder gennem erfaring. Du kan have et solidt kendskab til backend arkitektur og generelle udviklingsmetodikker.

Derudover forventer vi, at du:



Kender til Data Warehouse begreber og teknologier.
Har erfaring med SQL Server teknologi, T-SQL og SAS som programmeringssprog.
Har udviklet i ETL-værktøjer som SAS DI Studio eller lignende dataintegrationsværktøjer.
Bidrager med videndeling i teamet, hvor kompetenceudvikling og kontinuerlig læring er i fokus.
Har en solid forståelse for de nyeste teknologiske trends og værktøjer inden for Datawarehouse og formår at omsætte denne viden til forretningsmæssig værdi.
Er nysgerrig, dygtig analytisk og trives i et samarbejdsorienteret miljø, hvor du bidrager engageret med din faglige indsigt.



Det forventes desuden, at du er i stand til at formidle dig selv tydeligt på dansk.

Teamet Data Warehouse Bank holder til i Jyske Banks hjemsted i Silkeborg, samt i Glaskuben (Kalvebod Brygge 3, København), og du vælger selv hvilken lokation der passer dig bedst.

Hverdagen er organiseret i et hybrid setup, men vi prioriterer også at samle de to lokationer for at sikre sammenhængskraften i teamet.

Ansøgning

Vi oplever mangfoldighed som en fordel i vores opgaveløsning og i vores fællesskab. Derfor opfordrer vi alle til at søge.

Vi ser frem til at modtage din ansøgning, hvor du beskriver netop dine færdigheder i forhold til jobbet. Send et motiveret CV til os inden ansøgningsfristen d. 17. august.

HR Partner Stine Odgaard Ranum, vil tage sig af din ansøgning

Mere information

Interesseret? Har du spørgsmål om jobbet, så kan du ringe og få mere at vide:

Jesper Schaadt

Chapter Lead Afdeling: Data Warehouse

Telefon: 25 65 26 70
Show more

Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously – with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the site’s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a master’s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our Hillerød, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employee’s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.
Show more

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Hillerød, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customers’ products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one another’s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Student employee for US power trading team
Description:
Passionate about coding and markets? Launch your career as a junior quantitative analyst in US Power Trading, gain hands-on experience and help shape tomorrow’s energy strategies!

Here’s what the job entails
In this role, you will support the US Short Term Power Trading team with market analyses and data visualisation tools and thereby gain valuable insights into the US energy market.

Concretely, your responsibilities include:

conducting market analyses and testing market hypotheses using Python and SQL
support day-to-day trading activities
building and maintaining data visualisation tools by using Python



Meet the team
As our new junior quantitative analyst, you will join our US Short Term Power Trading Team, where we trade day-to-day power across large parts of the US. You will join a dedicated team of four colleagues who constantly strive to motivate, support and challenge each other. We have a curious mindset and an innovative approach to problem-solving, and we are always looking to improve our strategies and processes.

But enough about us… over to you!
As you will be responsible for your own projects, we see you as a detail-oriented and analytical person who always investigates ways to optimise and approaches challenges from different angles.

We also imagine that you:

are currently enrolled in a relevant education, such as finance, economics, natural sciences, computer science or a similar area
are interested in using the coding languages Python and SQL – perhaps already have some coding skills
can work approximately 15-20 hours per week
are proficient in English – both written and verbal



We’ll take good care of you
At Danske Commodities, we take great care of our people. Joining us means you’ll get a lot of great perks – including social events, cultural experiences, tasty food and benefits to better your health, your life and your future.

Here are some of the benefits we offer our employees:

Flexible working hours to fit with your studies

Vast development opportunities with the help of your own individual development plan, access to our DC University with 50+ courses as well as remote courses through Harvard Learning

Global career prospects as part of the Equinor group with +20,000 colleagues across the world

Unlimited paid children’s sick days no limit on paid absence days in relation to child sickness

Compensation for working night and weekend shifts

100+ yearly social and professional events including DC Sports and DC Talks events, gatherings in our book club, bicycle club, student network, wine club, CS:GO team and more

Various free tickets to family-friendly and cultural attractions

Discounts at hotels, restaurants, sports clubs and more

Organic food including a light breakfast, lunch buffet and snacks throughout the day

An office in the heart of Aarhus right next to the central train station

…. and much more

Recruitment process and relocation
You can read more about our recruitment process here. Please note that if you are an international candidate, we will reimburse travel expenses in connection with potential interviews and support you with the relocation process.

What we’re about
We're a tech-driven energy trading company present in +40 markets across five continents. Our +600 people are driven by a need to constantly better things. If you are too, we could very well be the right place for you. You'll join a collective of thinkers and doers. Aspiring chefs, runners, parents, beekeepers, gamers – the list goes on. We're highly specialised experts within our fields. But it’s actually our diversity of ideas we’re most proud of, which is why we continuously work on strengthening an inclusive culture where diverse teams thrive.

Our organisation is flat with an open-door policy. We expect you to care. About your work. About your own and your colleagues’ collective successes. And about the difference we make at Danske Commodities. Together with our parent company Equinor, we have the vision and strength to accelerate the energy transition and make an impact. Like no other.

In summer 2025, we'll be moving to our brand-new headquarters in Aarhus. Our future home, Akson, will be located in Sydhavnskvarteret – a vibrant district where business meets culture. On top of being in this urban oasis, we’ll enjoy state-of-the-art facilities – including our own barista coffee shop, modern fitness facilities and breathtaking views that will make every day at the office even sweeter. We can't wait.
Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for Governance and Frameworks
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Do you have a passion for working with risks and would you like to combine your business analyst competencies with supporting us on running and developing our reporting setup combined with business data analytics?

The Governance & Frameworks team is part of Core Functions in the Business Controls & Product Management (BCPM) function. We act as the first line risk function for the three business units in the Bank. Our responsibility is to protect products, processes, systems, data, and services from risks across different environments to bring value to customers and society. We do this by developing and delivering ongoing risk MI & reporting towards key stakeholders and Senior Leaders in the Personal Customers, Business Customers and Large Corporates & Institutions segments.

This is an opportunity to join a team of professionals where everyone has an important role to play in driving the Governance & Frameworks agenda. The team is located across Denmark, Sweden, Finland, Lithuania and Poland with daily interactions inside and outside the team.

“In our team, we believe in close collaboration and support. We expect that our colleagues take their responsibility seriously and, we are great believers that work should be fun. We do our best to contribute to a vibrant environment”. – Says Michael, hiring manager.


You will be working from one of our offices either in central Vilnius, Warsaw or Copenhagen with the opportunity to work from home 1-2 days a week.
Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you a different seniority for the role.


You will:

Contribute to running and developing our reporting solutions, ensuring timely, accurate and complete reporting, providing transparency and actionable insights relating to the overall risk picture and risk decisions. Moreover, you will be involved in business data analytics procuring and structuring data from across the organization to various projects.

Key responsibilities will include:


Be a key contributor to the running the reporting setup to support the risk management journey
Continuously work to maintain and improve existing MI & Reporting
Extract, develop and automate relevant data sources for reporting for various projects
Test during the process – both with colleagues within the department but also across the organisation
Develop relevant analysis to identify trends, key pain points and turn them into actionable insights in collaboration with the team


About you:

For our team to be at its best, collaboration, knowledge sharing, and timely execution are key. We are looking for a new colleague who can contribute with a structured and pragmatic approach, collaborates well within the team, and can handle multiple interactions with key stakeholders. It will also be important that you can look beyond the numbers, identify the underlying drivers of trends, and pinpoint key pain points. We need you to bring:


Solid experience in working with data visualisation in Tableau (or other visualisation tools)
Experience in working with Alteryx (extraction, transformation, and loading)
Experience with building queries in MS SQL (server management and governance skills are a plus)
Knowledge of operational risk management or Enterprise Risk Management (is beneficial)
Advanced English proficiencies that make you an excellent communicator, able to convey complex findings in a short and easily understandable manner


We offer:

Monthly salary range applies only if you work in Lithuania from 3600 EUR to 5400 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Analyst – Business Intelligence, Senior.

We hope to hear from you! Please be informed that the interview will start in August.

For any questions related to the position, feel free to contact Michael Anker Kristensen , Leader of Governance & Frameworks.

“Be yourself. We like it that way.”

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.


Show more

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst Lead Nordics
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Lead & Shape the Future of Marketing Analytics at Lunar!

At Lunar we are democratizing the power of money and changing the way we all bank, pay, and invest. Since starting in Aarhus in 2015, we've grown rapidly and are now a major player in the Nordics, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus and Stockholm 🚀




So who are we? Are we a tech company or a bank? Well, we're both, breaking free from the usual categories. Here, tech isn't just a cool add-on; it's the core of how we do things. With our own banking license, we go head-to-head with traditional banks. What sets us apart is the mix of tech and financial services, giving us the power to shake up a dusty industry that's ready for a change.




As we continue our journey to becoming the best everyday bank in the Nordics, we are looking for a Senior Marketing Data Analyst to lead and develop our marketing analytics function. This is a pivotal role where you will take full ownership of our marketing data strategy, driving advanced analytics and automation to optimize marketing ROI and scale our growth across the Nordics.




Be in the Driver’s Seat

As our new Senior Marketing Data Analyst Lead, you won’t just be working with data—you will be shaping and evolving the way we leverage data across marketing. You will set the vision for how we use analytics to fuel our marketing efforts, establish best practices, and build a function that delivers high-impact insights and measurable business outcomes.




You’ll be based in Copenhagen, embedded within our Marketing Function led by CMO Manuel Douchez you will report to Campaign & Acquisition Director Sally Armstrong leading the marketing analytics ship driving strategy, developing methodologies, and making sure data is at the heart of every decision we make.




What Will You Do?

Set and drive the strategy for marketing analytics, defining how we measure and optimize marketing effectiveness.
Establish and implement best practices for data analysis, reporting, and visualization, ensuring marketing performance is continuously improved.
Lead and innovate in advanced attribution modeling, leveraging machine learning, MMM (Marketing Mix Modeling), and Bayesian techniques to optimize marketing investments.
Develop and champion best-in-class marketing measurement methodologies, ensuring data integrity and actionable insights.
Take ownership of incrementality testing and media experimentation to enhance ROI and inform strategic decision-making.
Collaborate cross-functionally with data teams in Commercial, Product, and Finance to ensure alignment in methodologies, shared learnings, and commercial impact.
Act as the key strategic partner for marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations that shape our marketing approach.
Automate marketing analytics processes, leveraging AI and cutting-edge tools to enhance efficiency and insight generation.
Serve as the go-to expert for marketing data, ensuring all marketing initiatives align with broader business intelligence efforts.




Curious About the Lunar Culture? 💚

Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture, click here.

Is This You? Let’s Find Out!




We’re looking for someone who is eager to take ownership, build something incredible, and truly shape the future of marketing analytics at Lunar. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

Proven experience in a marketing data analytics or business intelligence role, ideally with a strong commercial focus.
Expertise in advanced attribution models, including MMM, machine learning, Bayesian techniques, and media mix modeling.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and data visualization tools.
Experience with Looker, Funnel.io, dbt, AWS, Redshift, Airflow, Git, or similar technologies.
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and executive-level reporting.
A passion for automation, AI-driven analytics, and streamlining marketing data processes.
Experience working cross-functionally, ensuring data-driven marketing decisions are aligned with commercial goals.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels.
Experience in high-volume, complex data environments such as fintech, banking, or large-scale consumer technology companies.




Are You Ready to Build the Future?

Apply now and let’s explore how you can take Lunar’s marketing analytics to the next level!

While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on LinkedIn for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our Instagram for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our blog for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰




Depending on the regulations in the country you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.

Title: Student Assistant - Data Engineering
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Again

At Again, we are tackling one of the planet’s most pressing issues— waste CO2 —by transforming emissions into the solution. Our innovative approach involves fermenting industrial waste gases into carbon-negative chemicals, thereby turning harmful emissions into valuable, emission-free green chemicals. With each tonne of product we create, we remove over 2 tonnes of carbon from the atmosphere. Backed by over $100 million in funding from top venture capital investors and the European Union’s Horizon 2020 programme, we’re poised for rapid growth and global impact. If you think we’re doomed - think Again

What you'll do


Continuous updating of databases for experimental data, ensuring integrity and completeness of raw and metadata
Writing basic data wrangling and analysis scripts
10-15 hours per week, consistent availability 2 days per week required, flexible around class schedule and exams periods.


About You


Undergraduate degree in a subject with data science/coding component (e.g. data science, statistics, computational biology)
Coding experience in R and/or Python and ideally SQL
Understanding of best practices in data management
Strong attention to detail, ability to work independently
Preferred:
Some knowledge of biology/experimental data
Basic experience with cloud data storage and cloud computing

What we promise you?


You get to work with a group of passionate scientists, working on challenging and meaningful projects
An inclusive, empowering and engaging work environment
This will be the journey of a lifetime – we are serious about our mission to reduce over 1 gigaton of CO₂ and you can play a pivotal role in making that happen


If you have questions regarding the role, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to reach out at hej@again.bio. We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: AI Student
Place: Nordborg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Impact You'll Make
Are you curious about Artificial Intelligence and excited to explore how it shapes real-world solutions? We’re looking for a motivated and open-minded Student Worker to join our AI and Machine Learning ML) team. You’ll work with engineers and project managers to explore, test, and contribute to innovative AI projects. Whether you’re an advanced student or just starting out, this is a hands-on opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and supportive environment.

What You’ll Be Doing

Help collect, label, and prepare data for AI and ML experiments
Explore and test ML models with guidance from experienced professionals
Participate in documenting results, sharing findings, and refining ideas
Participate in team meetings, code reviews, and knowledge sharing sessions
Support small research assignments or investigations into new AI methods.


What We're Looking For

Are you studying for a master’s degree in computer science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Robotics or related fields?
Are you curious about AI and ML and want to understand how they are applied in real products?
Enjoy thinking about complex problems and investigating them with others?
Have some experience with Python or are eager to learn.
Are you interested in tools like TensorFlow, PyTorch or scikit-learn – but it's okay if you haven't used them yet?
Enjoy working with others and sharing knowledge.
Want to develop your skills in a supportive and learning-focused environment.


What You'll Get from Us

A hands-on role on real AI projects – with room to explore and learn
Mentorship and feedback from experienced team members
Insights into how AI solutions are developed and deployed
Flexible work that fits around your studies
The chance to contribute to innovative products and ideas that matter
Show more

Title: Part-Time Analyst (m/f/d)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
PATRIZIA is a leading partner for global real assets.

The expertise and commitment of our global teams form the basis of our success. Shaping a sustainable future and making a positive contribution to society is what drives our daily business.

PATRIZIA Global Partners (PGP) is the company’s international real estate division, which invests throughout North America, Europe and Asia with best-in-class local operating partners. Most recently, PGP has launched the PATRIZIA Sustainable Communities fund, a real estate impact vehicle, and the PATRIZIA Global Real Estate Debt Fund, a specialised real estate debt strategy. It has also invested in a data centre platform across North and South America. PGP continues to evolve, actively pursuing opportunities in real estate private equity, real asset debt, and specialised investment strategies.

The role


We are looking for someone to join PGP’s team as soon as possible at our Copenhagen Office.
As a Part-time Analyst, you will join our investment and fund management team of ten dedicated professionals responsible for sourcing, analysing, selecting, and managing real estate investments through local operating partners. The role offers a broad range of assignments.


Your Responsibilities


Conduct macro- and micro-level market analysis, including sector-specific research
Perform financial and strategic analysis of investment opportunities, including financial modelling and return calculations
Preparation of Investment Committee materials
Prepare presentation materials for client meetings, investor briefings, and industry events
Maintain and update PGP’s proprietary deal database with information on investment opportunities
Benchmark performance and monitor risk across PGP’s investment portfolio
Meetings with international operating partners


What we look for


Strong analytical skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel and PowerPoint; knowledge of or willingness to learn VBA is an advantage
Strong academic track record with excellent verbal and written English skills
Preferably in the third year of a bachelor’s degree or the first year of a master’s degree in Economics, Business, Finance, or a related field
Self-motivated, driven, and an effective team player
Detail-oriented and thorough, with an interest in working in a dynamic, international, and engaging environment
The workload is approximately 15–20 hours per week, with flexibility on both sides during busy periods.


What we offer


Competitive remuneration package
Various skill building and learning opportunities through PATRIZIA Academy, like talent development programs and mentorship
Inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace (incl. ED&I Committee) in an international environment
Possibility to participate in different employee resource groups (NextGen, LGBTQ+ Alliance, Female Advance, Parents & Carer Network etc.)


Sounds like you?

If you have any questions, please contact Philip Olander, Associate Director, at philip.olander@patrizia.ag or on +45 2544 2052, or Peter Lindeschouw, Associate Director, at peter.lindeschouw@patrizia.ag or on +45 4216 0786.

Applications in English are welcome as soon as possible and no later than Friday, 22 August 2025. To apply, please email your cover letter, CV, academic transcripts, and any references to Job.DK@patrizia.ag.
Show more

Title: Analytics Engineer, Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Vivino in Copenhagen and play a pivotal role in democratizing wine for millions worldwide. You'll build and maintain the robust data foundation that delivers trusted KPIs and actionable insights, ensuring data powers every strategic decision and product enhancement as we continue to innovate and expand our global marketplace.




Provide actionable insights for product features

As an Analytics Engineer at Vivino, you will be key in building and maintaining a robust and scalable data foundation that powers decision-making across the organization. Working at the intersection of data engineering and analytics, your mission is to ensure a single source of truth, deliver trusted KPIs, and make data accessible and actionable through tools like DBT, Redshift, and Looker.




You will collaborate across product, commercial, and operational teams to deliver data models, dashboards, and structures that drive alignment, insight, and business outcomes.




Your primary responsibilities can be categorised as the following:




Own the data transformation layer: Design, build, and maintain well-documented, scalable, and testable data models in Redshift, primarily using dbt, to ensure a single source of truth
Define & deliver trusted KPIs: Consistently define, implement, and maintain core business KPIs, ensuring they are understood and utilized company-wide
Develop & maintain BI dashboards: Build and manage impactful Looker dashboards that provide actionable insights to Product, Commercial, Marketing, Finance, and leadership teams
Cross-functional partnership: Collaborate closely with product, commercial, and operational teams to scope analytical needs, define success metrics, and proactively surface insights to drive business outcomes
Champion data quality & accessibility: Drive continuous improvements in data quality, performance, and documentation, while promoting data literacy and self-service capabilities across the organization




A true partner and problem-solver, consistently driving value through data

While we prefer not to confine anyone within rigid categories, we believe you will thrive and succeed in this position if you can effectively showcase your experience or aptitude in the various aspects outlined below.




Proven track record in analytics engineering, data modeling, or advanced data analytics roles, ideally within a product or e-commerce environment
Mastery of SQL for complex data transformations and extensive hands-on experience with cloud data warehouses like Redshift, Snowflake, or BigQuery
Demonstrated expertise with dbt (data build tool) in a production environment, including building scalable, testable, and well-documented data models
Advanced proficiency with Business Intelligence platforms, specifically Looker (LookML, dashboard development, data exploration, and governance)
Solid understanding of dimensional modeling, KPI design, business metrics, and experience working with modern ELT/ETL data pipelines




Furthermore, we imagine you are sociable and supportive, thriving in a collaborative environment where you will work effectively across Product, Commercial, Marketing, and Finance teams. Your excellent communication skills allow you to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for diverse audiences, fostering data literacy and empowering informed decisions. You are naturally investigative and evaluative, possessing a strong understanding of e-commerce and product data. This enables you to proactively identify opportunities, define success metrics, and drive tangible business outcomes from our rich dataset. As a flexible and structured professional, you adapt seamlessly to evolving business needs while maintaining rigorous standards for data quality and robust data modeling practices. You are passionate about leveraging data to transform challenges into insights, ultimately contributing to Vivino's strategic success.




Working at Vivino

Working at Vivino is challenging, fun, and rewarding. We have an incredible, multicultural, and international work culture where we take care of and look out for each other. We appreciate new ideas and encourage everyone to bring them to the table. We are not afraid to make mistakes as long as we take ownership, learn from them, and support one another in continually improving. We have much fun at our weekly Friday bar, and Copenhagen's social committee hosts regular events.




Who are we?

TRUSTED BY MILLIONS TO DISCOVER AND BUY THE RIGHT WINE EVERY TIME

Vivino is the world's largest online wine marketplace and most downloaded wine app, powered by a community of millions. Vivino's unique wine shopping experience leverages community data to suggest personalized wine recommendations for each user. In addition to making wine discovery fun and effortless, Vivino is the best place for wine drinkers to buy wine. The Vivino app is available for download on Android and iOS devices.

We are a fast-paced, growing team with offices in San Francisco, California, and Copenhagen, Denmark. We also have teams worldwide in the UK, Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Germany, France, Ireland, Australia, and Hong Kong.

Our team is passionate about our core purpose - to empower people everywhere to enjoy wine to the fullest. We do that every day by building technology and leveraging data that puts the power back in the hands of the consumer. We do not see wine as a commodity but as an offering of a cultural experience that was once out of reach for many but is now open to everyone.




Our five core values are

Always Strive for Better
Work Together
Earn and Offer Trust
Be Approachable
Lead with Data




Commitment to diversity and inclusion

Vivino is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.




Application deadline: August 3, 2025

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Vejle, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join AutoProff – Build the Data Foundations of European Automotive Tech! 🚗📊

We’re looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing Empower platform team, based out of our Vejle headquarters or Copenhagen office.

At AutoProff, data is at the heart of how we grow and operate. As part of the Empower team, you’ll help build and evolve the core data platform that powers everything from operational insights to customer-facing analytics. You’ll work closely with platform engineers, analysts, and product teams to enable a modern, self-service, scalable data ecosystem.

We are transitioning from legacy BI systems to a modern, distributed data platform. This role is key to shaping the architecture, pipelines, and tooling that enable trusted, observable, and compliant data flows across the company. You’ll play a crucial role in ensuring that domain teams can produce, access, and act on data efficiently and securely, without relying on central bottlenecks.

Let's Dive Into Your Key Responsibilities, You Will


Design, build, and maintain data pipelines, orchestrations, and event-based data flows.
Support the migration to a data mesh model with embedded domain ownership.
Develop and maintain platform-level tools for monitoring, governance, and self-service access.
Collaborate with analytics, BI, and product teams to ensure data is reliable, reusable, and observable.
Partner with engineering teams to embed data practices into their service design and operations.
Contribute to the technical roadmap for AutoProff Data Platform alongside platform leadership.


The Need-to-have Skills


Proficiency in Python and SQL as essential programming skills for building, testing, and maintaining data pipelines and transformations.
Solid engineering experience with data pipeline tools (e.g., AWS Glue, Airflow, AWS Step Functions, AWS Lambda).
Proficiency in AWS data services (Athena, S3, Kinesis/Streams, Redshift, etc.).
Strong understanding of data governance, security, and privacy (e.g., GDPR, access controls).
Comfortable working with event-driven architectures and structured data across microservices.
Familiar with infrastructure-as-code (CDK or Terraform) and CI/CD practices.
Ability to collaborate across teams and explain complex data flows clearly.


The Nice-to-have Skills


Experience implementing data mesh or decentralized data platform architecture.
Familiarity with BI tools and embedded dashboards (e.g., QuickSight, icCube, Qlik).
Hands-on experience with data observability, lineage, and quality monitoring (e.g DataHub or GreatExpectations).
Some level of knowhow with real-time data setups (e.g. Snowplow, TimescaleDB)


We’re eager to hear from you! If this sounds like a great match and sparks your interest, don’t wait, apply today!

About AutoProff

AutoProff was founded in 2013 by the experienced car dealer Jesper Ratza in Denmark. The aim was to digitalize B2B used car trading, helping car dealers increase sales and improve profits. 

in August 2022, AutoScout24, the leading specialized pan-European online car marketplace, acquired a majority stake in AutoProff. The partnership has supported the rapid expansion of AutoProff's solutions across Europe and enables the creation of Europe's first fully integrated C2B-B2B-B2C dealing solution for used cars. 

At AutoProff, we specialize in providing online B2B used-car dealing solutions designed to improve the buying and selling experience for professional car dealers and their customers. 

We are the emerging European leader with more than 150,000 B2B used cars on our online trading platforms annually.   

With a focus on effective solutions, digitization and customer service, we are committed to being the home of B2B car dealing for European car dealers.

Title: Senior Consultant, Business Intelligence
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We’re looking for a Power BI Specialist with a passion for leveraging data to drive business transformation.

What
you
will
do

Based in Copenhagen, you will help clients across Europe harness the full potential of their data through interactive dashboards, robust data models, and actionable analytics. While you will play a key role in advising and guiding clients on high-level strategies, your primary focus will be on hands-on Power BI development and deployment.

In this role, you will:


Develop and optimise Power BI dashboards

Translate complex business requirements into well-structured data models
Build interactive Power BI dashboards that provide clear insights and foster data-driven decision-making
Implement best practices for data modelling, DAX calculations, and performance optimisation
Integrate data from multiple sources

Work with diverse data sets – spanning on-premises and cloud environments – to create unified, user-friendly views
Establish and maintain robust data pipelines, ensuring reliability and scalability
Consult on data and analytics strategy

Collaborate with clients to define their data and analytics goals, aligning Power BI solutions with broader business objectives
Provide input on governance, architecture, and ethical considerations for data-driven initiatives
Support AI-driven insights

Partner with AI specialists to embed predictive analytics and machine learning outputs into Power BI dashboards
Advise on data readiness for AI projects and ensure the seamless integration of AI-driven insights
Drive stakeholder engagement

Gather requirements, offer training, and conduct workshops to upskill clients on Power BI usage
Present findings and strategic recommendations to executive teams and business leaders
Project management

Coordinate tasks, timelines, and deliverables using structured methodologies
Communicate progress effectively to both internal teams and external stakeholders

What
you’ll
bring

We’re looking for individuals with:


Technical expertise

Hands-on experience in Power BI development
(data modelling, DAX, and visualisation best practices)
Familiarity with SQL, Python, or other relevant languages is a plus
Analytical mindset

Proven ability to translate business requirements into data solutions
Comfort working with complex data sets and deriving actionable insights
Communication skills

Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills
Fluency in English (Danish is a plus), with the ability to present technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Consultative approach

Some experience (or strong interest) in management consulting, ensuring you can advise on strategic data initiatives as well as deliver hands-on solutions
Flexibility and mobility

Willingness to travel within Europe to collaborate with diverse clients and teams

What we offer?

Working with Implement Consulting Group is your key to doing impactful work and contributing directly to transformative data initiatives in leading organisations across Europe. On top of that, this role will also give you plenty of opportunity to thrive in:


Professional growth

Engage in internal training, workshops, and keynotes to deepen your expertise in Power BI, data strategy, and emerging AI trends
A dynamic culture

Join an international consulting firm that values curiosity, collaboration, and a drive for excellence
Supportive environment

Thrive in a culture of trust, autonomy, and continuous learning, where your insights and creativity are highly valued

We look forward to hearing from you and exploring how your Power BI expertise
can help our clients unlock the true potential of data, analytics, and AI
!

Apply Now

Send us your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your Power BI experience.

We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as applications will close once the position is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

  • A dynamic culture
    • Join an international consulting firm that values curiosity, collaboration, and a drive for excellence
  • Supportive environment
    • Thrive in a culture of trust, autonomy, and continuous learning, where your insights and creativity are highly valued
We look forward to hearing from you and exploring how your Power BI expertise
 can help our clients unlock the true potential of data, analytics, and AI
!

Apply Now

Send us your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your Power BI experience.

We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as applications will close once the position is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Football Statistician (Data Collection)
Place: Sønderborg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
JOIN OUR TEAM AT GENIUS SPORTS!




WHO ARE WE?




Genius Sports is the official data, technology, and commercial partner driving the connection between sports, betting, and media on a global scale. Our mission is to create a more sustainable sports data network powered by rich, official live data. To achieve this, we're seeking enthusiastic Statisticians to join our team and collect match data while attending live sporting events.




ARE YOU PASSIONATE ABOUT FOOTBALL?




If you love football and want to be part of the action while getting paid, this is your opportunity! We are looking for individuals in the Sønderborg Municipality, Region of Southern Denmark, area to collect official in-game statistics from football events in Superliga; 1st Division; 2nd Division, 3rd Division and the Danish Cup.




As a Statistician, you will use our user-friendly smartphone-enabled software to report live events, including every shot, goal, tackle, and save. Don’t worry if you lack previous reporting experience - we provide comprehensive e-learning courses and practical training to ensure you’re fully prepared to cover live games. This is the perfect chance for sports enthusiasts to earn extra income while doing something they love.




WHAT WE OFFER:

Guaranteed base pay of €70 per game
A performance-based reward system
Coverage of travel expenses

If you’re eager to immerse yourself in the world of sports and want to be part of our global network of statisticians, we want to hear from you!




JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Basic level in English
Regular availability for a few hours on weekends and weekday evenings
Familiarity with using a smartphone
Willingness to travel
A strong knowledge of football
Reliability, commitment, organization, and integrity
Exceptional attention to detail




GET TO KNOW US:

For more information about our mission and values, visit: Genius Sports




ARE YOU READY TO JOIN THE GENIUS SPORTS TEAM?

If you’re excited about this opportunity, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and become a vital part of our team!

Title: AI Engineer - Drive Innovation in a AI first company!
Description:
Fullstack AI Engineer | Pioneering AI and AI Agents!




What You’ll Do

We're a fast-moving team transforming financial operations and compliance using production-grade AI. This isn't a research lab, it's about building and shipping real tools that automate the hard stuff and make systems smarter, faster, and more reliable.




You will:

Build internal and external AI agents that automate workflows like invoice validation, reconciliation, KYC/AML checks, and compliance monitoring.
Use tools like GPT-4o, LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to create end-to-end automations.
Translate deep domain knowledge from finance and legal into prompt-driven tools, backend logic, and APIs.
Connect your work to our core platform using REST APIs, webhooks, and third-party integrations.
Work closely with product and compliance teams to identify high-value use cases and execute fast.
Document and test your automations to ensure they scale across multiple clients and jurisdictions.
(Optionally) Build user interfaces with Retool, Lovable, or React to expose agent functionality.




Who You Are

You have 2–4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
You’ve built real AI-powered systems, agents, automations, wrappers, or workflows that do something useful.
You're confident with Python or JavaScript/TypeScript, and experienced with REST APIs and database development.
You’ve used tools like LangChain, GPT/OpenAI, Claude, Supabase, or n8n, and ideally connected them into working systems.
You enjoy solving real problems, shipping fast, and iterating based on feedback.
You understand how systems interact — tools, prompts, logic, APIs, and data flows.
Bonus: experience with finance, compliance, ERP integrations, or process-heavy industries.




Why Join Us

Work on real-world AI use cases, not demos or sandbox projects.
Join a small, highly capable, and product-driven team.
Ship and own projects that impact large, operationally complex organizations.
Help define how AI is used in an industry begging for modernization.
Enjoy a remote-first culture, fast decision-making, and real ownership over your work.




Tech Stack You'll Touch

LLMs: GPT-4o, OpenAI Functions, Claude
Frameworks: LangChain, n8n, Supabase
Languages: Python, Node.js, TypeScript
Data & APIs: REST APIs (internal and external)
Frontend (optional): Retool, Lovable, React
Cloud: Multi-cloud (flexible based on context)




Compensation

Competitive salary tailored to your experience
Remote within Denmark
Autonomy and a flat structure
Pioneer AI and AI Agents internally!
Optional access to co-working space or office (e.g. Aarhus, Copenhagen)




Ready to build real AI systems that matter? Apply now and help us automate the future of financial operations!




Please reach out to the hiring manager if you have any questions:

Luqman Mohammed-Brown - +45 88 74 11 43 / L.Mohammed-brown@tenthrevolution.com

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
”Stop og se her en spændende mulighed for dig, der vil være med til at sikre, at PFA’s data warehouse fortsat fungerer optimalt og leverer værdiskabende data til kollegaer på tværs af organisationen. Du kan også se frem til at træde ind i et team med et kanon sammenhold, en moderne arbejdsplads og gode rammer”, siger Andreas Nierhaus, der er leder for ’Forretningsdata’ i PFA.

Du skal give stabilitet til PFA’s data backbone

Der er tale om en tidsbegrænset stilling på et år, hvor du bliver en del af teamet ’Forretningsdata’, der vedligeholder og videreudvikler PFA’s data warehouse. Vi leverer dagligt data, der understøtter arbejdet for mange kolleger og afdelinger i PFA. Derudover leverer vi også data til danske myndigheder og styrelser. Din indsats vil sikre, at vi får en endnu mere stabil dataplatform, som vil gøre det nemmere at udstille nye data til vores brugere. Hos os får du en spændende og varieret hverdag i et erfarent og agilt team med engagerede data engineers. Vi arbejder tæt sammen, giver plads til fordybelse i egne opgaver, samtidig med at sparring med dine kolleger aldrig er langt væk. En typisk dag begynder med, at du gennemgår nattens loads. Er der en fejl i vores kode, analyserer du fejlen, udvikler en løsning og sender en kode-pakke til implementering. Du har også dage, hvor du tilføjer nye data og funktioner til eksisterende løsninger, diskuterer nye løsninger med kolleger og interessenter og bidrager til at scope nye opgaver.

Dine nøgleopgaver er at:


vedligeholde og videreudvikle det eksisterende data warehouse
forbedre kvaliteten af vores løsninger ved tidligt at indgå i opgavedefinition og dialog med interessenter
sparre og samarbejde med teamet om data engineering opgaver.


Du har erfaring og kan kommunikere på flere niveauer

Vi har brug for dig, der:


er en erfaren data engineer, der har 100% styr på Microsofts’ warehouse verden og kan se dig selv sikre, at PFA’s dataleverancer kører stabilitet, optimalt og bliver tilpasset nye behov
har flere års erfaring med SQL og SSIS
har erfaring med optimering af eksisterende SSIS løsninger
kan kommunikere tekniske emner til ikke-tekniske interessenter
kan omsætte ikke-tekniske krav til tekniske løsninger.


De støttende rammer og kollegialt samarbejde er afgørende

Dit nye team er meget velfungerende. Vi har et godt sammenhold i teamet, og vi sætter pris på hinanden og hinandens færdigheder. Vores leder er lyttende og giver dig konkrete og tydelige svar. Og så får du den frihed, der er nødvendig for at kunne arbejde som ekspert i dit felt. Som kollega i PFA mærker du fra dag 1, at vi har fokus på godt kollegaskab, din udvikling, sundhed, trivsel og arbejdsglæde. Du kan se frem til gode arbejdsforhold – fx byder køkkenet på frokost til alle kostpræferencer, og du kan købe take away med hjem. Du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, ret til at gå ned på 80% arbejdstid og personalegoder med en solid lønpakke, arbejdsgiverbetalt pension og feriefrihed. Du kan også se frem til at arbejde i et flot og velfungerende domicil på Nordhavn i København, få meter fra Metroen og havnemiljøet. Socialt har vi mange tilbud som yoga, løbehold, fredagscafé og medarbejderklubber.

Du behøver ikke skrive en lang ansøgning – send bare dit CV

Du behøver ikke sende en ansøgning. Vedhæft blot dit CV og tilføj et par linjer i dit resumé om, hvorfor du er interesseret i jobbet. Hvis du har spørgsmål, er du selvfølgelig velkommen til at ringe til Andreas Nierhaus, der er leder af Forretningsdata i PFA, på tlf.: 24 80 17 41. Vi ser frem til at høre fra dig og senest den 31. august 2025.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.
Show more

Title: Consultant - McKinsey Digital
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a junior associate, you will join a client service team and take ownership of a workstream to solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting.

You will take on a role that goes beyond advising. You’ll be at the heart of the action—helping to uncover the true challenges behind a client’s strategy and creating actionable plans that drive real change. Working alongside clients and other McKinsey colleagues, you’ll combine research, analyzing data, interviews, and brainstorming to generate fresh insights and breakthrough solutions. Your commitment to our values will be crucial in earning our clients' trust and delivering results that matter.

As you collaborate directly with clients, you’ll help them solve problems, refine strategies, and implement transformations. By equipping them with the tools and knowledge to continue innovating and improving after we’ve left, you’ll ensure the impact of our work endures. In doing so, you’ll uphold McKinsey’s commitment to making a meaningful difference in the industries and communities we serve.

Read more about McKinsey Digital here.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus
Excellent organization capabilities, including the ability to initiate tasks independently and see them through to completion.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English and local office language(s), with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels.
Proficient in rational decision making based on data, facts, and logical reasoning.
Ability to create work product-focused materials / outputs, which may include PowerPoint decks, Excel models, articles, or other written deliverables.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Ability to work or attend meetings outside of traditional business hours or take on projects with limited or no notice at times.
Ability to travel to and work in varying environments that may be challenging and/or not accessible (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines).
Show more
