Title: Data Center Technician
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
As a Microsoft Data Center Technician (DCT), you will stage, set up and perform hardware deployments. In addition, you will also perform troubleshooting and diagnostics on equipment, as well as perform hardware decommissions for simple changes and refreshes following Standard Operating Procedures. This opportunity will allow you to deepen your understanding of Data Center standard processes and procedures, develop mentoring skills while providing guidance to peers, familiarizing yourself with security and data management procedures, and accelerate your career growth in the process.

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers training and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion training and events, and professional certifications.

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 Data Centers in 32 countries and millions of servers. Our foundation is built upon and managed by a team of subject matter experts working to support services for more than 1 billion customers and 20 million businesses in over 90 countries worldwide.

With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our data center design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Microsoft as a world-class cloud provider.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

Responsibilities


Performs diagnostics and troubleshooting following standard procedures, quickly identifies the cause(s) of issues, and replaces faulty components with minimal customer and business disruption.
Performs post-execution quality checks and verifies that grounding, staging, labeling, and cabling are set up properly according to safety protocols, deployment standards, and planned Network Design Tasks (NDTs).
Decommissions hardware for simple changes and refreshes (e.g., memory upgrades, rebuilds) following standard procedures with minimal guidance.
Follows procedures to communicate, report, and escalate incidents to appropriate Microsoft data center operations management units, Technician Leads, and engineering specialists.
Assists and provides guidance to other technicians to complete challenging or complex tasks.
Completes required training aligned to the role and workload; observes more experienced technicians to gain hands-on experience and relevant on-the-job training.
Contributes to a positive and effective team environment by sharing information with others, contributing to regular team meetings, asking questions, and staying apprised of the status of others' work.
Has pride and a sense of accountability for the service quality, completeness, and resulting user experience; displays accountability and ownership of the data center facilities.
Embodies our culture and values.


Qualifications

Required Qualifications:


High school diploma, GED, or equivalent and basic knowledge of computer hardware and components AND experience in supporting IT equipment or related technology.


Background Check Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:


Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:


relevant experience in supporting IT equipment or related technology.
Applicable certifications: CompTIA (A+, Server+, Network+), Basic Structure Cabling (BSC).


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.
Show more

As a Microsoft Data Center Technician (DCT), you will stage, set up and perform hardware deployments. In addition, you will also perform troubleshooting and diagnostics on equipment, as well as perform hardware decommissions for simple changes and refreshes following Standard Operating Procedures. This opportunity will allow you to deepen your understanding of Data Center standard processes and procedures, develop mentoring skills while providing guidance to peers, familiarizing yourself with security and data management procedures, and accelerate your career growth in the process.

Microsoft’s Cloud Operations & Innovation (CO+I) is the engine that powers our cloud services. As a CO+I DCT, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Microsoft's online services including Bing, Office 365, Xbox, OneDrive, and the Microsoft Azure platform. As a group, CO+I is focused on the personal and professional development of all employees and offers training and growth opportunities including Career Rotation Programs, Diversity & Inclusion training and events, and professional certifications.

Our infrastructure is comprised of a large global portfolio of more than 200 Data Centers in 32 countries and millions of servers.   • Decommissions hardware for simple changes and refreshes (e.g., memory upgrades, rebuilds) following standard procedures with minimal guidance.
  • Follows procedures to communicate, report, and escalate incidents to appropriate Microsoft data center operations management units, Technician Leads, and engineering specialists.
  • Assists and provides guidance to other technicians to complete challenging or complex tasks.
  • Completes required training aligned to the role and workload; observes more experienced technicians to gain hands-on experience and relevant on-the-job training.

  • Has pride and a sense of accountability for the service quality, completeness, and resulting user experience; displays accountability and ownership of the data center facilities.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

  • High school diploma, GED, or equivalent and basic knowledge of computer hardware and components AND experience in supporting IT equipment or related technology.

Background Check Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:

  • Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

While not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:

  • relevant experience in supporting IT equipment or related technology.
  • Applicable certifications: CompTIA (A+, Server+, Network+), Basic Structure Cabling (BSC).

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Junior Data Analyst & Scientist – Bliv bindeleddet mellem data og forretning
Description:
Er du vild med data og nysgerrig på, hvordan tal og analyser kan skabe værdi i en virksomhed? Har du lyst til at kickstarte din karriere i en rolle, hvor du får lov at prøve kræfter med både analyse, samarbejde og forretningsforståelse? Så har vi måske jobbet til dig!

Lige nu leder vi efter en Junior Data Analyst til vores Marketing-team – en rolle, hvor du får masser af ansvar, læring og mulighed for at udvikle dig i krydsfeltet mellem forskellige afdelinger og stakeholders.

Hvad går jobbet ud på?

Du bliver en del af vores Marketing Data Insights-team, hvor vi hjælper forretningen med at træffe de rigtige beslutninger baseret på data. Du får chancen for at arbejde tæt sammen med både Product Marketing, Digital Marketing og andre nøglefunktioner.

Vi leder ikke efter én med mange års erfaring – vi leder efter dig, der har mod på at lære og har lyst til at bruge dine tekniske evner i en mere kommerciel kontekst. Vi sørger for, at du får den oplæring og sparring, du har brug for, så du kan vokse i rollen.

Når du er kommet godt ind i jobbet, vil du bl.a. arbejde med:


Supplier Management & Analyse: Understøtte Product Marketing med værktøjer, statistik og KPI-overvågning for vores leverandører. Du sikrer, at vi har styr på leverandørpræstationer, bonusberegninger og kontraktstatus.



Kampagneanalyse & Digital Marketing:

Evaluere og analysere marketingkampagner og bidrage med optimeringsforslag. Opbygge dashboards og datarutiner, der sikrer transparens og forbedret beslutningsgrundlag.


Projektledelse: Drive og koordinere projekter på tværs af Marketing og øvrige afdelinger, herunder budgetarbejde, sortimentsvalg og systemintegrationer.
Data & Systemudvikling: Være med til at videreudvikle og vedligeholde vores dataprocesser.



Hvem er du?

Du behøver ikke have mange års erfaring – det vigtigste for os er, at du:


Har en relevant uddannelse inden for Data Science, Business Intelligence eller lignende
Har arbejdet med SQL, Python eller lignende programmeringssprog og har et ønske om at blive endnu dygtigere på området
Har erfaring med databaser og Cloud (Google Cloud, Power BI eller lign.)
Har superbrugerkompetencer i Excel
Evt har erfaring med analyse, dataflows og performance management – gerne i en kommerciel kontekst
Er flydende engelsk i skrift og tale



Og vigtigst af alt: Du har lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vi tør prøve nyt, hjælper hinanden og har det sjovt undervejs.

Hvad får du hos os?


En plads i en international virksomhed.
Mulighed for både faglig og personlig udvikling.
Fantastiske kolleger og en stærk social kultur.
Svanemærket kantine og god kaffe.
Sundheds- og tandforsikring, pension og personaleforening.



Læs mere om os her

Klar til at tage det første skridt?

Så send os dit CV inkl. en kort motiveret tekst, hvor du fortæller, hvorfor du vil arbejde hos os. Ansøgningsfristen er d. 18. august 2025.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Dennis Rømer Jensen, Head of Marketing Data Insights på telefon 23331102 eller e-mail dennis.jensen@lyreco.com. (ferie frem til 14. juli 2025.)

Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Hos Lyreco ønsker vi at fremme ligestilling og mangfoldighed. Vi opfordrer alle kvalificerede kandidater til at søge – uanset køn, alder, etnicitet, religion, seksuel orientering eller handicap.

Lokation Roskilde


Show more

Lokation Roskilde

Title: Student Assistant, Data and Analytics (Temporary Position)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a “get-things-done” type of person with an interest in Data and Pharma? Do you want to make a difference in a dynamic team environment? If so, this could be the perfect student job for you! We are looking for a hands-on and outcome-oriented student assistant to join our Data and Analytics Department.

Your new role

You will collaborate closely with Project Managers and cross-functional teams. Your tasks will vary based on needs and may include:


Supporting Project Portfolio planning to ensure smooth execution and resource management.
Coordinating with key stakeholders on project resources and planning.
Ensure team backlogs are up to date and in a healthy state.
Assisting in managing a support vendor agreement, ensuring good collaboration and work instructions are in place.



We expect additional tasks related to planning, execution, and organizing, so you need to have an agile mindset.

Your future team

You will join a diverse team that includes Data Engineers, BI Developers, Software Developers, Architects, and Project Managers. We collaborate on cross-functional projects and products, focusing on Data and Analytics platforms, solutions, and driving AI adoption across Lundbeck.

The position is based in Valby, Denmark.

The position is temporary from September 1st to December 31st.

What You Bring To The Team


Enrolled in a study either in the final year of the bachelor’s degree or master’s program, preferably in a relevant field such as engineering, computer science, or project management.
Experience in planning, cross-functional collaboration within an IT organization, agile processes, and JIRA is an advantage but not required.
A willingness to learn new skills and adapt to a fast-paced environment with changing tasks.
Interested in IT, Data and Analytics and Project Management.
Get things done personality.
Proactive, curious and a mindset that empowers you to venture beyond your comfort zone.
Ability to work between 15-20 hours a week on agreed fixed days.



Our promise to you

Lundbeck offers an inspiring workplace and innovative culture, where our curiosity, accountability and adaptability enable us to transform lives. We want to go faster and further on addressing the big unmet needs of people living with brain disorders. We offer rewarding careers with a mix of exciting tasks and development opportunities that are balanced with initiatives focused on your well-being.

We need every brain in the game, and at Lundbeck, we are committed to building a workforce that is as diverse as the people we serve. Read more about our commitment at www.lundbeck.com/global/about-us/our-commitment/diversity-and-inclusion.

Apply now

Can you see yourself in this role? We want to hear from you. Does this sound like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you meet all the requirements? We still want to hear from you!

Upload your CV and include a few lines about your motivation and reasons for applying. No separate cover letter is needed, and we ask you not to include a photo or personal information that does not relate to your professional experience.

If you have questions, please contact Andreas Lassen, Head of Development on adea@lundbeck.com.

Applications must be received by 15th August 2025. We will begin reviewing applications in early August and conduct interviews on a rolling basis.

Learn more about us at www.lundbeck.com, LinkedIn or Instagram (@h_lundbeck).

#EveryBrainInTheGame

This job ad is intended for individuals seeking a career opportunity with Lundbeck. We engage with recruitment and search firms where needed on the basis of a written agreement, and we do not accept unsolicited requests of any kind. If you work as a recruitment consultant, you are kindly instructed to refrain from contacting Lundbeck or the hiring manager directly with suggested candidates. If you violate this policy, you do so at your own risk and for your own account, and Lundbeck will not assume any liability nor pay any associated fees resulting from such violation.
Show more

Title: Studentermedhjælper til BI
Place: Kastrup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
🚀 𝐕𝐢𝐥 𝐝𝐮 𝐯æ𝐫𝐞 𝐦𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐢𝐥 𝐚𝐭 𝐝𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐚𝐝𝐫𝐞𝐯𝐧𝐞 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐢 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐬 𝐬𝐭ø𝐫𝐬𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐭ø𝐫 𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐤𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐤𝐭𝐢𝐯 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭?




GoCollective søger en 𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐀𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 til 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐧, der vil være med til at forme fremtidens datadrevne beslutningstagning.




𝐒𝐨𝐦 𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞𝐥 𝐚𝐟 𝐯𝐨𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐁𝐈-𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐢 𝐊𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐮𝐩 𝐟å𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐦𝐮𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐞𝐝 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐚𝐭:

- Udvikle og vedligeholde data-pipelines på AWS-platformen

- Skabe dashboards i AWS QuickSight

- Bidrage til AI-løsninger og ESG-rapportering

- Arbejde tæt sammen med forretningen og gøre en reel forskel




🎓 𝐕𝐢 𝐥𝐞𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐞𝐟𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐢𝐠, 𝐝𝐞𝐫:

- Studerer fx datalogi, matematik eller ingeniørvidenskab

- Har erfaring med SQL og/eller Python

- Brænder for data, analyse og forretningsudvikling

- Er proaktiv, nysgerrig og klar til at tage ansvar




🧠 𝐃𝐮 𝐟å𝐫:

- Praktisk erfaring med moderne BI og cloud-teknologier

- Fleksible arbejdstider, der passer til dit studie

- En vigtig rolle i en virksomhed i transformation

- Et stærkt team og et inspirerende arbejdsmiljø




📍 Arbejdssted: Skøjtevej 26, Kastrup




📅 Ansøgningsfrist: 22. august 2025 – men vi holder samtaler løbende!




👉 𝐋æ𝐬 𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐨𝐠 𝐚𝐧𝐬ø𝐠 𝐡𝐞𝐫: https://lnkd.in/dJgZWBxi




*Bemærk, at vi kun behandler ansøgninger, der kommer ind via linket.

Show more
HTML:
🚀 𝐕𝐢𝐥 𝐝𝐮 𝐯æ𝐫𝐞 𝐦𝐞𝐝 𝐭𝐢𝐥 𝐚𝐭 𝐝𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐞 𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐚𝐭𝐚𝐝𝐫𝐞𝐯𝐧𝐞 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐢 𝐃𝐚𝐧𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐬 𝐬𝐭ø𝐫𝐬𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐞 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐭ø𝐫 𝐢𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐧 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐤𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐤𝐭𝐢𝐯 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭?


GoCollective søger en 𝐒𝐭𝐮𝐝𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐀𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 til 𝐁𝐮𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐈𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐧, der vil være med til at forme fremtidens datadrevne beslutningstagning.


𝐒𝐨𝐦 𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞𝐥 𝐚𝐟 𝐯𝐨𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐁𝐈-𝐭𝐞𝐚𝐦 𝐢 𝐊𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐮𝐩 𝐟å𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐦𝐮𝐥𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐞𝐝 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐚𝐭:

- Udvikle og vedligeholde data-pipelines på AWS-platformen

- Skabe dashboards i AWS QuickSight

- Bidrage til AI-løsninger og ESG-rapportering

- Arbejde tæt sammen med forretningen og gøre en reel forskel


🎓 𝐕𝐢 𝐥𝐞𝐝𝐞𝐫 𝐞𝐟𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐢𝐠, 𝐝𝐞𝐫:

- Studerer fx datalogi, matematik eller ingeniørvidenskab

- Har erfaring med SQL og/eller Python

- Brænder for data, analyse og forretningsudvikling

- Er proaktiv, nysgerrig og klar til at tage ansvar


🧠 𝐃𝐮 𝐟å𝐫:

- Praktisk erfaring med moderne BI og cloud-teknologier

- Fleksible arbejdstider, der passer til dit studie

- En vigtig rolle i en virksomhed i transformation

- Et stærkt team og et inspirerende arbejdsmiljø


📍 Arbejdssted: Skøjtevej 26, Kastrup


📅 Ansøgningsfrist: 22. august 2025 – men vi holder samtaler løbende!


👉 𝐋æ𝐬 𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐞 𝐨𝐠 𝐚𝐧𝐬ø𝐠 𝐡𝐞𝐫: https://lnkd.in/dJgZWBxi


*Bemærk, at vi kun behandler ansøgninger, der kommer ind via linket.

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH – Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 København Ø

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton Pottegård (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europe’s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation – with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture – creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: Junior Fundamentals Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you prepared to explore the ever-changing landscape of global commodity prices, forecasts, and market intelligence? Expana is a leading independent provider of this data for the food, consumer packaged goods (CPG), and capital goods industries. We offer our data and insights through various cloud-based SaaS products, as well as APIs and Data Feeds.

Join us in contributing to our continued success!

The successful candidate will be a valuable member of the forecasting team and will update and develop analyses of market developments within a range of commodities, including metals, energy sources, plastics, and edibles.

As a student employee at Expana you will be able to schedule your working hours to a great extent. The working hours will be 15-20 per week. We expect a certain degree of flexibility near deadlines, but we will accommodate your requests in relation to your exams and schedule.

Responsibilities


Maintain fundamental analyses of commodities, which analyse supply, demand, inventory levels, cost driver developments and financial measures
Support the identification and development of additional analytical indicators
Analyse data from a wide range of sources including industry organizations, The Federal Reserve, Eurostat, Census Bureau, CFTC, BLS, and many more.


Skills & Requirements


Is a bachelor student or a 1st year master student at KU or CBS studying e.g. Economics, HA (almen), Finance or similar.
Possesses strong quantitative and analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Is fluent in English
Speaks Danish at an intermediate level or better
Works independently, professionally and in a well-structured manner
Is able to identify problems, to collect data, to establish facts, and draw valid conclusions
Enjoys repetitive tasks based on practical procedures and systems
Has an interest in econometric techniques
Has a solid knowledge of Excel


Our Core Values at Expana

At Expana, we take great pride in our core values, which guide our actions and shape our culture:

Brilliance: We strive for excellence in everything we do, pushing the boundaries of creativity and innovation to deliver outstanding results.

Connected: We believe in the power of collaboration and communication. By fostering strong relationships within our teams and with our partners, we create a supportive environment that drives success.

Make a Difference: We are committed to making a positive impact in our industry and community. Our actions reflect our dedication to sustainability, social responsibility, and delivering value to our stakeholders.

Other values such as trust, transparency, creativity, and ownership define our brand and company culture. These qualities are what we seek in our teams as well. Your unique communication style and optimistic vision will inspire harmony with colleagues, customers, and business partners. Your commitment to excellence and strong relationship skills are also valued. Positive energy and strategic skills are key to succeeding at Expana. We value both individual success and collaboration, seeking dynamic team players who think outside the box. Everyone's development is integral to our collective success, so we foster and support each person's strengths and talents.

In return for your hard work and dedication, we offer fantastic rewards. Please note that we operate with an agile working model, allowing for remote work and occasional travel to our offices.

It is important to mention that we use E-Verify with third-party suppliers in our hiring practices to ensure compliance with employment laws.

Title: Data & AI Strategy Consultant
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join Us as a Strategy Consultant – Data & AI

Empowering Innovation. Creating Real-World Impact. Together.

At Accenture Strategy & Consulting, we help our clients embrace the power of change driven by data, AI, and human ingenuity. We’re now looking for ambitious, purpose-driven Strategy Consultants to join our Data & AI team in Denmark.

Are you passionate about making data and AI work for people? Do you want to shape the future of businesses using cutting-edge technology with empathy, curiosity, and impact at the core? Then we’d love to meet you.

What You’ll Find at Accenture



An inclusive culture where women thrive; with active networks like FLOT (Female Leader of Tomorrow) and mentoring programs to help you grow your career.

Flexibility that works for your life; hybrid setups, family-friendly policies, and mental well-being support.

A strong development journey tailored to your aspirations; with a mentor, global knowledge, and upskilling programs at your fingertips.

Fun and connection; we believe work should energize you. Our local team prioritizes joy, and Accenture Club Denmark hosts everything from sports to food tastings.

Impactful projects; collaborate with the largest organizations in the Nordics on meaningful, sustainable, and tech-powered transformations.

Opportunities to give back through volunteering locally and globally.



Your Role in Our Mission

As part of our Nordic Data & AI practice, you’ll work with talented people from diverse backgrounds to help organizations grow in a digital-first world. You’ll be driving value with AI strategies, from concept to implementation, while ensuring businesses become more inclusive, agile, and future-ready.

In this role, you will:



Lead or co-lead workstreams in strategy development and product adoption, where Data and AI meet real business challenges.

Shape holistic and ethical Data & AI strategies, including Generative AI, that drive measurable value.

Translate complexity into clarity, designing operating models and architectures that work for people.

Apply storytelling and business acumen to co-create solutions and proposals with clients.

Help implement scalable AI platforms and change initiatives in collaboration with tech experts and business stakeholders.



You’ll be joining a supportive environment that values collaboration, learning, and diverse perspectives. We grow together, every day.

Meet Your Future Colleagues

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives, and we’re proud to work with people who bring their whole selves to work. Combining expertise, curiosity, and compassion.



Nikkimarie Glenn – Consultant, Data Science With an MSc in Mathematical Modelling and a strong track record in bridging the gap between AI technology and day-to-day business operations, Nikkimarie supports clients through both strategic advisory and hands-on implementation. She is passionate advocate for people leadership, she’s also an active member of Accenture’s Female Leadership Academy.

William – Manager, Data Science With an PhD in Robot Systems and a background in research, William helps public and healthcare organizations in Denmark and across Europe harness the power of AI. He’s committed to making data science accessible and actionable. When he’s not guiding clients, you’ll find him leading Accenture Denmark’s ski team with energy and team spirit on and off the slopes.

Elizabeth – Senior Manager, Data Strategy With an MSc in International Business and fluency in French, Elizabeth brings a global mindset to every challenge. She has led SAP and data architecture projects and is now a recognized expert in Master Data Management (MDM). A frequent speaker at events like Connected Women in AI, she’s passionate about building inclusive communities and driving real-world impact with data.



These are just a few of the inspiring individuals you’ll collaborate with and learn from as part of our team.

Who We’re Looking For

We’re not looking for “perfect” resumes—we’re looking for people who share our values and curiosity.

You may be a strong match if you:



Have 2–3 years of experience in data / AI strategy, digital consulting, or AI-driven innovation (from consulting, startups, or corporates).

Are comfortable navigating both business and tech topics—e.g., MDM, data platforms, AI/ML, etc.

Think in hypotheses, structure problems, and communicate clearly to different audiences.

Care about people, details, and the bigger picture.

Enjoy staying up to date on new tech trends, AI regulations, and emerging GenAI use cases.

Speak and write English and Danish or another Nordic language fluently.

Hold a relevant Master's degree in business, engineering, or science with strong academic results.



We welcome all types of talent. If you're passionate about the future of data and AI—and making that future inclusive and human-centered—we encourage you to apply.

Ready to Shape the Future With Us?

We’d love to hear from you. Apply online with your CV, university grades, and a short cover letter. Questions? Reach out to recruiting lead Annika Venäläinen at annika.venalainen@accenture.com

About Accenture

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy & Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 740,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries.

We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities.

🌐 accenture.com

💼 Accenture Nordics on LinkedIn

📺 Accenture Nordics on YouTube

  • Nikkimarie Glenn – Consultant, Data Science With an MSc in Mathematical Modelling and a strong track record in bridging the gap between AI technology and day-to-day business operations, Nikkimarie supports clients through both strategic advisory and hands-on implementation. She is passionate advocate for people leadership, she’s also an active member of Accenture’s Female Leadership Academy.
  • William – Manager, Data Science With an PhD in Robot Systems and a background in research, William helps public and healthcare organizations in Denmark and across Europe harness the power of AI. He’s committed to making data science accessible and actionable. When he’s not guiding clients, you’ll find him leading Accenture Denmark’s ski team with energy and team spirit on and off the slopes.
  • Elizabeth – Senior Manager, Data Strategy With an MSc in International Business and fluency in French, Elizabeth brings a global mindset to every challenge. She has led SAP and data architecture projects and is now a recognized expert in Master Data Management (MDM). A frequent speaker at events like Connected Women in AI, she’s passionate about building inclusive communities and driving real-world impact with data.


    • These are just a few of the inspiring individuals you’ll collaborate with and learn from as part of our team.

    Who We’re Looking For

    We’re not looking for “perfect” resumes—we’re looking for people who share our values and curiosity.

    You may be a strong match if you:


  • Have 2–3 years of experience in data / AI strategy, digital consulting, or AI-driven innovation (from consulting, startups, or corporates).
  • Are comfortable navigating both business and tech topics—e.g., MDM, data platforms, AI/ML, etc.
  • Think in hypotheses, structure problems, and communicate clearly to different audiences.
  • Care about people, details, and the bigger picture.
  • Enjoy staying up to date on new tech trends, AI regulations, and emerging GenAI use cases.
  • Speak and write English and Danish or another Nordic language fluently.
  • Hold a relevant Master's degree in business, engineering, or science with strong academic results.


    • We welcome all types of talent. If you're passionate about the future of data and AI—and making that future inclusive and human-centered—we encourage you to apply.

    Ready to Shape the Future With Us?

    We’d love to hear from you. Apply online with your CV, university grades, and a short cover letter. Questions? Reach out to recruiting lead Annika Venäläinen at annika.venalainen@accenture.com

    About Accenture

    Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy & Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 740,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries.

    We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners, and communities.

    🌐 accenture.com

    💼 Accenture Nordics on LinkedIn

    📺 Accenture Nordics on YouTube

Title: IT Technical Support Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Please note that we’re looking for a Freelancer, B2B or similar for this role.

This is us

At Avenga, we believe that human creativity empowers technology that matters. Operating globally, our 6000+ specialists provide a full spectrum of services, including business and tech advisory, enterprise solutions, CX, UX and Ul design, managed services, product development, and software development.

This is the job

As an IT Technical Support you’ll be working with technical issues both for hardware and software. Your daily tasks could involve moving equipment, supporting colleagues in for example software installation and troubleshooting but also configuration of end-users’ laptops/desktops. The role also includes support of PDAs onsite, basic network patching and connections of cables i.e. printers, monitors, PCs etc. You’re experienced in different information technology systems and are used to both analyzing and maintaining them.

Please note that we’re looking for a Freelancer, B2B or similar for this role. The client’s office is located in Copenhagen.

This is you

You’re experienced in working in similar roles and understand the broad spectrum that comes with the role. Hopefully you find it fulfilling to help people out when they experience difficulties with their computers, phones or other technical equipment. You should be comfortable working in English, spoken and written. Danish language knowledge is a plus.

Skills


Knowledge in Microsoft + Linux eco system
Basic knowledge of Active Directory and Exchange
Basic knowledge of SCCM
Basic knowledge of LAN/WAN architecture, TCP/IP, Firewall/VLAN configuration, NAT/Hardware-based load balancing, encryption and network security best practices
Knowledge of Internet network concepts, protocols and associated services (TCP/IP, HTTP, FTP, SCP, DNS)
Ability to prioritize assignments, handles shifting deadlines, multitasking and works independently as well as in a team environment
Ability to exercise good judgement, to independently assess risk, and to make critical decisions


What awaits you at Avenga?

Through our values, Better Minds, Bolder Ideas and Bigger Hearts, we strive to provide you with the tools, the autonomy, the trust, and assistance you need to excel. Enjoy benefits like private health insurance, well-being programs, flexible and hybrid work models, laptops and gear, trainings, language classes, social events, great offices, and more.

We take pride in the diverse skills and character of our teams, welcoming everyone to apply and contribute to our collective strength.

We process the applications on an ongoing basis, which could mean that the process ends before the final application date, so don't wait to apply.

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Job Requirements:




1. Good general understanding of IT principles such as Networks, Hardware and Domains.

2. Knowledge of Infrastructure (Data Center and Network) hardware architecture as to understand the procedure shared by L3 teams during troubleshooting, H&E support.

3. Knowledge of server/client operations in a domain environment including Active Directory.

4. Understanding of current and legacy hardware Infrastructure platforms.

5. Hands-on experience in installation and troubleshooting Infrastructure (DC & Network) equipment's, Rack and Stack of the equipment/cable.

6. Good Hands-on Experience in IMAC and Break-fix activities related to Infrastructure environment.

7. Ability to identify Excellent the right defective spares and replace them with provided good spares as instructed and by physical observations.

8. Knowledge of TCP/I P standards and networking.

9. Experience with Tape Management activities.

10. Excellent knowledge of best practices around management, control, and monitoring of server infrastructure.

11. Familiarity with backup and recovery software and methodologies.

12. Updating and Recording of activities in relevant IT Ticket Management System.

13. Coordinating and agreeing attendance time and date with key stakeholders.

14. Provide support either through phone, remote tools, or in person at onsite.

15. Perform installation as needed either through physical or network medium.

16. Coordinate actual activity date and timings including arrival and departure times.

17. Carry all necessary tools, laptops etc. which might be needed to support issues in the infrastructure environment.

18. Labelling, Patching and Asset Tagging activities.







Deployment / In-Scope Configuration Items




• Servers (Virtual & Physical)

• Storage & Backup Devices

• Server Appliances

• Hyper Converged Infrastructure (E.g. Nutanix, Cisco UCS)

• Tape Storage Units

• Power Distribution Units rated 3KVA and below

• SAN Fabric Switches

• Network Switches

• KVM Units

• WAN Optimization Devices

• Firewalls

• Access Points

• Routers

• Physical Cabling

• Cable Management

• Cables which connect the device to itself, a peripheral, or a power/network port







Break-fix / Technical Tasks List




• Power Cycling

• Running Diagnostics Commands

• Conducting whole unit replacement

• Inserting/Removing Media

• Replacing Defective Components

• Assist with fault diagnosis and investigation

• Configuring Remote Access

• Basic Storage Array Configuration

• Replacing faulty cables

• Tape Management and Maintenance

• Rebooting routers, servers, storage devices or other equipment

• Providing loop-back cables in order to test circuits remotely

• Re-seating or replacing components or cables

• Cleaning fibers

• Identify/Analyze fiber issues by using OTDR/LSPM/VFL

• Installing loop backs

• Racking and de-racking and upgrade of any device installed.

Title: Analysts for our KPMG Corporate Finance team (part-time)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for professional and skilled people to join our growing Corporate Finance practice in Copenhagen. The position is an opportunity to gain insights and perspectives in the life of Corporate Finance and the great culture in KPMG.




We can offer you ongoing development opportunities and high-profile engagements with significant responsibility from day one, a steep learning curve and early client exposure. We achieve our goals through our global platform and our international sector teams as well as our entire competencies and services within Corporate Finance. Our work environment is team oriented with a professional culture where we motivate each other every day to deliver professional services and quality work to our clients.




About KPMG Corporate Finance

Corporate Finance is a cornerstone of KPMG’s vision to become the clear choice within professional services in Denmark and support shareholders, senior executives and the Board of Directors with our capabilities and expertise within deal advisory. Our services comprise M&A advisory and Valuation services and we work closely together across service lines in Denmark and with our colleagues across KPMG’s global network with more than 2,500 Corporate Finance professionals in 80 countries.

We are a leading global mid-market M&A and Corporate Finance advisor globally, providing our services to shareholders, corporates, private equity funds, and executives on exciting M&A engagements.




The position

As an analyst your primary tasks will be:




Analysis of markets, sectors and companies
Assist on sell and buyside pitches, presentations and on-going engagements
Assist on valuation of companies
Assist on financial modelling projects
Other ad hoc analysis
Weekly workload will be about 15-20 hours with flexibility during exam periods




About you, our newest team member

We seek qualified and skilled people with the following qualifications:




You are on your last year of your bachelor’s degree or have just recently started your master’s degree in finance, economics or similar
Relevant academic background
Open-minded with a positive and 'can-do' mind-set
Professional analytical skills incl. experience with Excel and PowerPoint
Solid written and verbal communication skills
Fluency in English and Danish is a prerequisite




Apply now

We take candidates into the recruitment process continuously so please do not hesitate to apply. This job post will close when the right candidates are found.




We are interested in hearing from you, so please feel free to contact Mathias Madsen, Manager at +45 28 43 24 77 (mamadsen@kpmg.com) or Jacob Jespersen, Associate at +45 25 79 29 13 (jjespersen@kpmg.com) in case of any questions.




Please note, that we do not accept applications by e-mail to ensure GDPR compliance.




At KPMG, we are committed to developing diverse talent at all levels. We encourage all interested candidates to apply, regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, religion or ethnicity.




We look forward to welcoming you to KPMG!

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Marketing)
Description:
Company Description

COS offers a wardrobe of ready-to-wear and accessories rooted in exceptional quality and lasting design. The creative soul of the brand is fuelled by a deep connection to modern culture, dynamic global cities and compelling fashion movements. With an emphasis on expert craftsmanship, innovation and materiality, collections are created with a mindful approach, seamlessly blending contemporary and timeless.

Job Description

If you are passionate about data and eager to tackle some of the most existing data analytics use cases in the fashion retail industry, COS is the place for you!

We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst (Marketing) to join COS marketing analytics team within COS AI, analytics and data (aiad) function. In this role you will be responsible for driving marketing data analysis use cases such as personalizing customer experience, enhancing customer segmentation, campaign performance, advanced attribution analyses to optimize marketing spend across channels, and predicting future trends. This is a heavily analytical role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, marketing and business impact.

As senior data analyst within COS aiad, you will also work with various business function within COS from customer, marketing, sales, commercial, merchandizing, product, supply chain, sustainability, finance and beyond driving data-driven decision making. You will be responsible for identifying strategic challenges, conducting in-depth analysis and collaborating with stakeholders to turn data into actionable insights that support business objectives.

What you will do:


Proactively identify strategic challenges where decision support anchored in data is needed.
Drive data-driven decision-making within your initiative/product team by transforming data into insights and providing clear, data-driven recommendations.
Conduct advanced attribution analysis (e.g., MMM) to assess media effectiveness and enhance the marketing measurement framework.
Gather and validate multi-source data to ensure model accuracy, generate ROI-focused insights, and deliver clear, actionable reports and dashboards to key stakeholders across marketing teams.
Apply advanced analytics methods and tools to model, execute, and follow up on initiatives from idea to industrialization.
Manage the full analysis process, from problem and scope definition to data extraction, cleaning, analysis, visualization, creating recommendations, and presenting results.
Turn business challenges into structured data analyses. Define and set up measurable KPIs and OKRs, and maintain their visualization for value reporting.
Serve as the data analytics expert in cross-functional teams, collaborating with business stakeholders to solve business challenges using data analytics.
Address a broad variety of business challenges with a wide range of business stakeholders (customer, sales, marketing, merchandising, finance, etc.).
Participate in the wider analytics community, both within COS and the H&M Group.



Qualifications

Alignment to our company values is the most important characteristic we look for in all new joiners. Our values are the behaviours that we appreciate above and beyond anything else. We are open-minded and curious, we dare to be different, we believe in constant improvement and we empower and trust you to take ownership. Our values are part of who we are, what we stand for and how we act.

Someone who is passionate about learning and development, and wants to grow yourself and others. A positive attitude and a role model for our values are important qualities that you should possess.

What you need to succeed:


Extensive years of experience as a marketing analyst, data analyst, product/business analyst, or in digital advertising measurements.
Familiarity with experimentation, incrementality testing, digital media attribution, and media mix modeling.
Knowledge of digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics.
Understanding of digital media platforms and attribution, including Google Ads, Meta Ads, TikTok Ads, etc.
Familiarity with privacy-first innovations for measurement systems.
Strong business sense and interest, with the ability to make sound interpretations of data and other information.
Fluent in English with excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate and explain complex data analysis to non-technical and/or senior stakeholders.
Hands-on skills with Microsoft Excel functions such as Power Pivot, Power Query, Tabular Editor, DAX, etc. Experience with BI tools such as Power BI or Looker Studio to visualize and share big data.
Familiarity with SQL queries to extract, prepare, validate, and analyze large data sets. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R to extract and transform large datasets.
Experience working within cloud environments, such as Azure (Azure SQL Server) or GCP (BigQuery).
Collaborative and open-minded, enjoying working with others to solve problems.



Additional Information

This is a Full time permanent contract based at our Head Office in London.

Benefits

We offer all our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.

In addition to this office based colleagues also receive:


20 days holiday
Discounts on everyday brands and leisure activities
Retail Trust membership
Pension scheme
Discounted gym membership
Cycle to work scheme



Inclusion & Diversity

At COS we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people who share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, what we perceive as possible and how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world, therefore all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.  

In this role you will have some flexibility to work remotely however due to the high level of cross department collaborations approx. 3 days per week office presence is required to foster strong collaborations and team work.

Ready to apply? Click on the I’M INTERESTED link where you can upload your CV securely. Once we have received your application, we will keep you updated regularly about the status of your application so please look out for our email.

  • Collaborative and open-minded, enjoying working with others to solve problems.


Additional Information

This is a Full time permanent contract based at our Head Office in London.

  • Retail Trust membership

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst (Fully Remote)

We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst to play a key role in driving strategic insights and evolving our data environment. This fully remote position offers the opportunity to collaborate across departments, supporting both day-to-day operations and broader strategic initiatives—especially as we modernise systems and strengthen our reporting capabilities.

Our current data stack includes SQL Server and Power BI, with complex data models and pipelines. Projects will span business intelligence, data science, and advanced analytics. If you’re someone who can quickly get to grips with existing systems, understand data logic, and communicate insights clearly, this role could be a great fit.

Key Responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders to identify analytical needs and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Collaborate across teams to uncover growth opportunities and provide statistical and business analysis.
Design, develop, and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using SQL Server and Power BI.
Support the development of a modern data strategy, including system upgrades and migrations.
Help standardise metrics, documentation, and reporting logic across the organisation.

What You’ll Bring

Advanced SQL skills, with hands-on experience working in SQL Server environments.
Strong ownership mindset and a proactive, solutions-focused approach.
Proven experience designing and maintaining Power BI dashboards and data models.
Ability to work with complex datasets and apply business logic to analytical outputs.
Excellent communication skills—you can clearly explain data insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
Solid grounding in statistics, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modelling.
Bonus: Experience with ERP systems or large-scale data migrations.
Bonus: Background in e-commerce or service-oriented operations.

Show more

  • Design, develop, and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports using SQL Server and Power BI.
  • Support the development of a modern data strategy, including system upgrades and migrations.
  • Help standardise metrics, documentation, and reporting logic across the organisation.

What You’ll Bring

  • Advanced SQL skills, with hands-on experience working in SQL Server environments.
  • Strong ownership mindset and a proactive, solutions-focused approach.
  • Proven experience designing and maintaining Power BI dashboards and data models.
  • Ability to work with complex datasets and apply business logic to analytical outputs.
  • Excellent communication skills—you can clearly explain data insights to technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Solid grounding in statistics, exploratory data analysis, and predictive modelling.
  • Bonus: Experience with ERP systems or large-scale data migrations.
  • Bonus: Background in e-commerce or service-oriented operations.

The role will focus on analytics on an existing Azure based data platform, and will include data extraction, cleaning, analysis, and visualisation whilst using SQL SSIS/SSRS software. Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Junior Data Analyst

Location: London, UK (Hybrid)

Salary: £35k–£40k (DOE)




Are you a detail-driven analyst with a passion for data and automation? Join a specialist investment firm that partners with some of the most exciting high-growth software companies across Europe and the US. In this dynamic role, you’ll play a critical part in streamlining data-driven workflows and powering smarter investment decisions through innovative tech.




This is an exciting opportunity for an early-career analyst to join a growing Data & Research function that sits at the heart of the firm’s investment strategy. You'll be part of a high-impact team driving digital transformation and working with modern tools to improve processes, insights, and decision-making.




Your Responsibilities:

Build and enhance data pipelines: Help design and maintain proprietary automation systems that support investment strategy.
Improve internal platforms: Collaborate on projects to streamline workflows and eliminate manual processes using modern tooling.
Deliver high-quality insights: Monitor key data metrics and trends to support investment research and decision-making.
Ensure data integrity: Validate and enrich datasets to maintain accuracy, completeness, and consistency across internal platforms.
Evaluate tools and vendors: Assist in reviewing and optimising external data providers and technical solutions.
Contribute to innovation: Continuously explore opportunities to improve systems through experimentation, automation, and modern engineering practices.




Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in a STEM or data-oriented field such as Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Economics.
A meticulous attention to detail and passion for accurate, high-quality data.
Interest in data automation and how technology enables smarter decision-making.
Exposure to or willingness to learn tools like Python, SQL, Zapier, n8n, or similar.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while delivering at pace.
Strong communication skills to collaborate across teams and share insights clearly with non-technical stakeholders.
A curiosity-driven mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies and data tools.




It's A Bonus If You Have:

Experience with Google Cloud Platform, APIs, or GitHub.
Familiarity with structured data entry, validation processes, or workflow automation.
A genuine interest in private equity, venture capital, or financial technology.




The Benefits:

Join a mission-driven firm focused on supporting exceptional software companies.
Opportunity to work on impactful projects that shape investment outcomes.
Hybrid work model with a collaborative London-based team.
Mentorship and growth opportunities tailored to early-career talent.
Competitive salary and long-term progression within a growing data function.




If you're a motivated Junior Data Analyst eager to apply your skills in a fast-paced, tech-enabled environment, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and be part of a team turning data into competitive advantage.

Title: Excel Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Excel Data Analyst

Location: London (Hybrid – with global team collaboration)

Salary: up to £55,000 + Benefits




Are you an Excel power user with a knack for automation and process improvement?

We’re hiring a proactive and technically skilled Excel Data Analyst to join a growing team within a high-performing, globally-connected Insurance services organisation.




This is a fantastic opportunity to modernise internal tooling and play a hands-on role in streamlining processes across international teams. You’ll be a key player in evolving the way data is structured, analysed, and reported across the business.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Data Analysis & Reporting

Clean, structure and analyse data from diverse sources
Apply statistical techniques to derive insights
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences
Conduct regular data quality checks and support data governance practices




Tooling & Automation

Build and maintain advanced Excel-based tools
Use macros and VBA to automate manual workflows
Assist in integrating tools with databases and external systems
Support ongoing Power BI dashboard development




Project & Process Support

Coordinate small internal projects and user requirements
Assist in writing user stories, test cases, and acceptance criteria
Apply structured problem-solving (e.g. pyramid principle, hypothesis-led design)
Deliver user training and documentation for tools developed

Tech Stack & Tools:

Advanced Microsoft Excel (including Macros and VBA)
Power BI (desirable)
SQL/database integration (advantageous)
Familiarity with data lake or cloud-based tools is a bonus




Ideal Candidate:

Strong Excel skills – confident in macros, complex formulas, and VBA
A proactive problem-solver who enjoys driving process efficiencies
Excellent communicator, comfortable working across functions and regions
Organised, detail-oriented, and accountable for your own deliverables
Experience in financial services or insurance is a plus
Familiarity with Agile methodologies is helpful but not essential




What’s on Offer:

Competitive salary (£40–55K)
Hybrid working – 2 days onsite in a central London location
A collaborative and values-led team culture
Exposure to global teams in Europe, Asia, and North America
Opportunities to shape and improve internal tools and workflows
A socially responsible business supporting causes globally through dedicated CSR efforts




Ready to make an impact with your Excel and automation skills?

APPLY NOW!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Roundpeg is hiring a Data Analyst to support a leading LEAN consultancy that partners with organisations across healthcare and manufacturing, to solve operational problems. In this dynamic role, you will dive into data to help build tools and solutions that deliver clarity, insight, and agility. No two days are the same — you'll be balancing multiple complex projects and working at the intersection of data and decision-making.




About the Role




In this role, you will be responsible for various key tasks that contribute to the overall success of the consultancy, with a host of clients from car manufacturers and yacht builders to the NHS.




Responsibilities




Collect, process, and analyse complex datasets to uncover patterns and actionable insights
Build and maintain dashboards and reporting tools to visualise performance metrics
Collaborate with consultants and cross-functional teams to understand business problems and recommend data-driven solutions
Develop Excel and Power BI-based tools that can be deployed quickly in operational environments
Conduct data quality checks to ensure accuracy and consistency
Apply statistical methods to interpret data and identify trends or anomalies
Support market research, benchmarking, and competitive analysis where required







Qualifications




Advanced Excel expertise – confident in building, debugging, and optimising spreadsheet tools
Proficiency with data visualisation platforms, preferably Power BI or Tableau
Working knowledge of SQL, Power Query, or Python for data transformation and analysis
Prior experience in a data-focused role – consultancy or tool-building background preferred
Strong analytical thinking with the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects
Clear communicator – able to explain data findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Comfortable working independently as well as in a collaborative team
Experience with statistical methods or operational problem-solving in sectors such as healthcare or manufacturing
Experience of working for the NHS and or a manufacturing setting is strongly preferred

Title: Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations
Description:
OVERVIEW

Company description

Publicis Groupe is one of the world’s largest communications holding companies, present in over 110 countries and employing about 100,000 professionals.. The Groupe is positioned at every step of the value chain, from consulting to execution, combining marketing transformation and digital business transformation.

HELPING OUR CLIENTS UNLOCK GROWTH IN THE PLATFORM WORLD

Our clients compete in the platform world, a horizontal marketplace between creators and consumers, between speakers and listeners, between buyers and sellers. To thrive in the platform world, companies must continue to innovate their products and business models. Four imperatives (1. Real Identity, 2. Dynamic, Diverse and Disruptive Creativity 3., Smart Media and 4. Direct Relationships) via our suite of world-class agencies, are necessary for modern brands to win in the platform world. At Publicis Groupe, we’ve invested in capabilities across these four imperatives our clients need to unlock growth. As the only one who can architect, build and orchestrate end to end solutions, not only do we have a proven record of building bespoke models for clients and leading expertise across all major industry categories, we are able to offer our talents more opportunities to grow and benefit from a richer learning experience. We call this Power of One. Powered by a 100,000-strong network via Marcel, our AI-based platform, we are also able to provide our clients and talents instant access to resource, knowledge for any need, any time, in any market.

THE SPIRIT OF VIVA LA DIFFERENCE

Viva La Difference is deeply rooted in everything we do. It has always been in our DNA. From the birth of Publicis, 94 years ago, when Marcel Bleustein-Blanchet, our founder, invented French advertising. Viva La Difference expresses how we value and respect each individual and recognize what makes us distinctive. This is the charge that inspires our teams to celebrate the differences in identity, background, culture, and experience of all of us. It is how we behave with each other and our clients, and it is deeply rooted throughout our work, to elevate and bring to life our differences throughout the platform world.

Overview

At Publicis Groupe, we believe in the power of data to transform how brands connect with people. Our Data Solutions team leads a Groupe-wide initiative focused on delivering best-in-class reporting and data solutions for some of the world’s most iconic brands. We work hand-in-hand with client teams, analysts, and tech specialists to build scalable, intelligent reporting frameworks that drive insight and action.

We’re now looking for a Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations to join our growing team and help bridge the gap between business and tech. If you thrive at the intersection of analytics, systems thinking, and client service—this role is for you.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, Reporting & Operations, you’ll serve as the strategic link between client-facing teams and our technical developers—translating complex requirements into clear, deliverable solutions. Your focus will span data integrations, API connectors, reporting development, and dashboard functionality. Expect to lead projects end-to-end, working across teams to deliver smart, scalable, and elegant data solutions.

Client & Stakeholder Leadership


Be a trusted partner to internal client teams, ensuring expectations are met with clear timelines, technical support, and transparent communication
Lead regular check-ins to align on goals, capture feedback, and proactively surface new needs
Maintain a detailed understanding of project status and ensure best-in-class service delivery


Data Integration & Testing


Own the setup and maintenance of API connectors and automated reporting pipelines
Validate data quality, perform regression testing, and ensure KPI definitions match client narratives
Collaborate with technical teams to guarantee dashboard integrity and address any discrepancies


Reporting & Dashboard Development


Create dashboard wireframes, gather input from client teams, and translate into development-ready briefs
Oversee QA processes with Data Governance and the BI team
Coordinate testing, troubleshooting, and resolution of reporting issues
Safely manage data sharing with non-Publicis users in line with security standards


Qualifications

✔ Experience in a data, operations, or analytics-focused role

✔ Familiarity with BI and reporting platforms such as Power BI, Datorama, Data Studio, Databricks, SQL

✔ Strong communication skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

✔ An organised, proactive approach—comfortable working across teams and timelines

✔ Excitement for new technology, data storytelling, and digital marketing innovation

✔ A team player who’s passionate about making data work harder, smarter, and more creatively

Benefits:

Additional information

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:


WORK YOUR WORLD opportunity to work anywhere in the world, where there is a Publicis office, for up to 6 weeks a year.
REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.
HELP@HAND BENEFITS 24/7 helpline to support you on a personal and professional level. Access to remote GPs, mental health support and CBT. Wellbeing content and lifestyle coaching.
FAMILY FRIENDLY POLICIES We provide 26 weeks of full pay for the following family milestones: Maternity. Adoption, Surrogacy and Shared Parental Leave.
FLEXIBLE WORKING, BANK HOLIDAY SWAP & BIRTHDAY DAY OFF You are entitled to an additional day off for your birthday, from your first day of employment.
GREAT LOCAL DISCOUNTS This includes membership discounts with Soho Friends, local restaurants and retailers in Westfield White City and Television Centre.


Publicis Groupe operates a hybrid working pattern with full time employees being office-based three days during the working week.

We are supportive of all candidates and are committed to providing a fair assessment process. If you have any circumstances (such as neurodiversity, physical or mental impairments or a medical condition) that may affect your assessment, please inform your Talent Acquisition Partner. We will discuss possible adjustments to ensure fairness. Rest assured, disclosing this information will not impact your treatment in our process.

Please make sure you check out the Publicis Career Page which showcases our Inclusive Benefits and our EAG’s (Employee Action Groups).

✔ Strong communication skills and a collaborative, solutions-focused mindset

✔ An organised, proactive approach—comfortable working across teams and timelines

✔ Excitement for new technology, data storytelling, and digital marketing innovation

✔ A team player who’s passionate about making data work harder, smarter, and more creatively

Benefits:

In The UK, Alongside The Core Benefits Such As Pension, Life Assurance, Private Medical, And Income Protection Plan, We Also Offer:

  • REFLECTION DAYS - Two additional days of paid leave to step away from your usual day-to-day work and create time to focus on your well-being and self-care.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of motor insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we’ve been using our love of data and tech to rethink motor insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we’ve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we’re trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we’re expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Analyst to join our Online Sales Team.

This team serves both our business and our customers.

As part of this team, you’ll optimise our online products, making sure they meet user needs and convert. You’ll also help strengthen our relationship with third party partners, such as price comparison websites, so we can better connect with our audience and turn more clicks into sales.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You'll Do


Analyse data from various business areas, including online conversion, operational efficiency, trading reports and strategic projects.
Identify improvement opportunities and support data-driven decision making in collaboration with teams like Pricing, Underwriting, Product & Engineering, UX, Customer Care and Claims.
Design and maintain dashboards in Tableau to monitor performance of the metrics that matter, as well as impact of initiatives to enable deeper analysis.
Participate in the integration and automation of data exchange between local and global teams.
Collaborate with other Data Analysts and Data Scientists to share best practices and strengthen Prima’s data-driven culture.
Support and lead key business initiatives, including the launch of new channels and propositions.
Manage successful relationships with 3rd party commercial partners.


What We're Looking For


A minimum of 2–3 years of professional experience is required in data analytics, management consulting, or other roles that are analytically driven.
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative or analytical field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, or Economics.
A solid understanding of business in regulated industries
Excellent analytical mindset and problem solving skills
A keenness and confidence in stakeholder management, both internally and externally.


Nice to Have


Proficiency with SQL, Python, Excel & Tableau
Experience with cloud data platforms (e.g., Databricks)
Understanding of or interest in UK Motor Insurance


Why You’ll Love It Here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

🤸Work Your Way: Enjoy hybrid working, with a mix of home and office days. Plus, for up to 30 days per year, work from anywhere.

🏁 Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

🌈 Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you’re a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.
Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let’s build the future of insurance, together.
